{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"B2C Marketing Automation and 5 Top Software Tools to Power It","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/b2c-marketing-automation-software","description":"<p>Any B2C marketer can attest to the <em>total</em> relief that comes right after setting up successful email automation. To know that your customers will receive personalized emails without you having to manually write each and every one … whew, that’s powerful stuff.</p>  \n<p>Did you know that segmented (a.k.a. personalized) email campaigns can drive a <a href=\"https://www.campaignmonitor.com/resources/guides/email-marketing-new-rules/\">700+% increase in revenue</a>? And that’s just email.</p> \n<p>From text reminders to cart abandonment emails to multi-channel campaigns that span social media and in-app messaging, B2C marketing automation marries the power of personalized messaging and hands-off marketing. It simultaneously saves time (and money) while <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-delight\">delighting your customers</a> wherever they are.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>What is marketing automation?</h2> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-automation\">Marketing automation</a> refers to any marketing efforts, campaigns, and tasks that are managed, executed, and measured with software versus manually. These efforts and campaigns are typically triggered by actions taken by leads or customers.</p> \n<p>Marketing automation has many benefits. It can help save your resources, nurture your leads, and increase your revenue — all at once and with minimal manual effort. Amazing, right?</p> \n<p>It’s important to note, however, that marketing automation shouldn’t replace human touch. This is especially true for B2C — unlike B2B, the B2C sales cycle is much shorter and the customer journey much more personalized.</p> \n<h2>What is B2C marketing automation?</h2> \n<p>B2C marketing automation encompasses any automated marketing messages and campaigns targeted to individual consumers versus business audiences. This type of marketing automation must be much more personalized and data-driven to best appeal to the individual in his or her specific customer journey.</p> \n<p>Both B2C and B2C marketing automation work to send relevant messages, increase efficiency, and drive revenue, but let’s further unpack their differences.</p> \n<h3>B2B vs. B2C Marketing Automation</h3> \n<p><strong>B2B marketing automation</strong> delivers more mass-oriented content that’s focused on educating and nurturing leads through a pre-established sales funnel. Since there are typically more stakeholders involved in B2B purchases, B2B marketing automation also works to provide action-triggered information that can help <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/identify-sales-prospects-influencers-decision-makers-ht\">influencers educate their decision-makers</a>.</p> \n<p>Let’s say a junior social media strategist is searching for a new social media management software for their entire team. They download an ebook on social media strategy from a prominent SaaS company, thus prompting the company’s B2B marketing automation software to send them nurturing emails about building a social media strategy and how to use its tool to do so.</p> \n<p>The junior strategist is now equipped to bring this information to his or her director, who will make the final decision about which social media SaaS tool to purchase.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Copy%20of%20LinkedIn%20-%20Graph%20-%201104%20x%20736.png?width=600&amp;name=Copy%20of%20LinkedIn%20-%20Graph%20-%201104%20x%20736.png\" alt=\"b2c marketing automation\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p>On the other hand, <strong>B2C marketing automation</strong> typically focuses on highly relevant and personalized marketing messages. B2C marketing automation also targets individuals wherever they are in their individual customer journeys and attempts to deliver customized product or service recommendations based on action triggers and captured data.</p> \n<p>For example, one type of B2C marketing automation is <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/ecommerce/shopping-cart-abandonment-reasons-solutions\">cart abandonment email</a>. By tracking shopper behavior and capturing personal information like email addresses, B2C companies set up a marketing automation “rule” to send an email to consumers who leave un-purchased products in their shopping carts.</p> \n<p>Typically, abandoned cart emails include the specific products left behind — a dose of personalization that may motivate shoppers to return to the website and complete their individual purchase.</p> \n<h3>Benefits of B2C Marketing Automation</h3> \n<p>Marketing automation sure has its perks — for both marketers and their audiences. These <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-automation-benefits\">marketing automation benefits</a> include:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Keeping your brand top-of-mind with potential customers</li> \n <li>Allowing your team to send personalized, targeted messages without having to manually track users and repeatedly write content</li> \n <li>Increasing efficiency amongst your marketing team</li> \n <li>Closing the gaps in your marketing analysis by removing human error</li> \n <li>Tracking user data that can be used to better serve up personalized product or service suggestions</li> \n <li>Delighting site visitors, leads, and customers with customized content</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Now, let’s discuss some B2C marketing automation tools software tools that can help you reach, engage, and convert your shoppers and customers.</p> \n<p>There are countless marketing automation tools on the market. According to our research, the following five are a great fit for B2C marketing automation.</p> \n<p>However, when comparing what tool may meet your B2C marketing automation needs, consider 1) how complex each tool is and what onboarding resources are offered, 2) what integrations each tool offers and how they may fit into your current tech stack, and 3) how each tool is priced and how much your marketing automation needs may cost.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing\">HubSpot Marketing Hub</a></h3> \n<p><em><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image2-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-25-AM.png?width=600&amp;name=image2-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-25-AM.png\" alt=\"b2c marketing automation software hubspot\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></em></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/professional\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>Built on the foundation of the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm\">free HubSpot CRM</a>, HubSpot Marketing Hub holds a wealth of B2C marketing automation tools that allow you to use your lead’s behavior to personalize emails, content, and outreach at scale. From email to SMS, and even internal automations like lead scoring and CRM updates, HubSpot is easy to get accustomed to and can quickly become your team’s <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/marketing-automation\">marketing automation</a> best friend.</p> \n<p><strong>Onboarding support</strong>: HubSpot’s award-winning customer support is available 24/7 through email and chat, as well as over the phone for Professional and Enterprise subscribers. You can also access a <a href=\"https://help.hubspot.com/\">knowledge base</a> and various <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/hubspot-marketing-software\">HubSpot Academy</a> courses.</p> \n<p><strong>Integrations</strong>: HubSpot Marketing Hub integrates with over <a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps\">500 third-party applications</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: HubSpot Marketing Hub offers a Free plan as well as multiple subscription options. Note that the marketing automation features are only available for paid subscribers.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/\">Mailchimp</a></h3> \n<p><em><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image1-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-41-AM.png?width=600&amp;name=image1-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-41-AM.png\" alt=\"b2c marketing automation software mailchimp\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></em></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://martechtoday.com/release-notes-mailchimp-launches-customer-journeys-242888\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>Mailchimp is an industry leader in <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/automations/\">email marketing automation</a>. Use the Mailchimp tool to deliver transactional emails, such as order confirmation emails and other personalized messages. The tool also allows you to build <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/features/automations/customer-journey-builder/\">visual customer journeys</a> so you can provide the best possible experience to each customer — or convert your leads and prospects into one.</p> \n<p><strong>Onboarding support</strong>: Mailchimp has a large library of resources, including guides, tutorials, and case studies. Free users get 30 days of email support, and paid subscribers get unlimited email and chat support.</p> \n<p><strong>Integrations</strong>: Mailchimp integrates with over <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/integrations/\">200 third-party applications</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Mailchimp offers a Free subscription, but the more in-depth marketing automation tools aren’t available unless you invest in the Essentials subscription or higher.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"http://activecampaign.com\">ActiveCampaign</a></h3> \n<p><em><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image5-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-04-AM.png?width=600&amp;name=image5-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-04-AM.png\" alt=\"b2c marketing automation software activecampaign\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></em></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"http://www.activecampaign.com\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>ActiveCampaign is a renowned marketing automation software and was the first to develop the visual automation workflow builder. (You know, the one with the boxes and labels and lines going everywhere — like the one above.) In addition to email, it offers site tracking, lead scoring, attribution, and more.</p> \n<p><strong>Onboarding support</strong>: ActiveCampaign offers a free demo and a whole slew of resources, such as a blog, developer documentation, and a library of pre-written automations. All subscriptions include data migration and implementation services, and more expensive subscriptions include limited one-on-one training.</p> \n<p><strong>Integrations</strong>: ActiveCampaign integrates with over <a href=\"https://www.activecampaign.com/apps/\">300 third-party applications</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: ActiveCampaign offers a free trial. From there, you can pay for a Lite subscription at $9 per month or more.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.autopilothq.com/\">AutoPilot</a></h3> \n<p><em><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image3-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-42-AM.jpg?width=600&amp;name=image3-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-42-AM.jpg\" alt=\"b2c marketing automation software autopilot\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></em></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 13px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"http://www.martechtoday.com\">Source</a></em></p> \n<p>AutoPilot, like others on this list, offers a visual automation workflow builder … but with a twist. It sets itself apart with emojis, stickers, custom notes, and other details that help your team collaborate and, well, have fun building your marketing automation sequences. Although the tool doesn’t offer its own built-in CRM, it is fairly intuitive, easy to use, and offers fantastic reporting features.</p> \n<p><strong>Onboarding support</strong>: All AutoPilot subscriptions include unlimited emails and access to support. You can purchase an Expert Setup and Training add-on for $1699.</p> \n<p><strong>Integrations</strong>: AutoPilot integrates with <a href=\"https://www.autopilothq.com/integrations\">dozens of third-party applications</a>.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: AutoPilot offers a free trial, after which you can join at as little as $49 per month.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://www.omnisend.com/\">Omnisend</a></h3> \n<p><em><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image4-3.jpg?width=600&amp;name=image4-3.jpg\" alt=\"b2c marketing automation software omnisend\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></em></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"http://omnisend.com\"><span style=\"font-size: 13px;\">Source</span></a></em></p> \n<p>Omnisend is a leading marketing automation tool specifically tailored for e-commerce businesses. Not only does it offer dozens of pre-written templates for all e-com automation scenarios, but it also integrates with nearly every possible e-commerce-related tool, including both email and SMS automation software.</p> \n<p><strong>Onboarding support</strong>: Omnisend offers a library of resources, including an onboarding course. Unfortunately, live support is only offered to paying subscribers.</p> \n<p><strong>Integrations</strong>: Omnisend integrates with <a href=\"https://partnerpage.omnisend.com/integrations\">hundreds of third-party applications</a>, although most aren’t available with the Free plan.</p> \n<p><strong>Pricing</strong>: Omnisend does offer a Free subscription option, although most automation features aren’t available unless you’re paying.</p> \n<p>These five tools are among the most powerful for B2C marketing automation efforts. Whether you’re sending time-triggered birthday emails or following up with prospective customers with automated SMS messages, try these B2C marketing automation software tools to reach, engage, and convert your customers.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img Decker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Copy%20of%20LinkedIn%20-%20Graph%20-%201104%20x%20736.png?width=600&name=Copy%20of%20LinkedIn%20-%20Graph%20-%201104%20x%20736.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-13-346_b4b90e9d52c01e7e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image2-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-25-AM.png?width=600&name=image2-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-25-AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn79@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-13-975_a0754e6bab244a02.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image1-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-41-AM.png?width=600&name=image1-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-41-AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn45@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-11-226_f782e19cd06297de.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image5-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-04-AM.png?width=600&name=image5-Oct-07-2020-03-09-17-04-AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn21@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-57-482_219161e4752288b9.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image3-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-42-AM.jpg?width=600&name=image3-Oct-07-2020-03-09-15-42-AM.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn61@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-13-770_ea6ec9ed29e0f4cb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/image4-3.jpg?width=600&name=image4-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn86@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-53-54-034_faaa662a5dac0045.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fb2c-marketing-automation-software&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn81@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-53-901_85794ba508ff4af2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624893},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"7 of the Best Promotional Product Videos Ever","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-product-videos-list","description":"<p>One of the wisest things I've ever read about product marketing came from the writer of a children's book.</p>  \n<p>\"If you want to build a ship, don't drum up people to collect wood and don't assign them tasks and work, teach them to long for the endless immensity of the sea,\" said Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, creator of <em>The Little Prince.</em></p> \n<p>The goal in crafting a perfect product video is not far off. If you want your video to resonate, it should be about <em>more than</em> just the product. It should be about the problem, the solution, the experience, and the larger vision of what you're trying to build.</p> \n<p>Considering the right video can put a product on the map for the first time or reinvigorate a company that has long been stale, it's important that marketers have a strong grasp on this. So to inspire your own efforts, we've collected a list of impressive product videos for marketing a product or new release.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>What is a product video?</h2> \n<h3>Product Videos Defined</h3> \n<p>A product video is one that explains and visually exhibits a product's tangible benefits. A lot of product videos tend to emphasize a product's unique features, but one chief thing that truly differentiates a good product video is its ability to exhibit how it solves problems.</p> \n<p>What Makes a Good Product Video?</p> \n<p>As a rule, remarkable product videos encompass the following:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Engaging dialogue and narration</li> \n <li>Long enough to fully explain the product and its benefits, but short enough to keep the viewer's attention</li> \n <li>Professionalism, without being \"stuffy\"</li> \n <li>Empathy and relatability</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Want to see how these elements are put into action? Check out the examples below.</p> \n<h2>7 Promotional Product Videos That Make You Want to Buy</h2> \n<h3>1) Blendtec: Will it Blend?</h3> \n<p>I'm digging into the archives for this one, but in the world of videos that add life to a product, few have done it better than Blendtec. The company's CEO, Tom Dickson, became a YouTube icon back in 2006 with the introduction of his <em>Will it Blend?</em> series.</p> \n<p>Since then, Blendtec has expanded the tremendous success of these videos to other channels, enabling viewers to <a href=\"http://www.youtube.com/user/Blendtec\">suggest things to blend on Facebook</a>. The company even has its own <a href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Will_It_Blend%3F\">Wikipedia page</a> dedicated to the series.</p> \n<p>The success of this video comes down to two things: a clear, unwavering message and a company with a personality. In seven years, the series has never changed. The point of each video and the underpinning of the product positioning is essentially, \"Why yes, it will blend.\"</p> \n<p>For years, we've been watching this product blend everything from <a href=\"http://www.willitblend.com/videos/view/41\">glow sticks</a> to an <a href=\"http://www.willitblend.com/videos/view/129\">iPhone</a>. The videos are minimally expensive, product-focused, and garner millions of views. In a <a href=\"http://features.slashdot.org/story/13/03/13/161200/interviews-blendtec-founder-tom-dickson-answers-your-questions\">recent interview</a>, Dickson explained the history and success of the video series:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>\"'Will it Blend?' was developed accidentally by a new marketing director hired in 2006. I have always been one to try to break my blenders to find their fail points and determine how I can improve them. George, the new marketing director, discovered some of the wacky things I was doing to my blenders ... With a $50 budget, George bought a Happy Meal, a rotisserie chicken, Coke cans, golf balls, and a few other items, and they made five videos. Six days later, we had six million views on YouTube. Six years, 120-plus videos, almost 200 million views later, 'Will it Blend?' has been named as <a href=\"http://adage.com/article/the-viral-video-chart/digital-marketing-top-10-viral-ads-time/145673/\">the number one viral marketing campaign of all time</a> [by Ad Age].\"</em></p> \n<p>Here's Tom blending a Facebook request: Justin Bieber. The video earned 2.8 million views (and counting) on YouTube.</p> \n<div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed hs-responsive-embed-undefined\">\n  <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; margin: 0px auto;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/I7TK_8RiVj8?rel=0\" width=\"667\" height=\"375\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n </div> \n</div> \n<h3>2) Dollar Shave Club: Our Blades are Great</h3> \n<p>Dollar Shave Club also made waves with their first product video. I'll warn you now: they're not shy with the F-bombs or referring to \"your handsome-ass grandfather,\" so you may want to throw in the headphones before pressing play. Having said that, what's singular about this product launch video is how well the company knows its audience and the problem it's trying to solve.</p> \n<p>Dollar Shave Club was trying to crack into a demographic of young, professional men who habitually purchase big-brand razors at local stores. The problem they attempt to highlight is the absurdly high cost of store-bought razor cartridges. Thus, the company needed an absurdist, well-targeted product launch video to match.</p> \n<p>CEO Michael Dubin, who studied improv with the Upright Citizens Brigade, wrote the spot himself and hired a comedian friend, Lucia Aniello, to produce the video. According to <a href=\"http://www.quora.com/Dollar-Shave-Club/Who-created-the-video-script-etc-for-Dollar-Shave-Clubs-video\">reports on Quora</a>, the video cost approximately $4,500 -- and yet, it got more than 11 million views and coverage on countless media outlets.</p> \n<div> \n <div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n  <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed hs-responsive-embed-undefined\">\n   <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; margin: 0px auto;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/ZUG9qYTJMsI?rel=0\" width=\"667\" height=\"375\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n  </div> \n </div> \n <h3>3) Purple Feather: The Power of Words</h3> \n <p>In tight marketing budgets, professional copywriting services are often the first to be cut. Instead of hiring professional copywriters, companies opt to take on the writing themselves, figuring it's not all that different from other writing they do. They assume the words they choose won't make much of a difference one way or the other. Based in Glasgow, Purple Feather is a copywriting agency that set out to prove that assumption wrong.</p> \n <p>Words matter. In fact, they can change everything. Purple Feather made that point exceptionally clear in this powerful video:</p> \n <div> \n  <div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n   <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n    <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.22%; margin: 0;\">\n     <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe hs-fullwidth-embed\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/Hzgzim5m7oU\" width=\"667\" height=\"375\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n    </div> \n   </div> \n  </div> \n  <div> \n   <h3>4) Google Chrome: Jess Time</h3> \n   <p>The best product videos focus not on the product itself, but on the stories of the people who use it.</p> \n   <p>Technology writer and NYU Professor <a href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clay_Shirky\">Clay Shirky</a> has a great chapter in <a href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Here_Comes_Everybody\">his first book</a> about the pervasiveness of communications tools in our lives. In it, he explains that technology doesn't truly get interesting until it becomes so ingrained in our lives that it turns invisible.</p> \n   <p>No product video shows this \"invisibility\" of really good products better than Google's \"Loretta\" Super Bowl commercial, which tells the story of a man reminiscing about the love of his life with help from Google.&nbsp;</p> \n   <p>The video below demonstrates how seamlessly Google and all of its products have melded into our lives and become a part of how we interact. It's a video about an&nbsp;experience, not software, and that is arguably what the company truly creates.</p> \n   <div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n    <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n     <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n      <iframe width=\"560\" height=\"315\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/6xSxXiHwMrg\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n     </div>\n    </div>\n   </div> \n   <h3>5) Apple: The Only Thing That's Changed</h3> \n   <p class=\"p1\">Launch videos like the Dollar Shave Club video above have a bit of an advantage when it comes to resonating with an audience. They represent a brand new company, product, or idea. But what if your company has been around for a long time? What if the announcement you're making is really more of a set of enhancements to an existing product than a brand new launch?</p> \n   <p class=\"p1\">This year, Apple tackled that challenge head-on with the following video. This video takes a collection of seemingly small enhancements and strings them together in a way that underscores just how advanced the total new functionality is. Take a look:</p>  \n   <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n    <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.07%; margin: 0;\">\n     <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe hs-fullwidth-embed\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/nUrkQxyOTKg\" width=\"560\" height=\"314\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n    </div> \n   </div>  \n   <h3>6) Google: Google, Evolved</h3> \n   <p>This year Google introduced a new logo for the company and a new parent company, Alphabet. It was the perfect moment for retrospection. So the company took to video to show not only how much Google's products have evolved, but how much progress those products have enabled in the world around them.</p> \n   <p>The brilliance of this video is that it uses others to tell the story. Whereas some companies may have pointed the camera at their own designers and developers (looking at you, Apple), Google put the focus on the users, media, and cultural leaders that have adopted and promoted the products along the way. The resulting video plays more like a historical chapter than a commercial.</p> \n   <p>&nbsp;</p> \n   <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 667px; max-height: 375px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n    <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.22%; margin: 0;\">\n     <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/olFEpeMwgHk\" width=\"667\" height=\"375\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n    </div> \n   </div> \n   <p>&nbsp;</p> \n   <h3>7) InVision: Design Disruptors</h3> \n   <p>I want to end this list with a bit of an anomaly, because it pushes at the boundaries of what can be considered a product video and, as such, opens up all sorts of opportunities.</p> \n   <p>InVision, a prototyping, collaboration, and workflow platform wants to empower designers -- their primary users. Much of their content strategy is bent on this mission. This year, InVision will launch a documentary on the role of design in the modern business.</p> \n   <p><em>Design Disruptors</em> looks at how 15 top businesses prioritize design in their products and overall user experience. Unlike traditional product videos, <em>Design Disruptors</em> will run in theaters and on Netflix. And unlike traditional product videos, <em>Design Disruptors</em> never actually promotes the product. The goal is bigger than the product.</p> \n   <p>\"We're trying to bring attention to the increased importance of design in a company's success,\" <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/design-disruptors\">explains David Malpass</a>, InVision's vice president of marketing. \"A lot of our work is based on doing things that'll create a positive effect on the design community and that will elevate the role of the designer within their organization.\"</p> \n   <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 640px; max-height: 360px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n    <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\">\n     <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/W4AViRgrgkU\" width=\"640\" height=\"360\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n    </div> \n   </div> \n   <p>Want more tips on creating visual content? Check out this list of the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/gif-websites\">best websites for finding GIFs</a>.</p> \n   <p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in October 2017 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n   <p></p> \n   <p></p> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-product-videos-list&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 20 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"20591f1e9166af89c24ae6ff064eac7e","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"manderson@hubspot.com (Meghan Keaney Anderson)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-product-videos-list&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn89@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-02-253_210912a3e500aa75.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624904},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"Recruiters Reveal the 7 Best Fonts for Your Resume in 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-font-resume","description":"<p>Studies have shown recruiters typically scan a resume for only <a href=\"https://cdn.theladders.net/static/images/basicSite/pdfs/TheLadders-EyeTracking-StudyC2.pdf\">about six seconds</a><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\"> before making a decision on whether an applicant is fit for a role.</span></p> \n<p>With only six seconds to demonstrate your qualifications for a position, every detail counts. To evoke a sense of style, professionalism, and uniqueness, it's critical you put effort and consideration into your font choice.</p> \n<p>But, besides Times New Roman, which fonts pass the six-second resume scan? Additionally, which fonts should you avoid to ensure your typeface isn't distracting the recruiter from the content itself?</p> \n<p>Here, we've asked HubSpot recruiters to reveal the seven best fonts for your resume in 2019, as well as what they consider in terms of design in general, so your resume can stand out in the pile.</p> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>Best Fonts for Resume</h2> \n <ol> \n  <li>Times New Roman</li> \n  <li>Arial</li> \n  <li>Calibri</li> \n  <li>Helvetica</li> \n  <li>Cambria</li> \n  <li>Georgia</li> \n  <li>Garamond</li> \n  <li>Avenir Next</li> \n  <li><span>Muna</span></li> \n </ol> \n</div> \n<p>When speaking with recruiters, it quickly became clear that classic fonts are still the best options -- when in doubt, you want to make your resume as clear and easy-to-read as possible, even if it means forsaking your favorite script font.</p> \n<p>For instance, Johanna Fleming, a Services Recruiter at HubSpot, told me, \"I’m a big fan of the 'classics' for resumes -- Times New Roman, Arial, Calibri, Helvetica, and Cambria. I’m a little old school, but I think they are the cleanest and exude professionalism.\"</p> \n<p>Additionally, when asked which font <em>size </em>is best, Johanna said, \"12 is ideal -- nothing less than 10.5.\"</p> \n<p>Riley Kundtz, MBA Campus Recruiter at HubSpot, further noted, \"I find the classic formatting and Times font to be helpful when reading a dense resume from an experienced MBA candidate.\"&nbsp;</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">Another HubSpot recruiter, Rich Lapham, concurred, saying, \"I</span><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">&nbsp;would stick with the classics like Times New Roman or Arial. My personal recommendation would be Garamond -- I think it makes it look that much more professional. Recruiters have an idea of the skills they are looking for on a resume, so if you try a new style or format it can be tougher for recruiters to find the information they are looking for. Keep it clean and simple.\"&nbsp;<br></span></p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">Holly Peterson, a Senior Recruiter at HubSpot, also supports more traditional fonts -- \"I really like Arial, Tahoma, and you can't go wrong with Times New Roman! Anything that is cursive (or too bubbly) is too hard to read. For instance, I'd stay clear of Comic Sans.\"<br></span></p> \n<p>Despite the preference of Times New Roman by some of the recruiters I spoke to, not all recruiters prefer it. For instance, Glory Montes, Associate Campus Recruiter at HubSpot, told me, \"For me it’s all about legibility and cleanliness. This means I prefer sans-serif fonts like Helvetica, over serif fonts like Times New Roman. Overall, I would just stay away from a font like Times New Roman. It’s overused and reminds me of long nights writing course papers in college.\"</p> \n<p>Ultimately, you'll want to consider the position for which you're applying when you're choosing a font. To Glory's point, certain more creative roles might benefit from a more unique font than Times New Roman.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Paulina Valdez Franco, a Senior Recruiter at HubSpot, also supports fonts other than Times New Roman. She mentioned, \"<span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">My two favorite fonts for 2019 are Helvetica, if you're looking for a clean and classic look, and Georgia, if you're going after a more modern and fun look. The latter is also designed to read well on screens.\"</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">Additionally, Paulina added, \"Arial and Calibri are great choices if you want to play it safe.\"</span></p> \n<p><span style=\"font-size: 1em;\">Bridget LeMon, a Technical Campus Recruiter at HubSpot, agrees that \"it's totally acceptable (and becoming more common) for candidates to stray away from the resume-norms of Times New Roman and Calibri. Avenir Next and Muna are two great options if you are looking to break the status quo.\" </span></p> \n<p>However, it's important to note most recruiters I spoke with were hesitant to even offer a font at all.</p> \n<p>For instance, Heta Patel, a HubSpot recruiter, said, \"I typically don't pay too much attention to font. I'm more concerned about whether the resume is formatted in a clean way -- submitting a PDF is helpful with this, so your formatting doesn't shift.\"</p> \n<p>Kelsey Freedman, a Sales Recruiter at HubSpot, concurred -- \"Honestly, I don't care much about the font of a resume, as long as it's clear and in PDF format. I typically only review a resume for 20-30 seconds, so a traditional font is good. I would advise avoiding script font or bubble font, or something distracting like that.\"</p> \n<p>Ultimately, and as expected, your content still matters most -- however, a clean, clear font will help avoid any irritability you might cause a recruiter with a distracting, messy design.</p> \n<p>Ashley Hodder, a Technical Recruiter at HubSpot, seconds this notion -- \"I think a resume shouldn't have distracting font, and it should be easy to read. [But] what I get most excited about is the content. Depending on the role, I look to see that candidates are sharing direct and compelling snapshots of their work. I look for indicators that show data orientation, autonomy, and thoughtfulness about business impact.\"</p> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>Resume Font Size</h2> \n <p>Regular font size for resumes is 12 points, typically in Times New Roman or another classic, easy-to-read font. Larger fonts are acceptable for headings, your name, or titles of sections. If you're having trouble fitting your content on one page, you might try making your font 10.5 points, but don't go lower than that.<span style=\"font-size: 1em; background-color: transparent;\"></span></p> \n</div> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in November 2018 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-font-resume&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"56a38d0aefc3dbb0c47132fa53b7059c","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Caroline Forsey","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-font-resume&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn59@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-52-353_0353129567627031.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624908},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"The 9 Best Free Email Accounts and Service Providers of 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/free-email-accounts","description":"<p>You need it for networking, job recruitment, downloading resources, transferring files, setting reminders, meeting with colleagues, and so much more.</p>  \n<p>Even with the rise of office chat platforms, you still depend on email for a surprising number of things. But unfortunately, not every email service is completely free. And even the free ones might not be the easiest to use or have all the features you need.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>It can be a challenge to find an email service provider at no cost that balances the right features with usability. To help make your search easier, we put together a list of the different types of email accounts you can set up, followed by the nine best email service providers you can host your account on right now for free.</p> \n<h2>Types of Email Accounts</h2> \n<p>There are two main types of email service providers to choose from: email clients and webmail. When you use your provider to access your email from a different device or location online, you can use one of three major email protocols to do so: POP3, IMAP, and Exchange.</p> \n<p>Let's briefly go over these different types of providers and protocols.</p> \n<h3>Email Clients</h3> \n<p>Email clients are software applications that you install onto the computer itself to manage the email you send and receive. To access this email, the client interacts with a remote email server.</p> \n<p>Email clients you've likely heard of include Microsoft Outlook, Mozilla Thunderbird, and Apple Mail.</p> \n<p>If you want to access this type of email from the web, rather than the client's computer application, the email client uses one of the email protocols described below. For example, although you might have Outlook installed on your computer, you can also log in to your email account via outlook.com using a specific email protocol.</p> \n<h3>Webmail</h3> \n<p>Webmail is a form of email you access exclusively from the internet, and therefore exists primarily on the cloud rather than your computer. Instead of an installed application fetching your email, you manage your inbox right from your internet browser.</p> \n<p>Webmail providers you've likely heard of include Gmail, Yahoo! Mail, and AOL (all of which have made our list of best free email accounts, below).</p> \n<p>If you want to access your webmail from a mail app on your mobile device, rather than your desktop web browser, your webmail provider can use one of the email protocols described below.</p> \n<p>Now, before we get into the best free email accounts, let's talk about those email protocols.</p> \n<h3>Email Protocols</h3> \n<p>Email protocols are the systems that actually retrieve your email for you. They can be used to fetch <em>email client</em> accounts on the internet, and fetch <em>webmail</em> accounts on a mobile app. Here are the three main types of email protocol your account can use.</p> \n<h4>POP3</h4> \n<p>POP stands for \"post office protocol,\" and is best suited for people who have just one email account and email client. <a href=\"https://whatis.techtarget.com/definition/POP3-Post-Office-Protocol-3\">POP3</a> is the latest version of this email protocol, and allows you to access email while offline. It therefore requires less internet bandwidth.</p> \n<h4>IMAP</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.business.org/it/operating-systems/exchange-vs-imap-email-protocols-compare/\">IMAP</a> stands for \"internet mail access protocol,\" and is one of the older email protocol available today. IMAP4 is considered the latest version, and unlike the POP protocol, you do not download your email to your offline email client. Instead, all your email stays online while you're accessing and managing it.</p> \n<p>IMAP is particularly useful for people who have more than one email account and access them from multiple devices or locations.</p> \n<h4>Exchange</h4> \n<p>Exchange is a Microsoft email protocol, and is pretty similar to the IMAP protocol explained above. This protocol allows you to not only access your email over the internet from multiple devices, but also tasks, calendars, and contact information tethered to that email address. For this reason, it's particularly helpful to organizations whose employees share many types of information and collaborate remotely.</p> \n<p>Now, take a look at seven of the best free email service providers you can get your hands on today -- both webmail and email clients included. For each email service provider, we highlighted a unique feature to help you find the best fit.</p> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>Best Free Email Accounts</h2> \n <ol> \n  <li>Gmail</li> \n  <li>AOL</li> \n  <li>Outlook</li> \n  <li>Zoho</li> \n  <li>Mail.com</li> \n  <li>Yahoo! Mail</li> \n  <li>ProtonMail</li> \n  <li>iCloud Mail</li> \n  <li>GMX Mail</li> \n  <li>Mozilla Thunderbird</li> \n  <li>Yandex Mail</li> \n </ol> \n</div> \n<h3>1. Gmail</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Native File Collaboration</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://accounts.google.com/SignUp?hl=en-GB\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> anyone who already uses and loves the rest of Google's products.</p> \n<p>It might seem like an obvious top pick, but Gmail is just too versatile to not award the first slot. Gmail has the second-highest email provider market share (behind Apple iPhone's native email app), according to <a href=\"https://emailclientmarketshare.com/\">Litmus Labs</a>. And ironically, one of the reasons Gmail has become so popular is because of all the communication options in your inbox that don't involve email.</p> \n<p>Gmail is an everyday email inbox you can sign up for by registering for a Google account. But it's built into Google Suite, a group of free apps that allow you to chat, video-conference, and share files with the people in your contact list.</p> \n<p>Google Hangouts, available from your inbox's left sidebar (or the right -- you can customize how you inbox is displayed), lets you text and video chat with other Gmail users for the things that might not warrant an email message. Like most other email accounts today, Gmail also has an intuitive calendar where you can set meetings and reminders.</p> \n<p><strong>Pro tip:</strong> You can also use a free product like <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/sales/schedule-meeting\">HubSpot Meetings</a> to easily schedule meetings without back-and-forth emails.</p> \n<p>Unlike other email accounts, you can use your Gmail address to log into and manage your YouTube account, as well as collaborate on shared documents and spreadsheets right from a cloud-based Google Drive.</p> \n<p>Offering a generous 15 GB of free email storage, Gmail does everything it can to make your inbox less chaotic, including advanced filters that automatically push emails into separate folders as they arrive. And none of these functions costs a dime.</p> \n<h3>2. AOL</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Unlimited Storage</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://login.aol.com/\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> people who use email for most of their communication.</p> \n<p>America Online (I feel nostalgic just typing those words) has quietly kept up with today's standards for a good user experience. The classic AOL is now once again one of the best free email accounts available to you.</p> \n<p>Purchased by Verizon in 2015, AOL delivers you email from its classic news-driven homepage, and comes with the contemporary spam filters and virus protection you'd expect from your email provider. You can also<a href=\"https://help.aol.com/articles/one-click-messaging-in-your-aol-mail-inbox-video\"> </a><a href=\"https://help.aol.com/articles/one-click-messaging-in-your-aol-mail-inbox-video\">send text and instant messages</a> from specific windows in your email inbox.</p> \n<p>AOL does have something over Gmail, though: unlimited storage. Additionally, you can import email contacts from a CSV, TXT, or LDIF file so you're not creating your \"buddy list\" (get it?) from scratch.</p> \n<h3>3. Outlook</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Multiple App Integrations</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://outlook.live.com/owa/\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Email client</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> people who use many different platforms to connect with others.</p> \n<p>If you ever cringed at the sight of a \"Hotmail.com\" email address, you can thank Outlook for this outdated domain name. But there's good news: Microsoft has reinvented its longstanding email service, and your free Outlook.com email address has many progressive features waiting for you.</p> \n<p>While it touts a calendar and message filter that is similar to Gmail, Outlook also integrates with a number of other popular communication apps. You can connect Skype, Facebook, PowerPoint, PayPal, and even task-management software such as Trello -- making it very easy to reach and work with non-Outlook users without leaving your inbox.</p> \n<p>Outlook offers 15 GB of free storage for each user, along with a super-clean interface.</p> \n<h3>4. Zoho</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: 25 Business Addresses</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://www.zoho.com/mail/\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> startups and small businesses.</p> \n<p>This is the first of the lesser-known free email accounts to make our list, but it holds a lot of potential for businesses.</p> \n<p>The first thing you'll notice about Zoho is its user-friendliness. From integrating with Google Drive, Box, and other cloud-based file managers, to its built-in task manager, this email service offers a simple way to accomplish all of your daily tasks.</p> \n<p>The real difference-maker, though, is the ability to<a href=\"https://www.zoho.com/mail/help/complete-guide-to-setup-zohomail.html\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.zoho.com/mail/help/complete-guide-to-setup-zohomail.html\">customize the domain name</a> for up to 25 connected email addresses. Want to replace \"@zoho.com\" with the name of your business's website? You can do so under Zoho Lite, which gives you 5 GB for free -- all under username@yourdomainname.com.</p> \n<h3>5. Mail.com</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: 200 Custom Domain Names</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://www.mail.com/\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> small businesses, freelancers, and the self-employed.</p> \n<p>It doesn't get more self-explanatory than \"Mail.com,\" does it? This email provider knows its audience -- or should I say, audiences.</p> \n<p>Right off the bat, you'll probably notice Mail.com doesn't have stellar storage space compared to the options above: only 2 GB. But what this webmail service lacks in gigabytes it makes up for with … drumroll …<a href=\"https://www.mail.com/email/#.509574-stage-link1-2\"> </a><a href=\"https://www.mail.com/email/#.509574-stage-link1-2\">200 free custom domain names</a>. You can replace \"@mail.com\" at the end of your username with just about anything that describes you. Here are some options Mail.com has precreated for you to choose from:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Bartender.net</li> \n <li>Musician.org</li> \n <li>Columnist.com</li> \n <li>Engineer.com</li> \n <li>Accountant.com</li> \n <li>Toothfairy.com (who knew she was online?)</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Mail.com doesn't rest on its 200 laurels, though, as the email provider also comes with a calendar for creating and tracking your events each week.</p> \n<h3>6. Yahoo! Mail</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Media and attachment history</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://login.yahoo.com/account/create?specId=yidReg\">Sign up here.</a></h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> creatives and those who send and receive attachments frequently via email.</p> \n<p>Yahoo! Mail, another well-known platform, sits just behind AOL in storage space with a whopping 1 TB (that's a <em>terabyte</em>) for free, along with a few key social media integrations.</p> \n<p>In addition to custom background themes and being able to search key information from your inbox, Yahoo! Mail also makes it easy to find every photo, video, and document you've ever attached or received via email in their own tabs on your inbox's sidebar. This makes the platform especially appealing to those who share documents on a regular basis or simply want an album made of every photo they've ever had shared.</p> \n<h3>7. ProtonMail</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Encrypted email</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://protonmail.com/signup\">Sign up here.</a></h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> people who send and receive sensitive information.</p> \n<p>ProtonMail offers just 500 MB of free space, but for the worthy trade of <em>encrypted</em> email, allowing you to send messages that nobody else can see, and disappear after a month.</p> \n<p>What's the catch? Is the service hard to use? As with most webmail platforms, ProtonMail is easy to use on any device without any software needed to encrypt your emails. Its inbox interface is as easy to understand at a glance as the other email services on this list, and offers quick color-coded labels to help you further organize which emails deserve the most care and protection.</p> \n<h3>8. iCloud Mail</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Label senders as VIPs</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://www.apple.com/icloud/\">Sign up here.</a></h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> people who use Mac and want everything on one system.</p> \n<p>If you’re a Mac user, you may want to consider using iCloud Mail as your email provider. Their free email account comes with 5GB of storage that you can use to sync your photos, files, or email. It’s important to note that storage is shared between all of your apps and devices — so if you take a lot of photos on your iPhone, you may eat into your email storage allowance for the month. Upgraded plans start at $0.99/month and go up to $9.99/month.</p> \n<p>One of the biggest advantages of using iCloud over other email providers on this list is the ease of integration. Apple builds its desktop and iPhone mail apps with all email clients in mind, but it pays special attention to making the experience delightful for iCloud users.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>Some of the pros of iCloud Mail include an easy to use search functionality, easy-to-use rules, and an ability to label senders as VIP. When a contact is marked as VIP, new messages will automatically filter to a separate tab on the left, saving you both time and energy.&nbsp;</p> \n<h3>9. GMX Mail</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Alias email addresses</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://www.gmx.com/mail/create-email-address/\">Sign up here.</a></h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> people who need multiple emails with one central inbox.<br><br>While you may not have heard of GMX Mail, it’s been around for quite a while (since 1997) — and it has a bunch of features that make it worth considering. First off, GMX offers 65GB of storage. That’s a lot of storage for a free email service. In fact, they claim that allows you to keep nearly half a million messages in your Inbox!<br><br>Another feature worth noting is the ability to send large attachments. While many services have caps for your email attachments, GMX Mail allows you to send files up to 50GB. That’s great if you share a ton of photos, presentations, or other large files from your account. <br><br>But the feature of GMX Mail that really sets it apart is the ability to set up to 10 alias email addresses all from within one account. This can be useful in many situations — both personally and professionally. On a personal note, you could use one alias for all of your online purchases and logins — to keep marketing emails separate from your personal messages. From a business perspective, multiple email addresses can be useful for managing role based emails such as support@yourdomain.com or sales@yourdomain.com.</p> \n<h3>10. Mozilla Thunderbird</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: Customization features, and the ability to open multiple emails in tabs</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Email clients</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> anyone looking for a simple, but customizable email inbox.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/\">Thunderbird</a>, a free email application from Mozilla, known for Firefox, offers a quick email inbox setup and a simple, easy-to-use user interface.</p> \n<p>The app offers customizable features, such as theme settings and app extensions that can improve your email experience. The email app also allows you to open multiple emails in tabs, similarly to how you would open multiple web pages in Firefox browsers.</p> \n<h3>11. Yandex Mail</h3> \n<h4>Unique Feature: 10 GB of free cloud storage</h4> \n<h5><a href=\"https://mail.yandex.com/\">Sign up here</a>.</h5> \n<p><strong>Type of email:</strong> Webmail</p> \n<p><strong>Who should use it:</strong> anyone seeking a free email with additional storage capabilities.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://mail.yandex.com/\">Yandex is a Russian web company </a>that offers a global email tool. With the tool, you can sign up for a free account, link it to your Facebook, Twitter, or Gmail accounts, and personalize your email inbox.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://www.lifewire.com/thmb/Jgby1eVME4lmPMnh6duppa9Q9r0=/1414x943/filters:no_upscale():max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/yandex-mail-10d3b62f5ac342ee956fa9cdc1a551b0.png\" alt=\"Yandex free email account Mail inbox \" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 10px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.lifewire.com/best-free-email-accounts-1356641\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Source: LifeWire</a></p> \n<p>Like many of the other providers on this list, Yandex's email inbox can be set to filter or prioritize emails so you see messages from real people. It can also recognize keywords in messages and subject lines and organize emails into categorized inboxes. Additionally, users who sign up for Yandex mail get <a href=\"https://mail.yandex.com/\">10 GB of free cloud storage</a>.</p> \n<h2>Making the Most of Your Email</h2> \n<p>And with that, you have some of the best options for free email accounts this year. But who knows? Your next email address could be entirely different while giving you just what you need to succeed.</p> \n<p>Once you've chosen an email provider and launched a new email address specifically for your marketing needs, you should also leverage apps, outside software, and APIs to add to your email strategy.</p> \n<p>One powerful tool worth noting is <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/email\">HubSpot's Free Email tool. </a>The tool allows you to link your email address to the HubSpot CRM, while also allowing you to build email templates and send messages straight from the HubSpot software. Even more beneficial? The <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/email\">software even lets you</a> track basic analytics and collect email subscriber contacts in your CRM -- which can then be added to your email marketing lists.</p> \n<p>To learn more about our free email tool, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/And%20with%20that,%20you%20have%20some%20of%20the%20best%20options%20for%20free%20email%20accounts%20in%202019.%20But%20who%20knows?%20Your%20next%20email%20address%20could%20be%20entirely%20different%20while%20giving%20you%20just%20what%20you%20need%20to%20succeed.\">click here</a>.&nbsp;</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ffree-email-accounts&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 22 Oct 2020 23:31:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"11f09f082a1859f82c506b03730b2270","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"brbecker@hubspot.com (Braden Becker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.lifewire.com/thmb/Jgby1eVME4lmPMnh6duppa9Q9r0=/1414x943/filters:no_upscale():max_bytes(150000):strip_icc():format(webp)/yandex-mail-10d3b62f5ac342ee956fa9cdc1a551b0.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn91@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-47-861_bfad8694e7eda567.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ffree-email-accounts&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn43@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-47-818_3ac0b680dbbece4e.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624891},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"The Ultimate Guide to Integrations and Why Your Business Needs Them","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/integrations","description":"<p>Have you ever found yourself working on a project in which you had to toggle between different software and applications? Perhaps you had to plug data from one system into another or rewrite the same content over and over again to ensure it was in multiple locations.</p> \n<p>Although few people have the time or patience for this type of tedious work, it’s common and often critical to your business’s success — these mundane tasks need to get done.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>What if there was a way to connect your software to the applications you use in a way that successfully brings them together? This would mean all of your information and data would live in a central location with no manual entry required, even if those applications don’t actually come with the software itself … sound nice?</p> \n<p>Well, good news! This type of solution exists … it’s called an <strong>integration</strong>.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p class=\"p1\"></p> \n<p>Integrations are a complex topic to understand. So, let’s simplify the concept with the help of an analogy we can reference throughout this guide.</p> \n<p>Let’s pretend you want to plug your MacBook laptop into your TV using a connector cable so you can watch reruns of Friends on Netflix on the big screen. And integration kind of works like this — I’ll explain more as we go.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://docs.google.com/a/hubspot.com/drawings/d/svOKAAijuEee1UcTkqY-knQ/image?parent=1xU9AVbjLRDDV78t5W6AdknVJodSYBCEmypuNSfrElCk&amp;rev=68&amp;h=110&amp;w=616&amp;ac=1\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"applications integration example\">\n</div> \n<a></a> \n<p>Back to our analogy: If your <strong>software</strong> is your laptop, you’ll use a connector cable, or <strong>integration</strong>, to then watch Friends on the TV, or <strong>application</strong>.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://docs.google.com/a/hubspot.com/drawings/d/srHPCIh1I_ca6aV951yxUfQ/image?parent=1xU9AVbjLRDDV78t5W6AdknVJodSYBCEmypuNSfrElCk&amp;rev=132&amp;h=125&amp;w=624&amp;ac=1\" alt=\"example of an integration\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>Now, let’s run through some commonly asked questions about integrations to help you get a better grasp on what they are, how they work, and why your company needs them.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Why use integrations?</h3> \n<p>Integrations solve and simplify your need for new software as your business grows and evolves. They allow you to keep the system you’re currently using by simply adding connections to third-party applications to enhance system functionality and provide additional features you may need but aren’t able to build within your software. You can keep your current laptop and TV, and simply use the connector cable to watch Friends on the big screen.</p> \n<p>By leveraging integration connections across your systems, you can <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/business-analytics?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=business_analytics_course\">power your business</a> to achieve a much wider range of tasks on your software as you enhance its functionality. This is especially helpful as your business expands since your needs are bound to change.</p> \n<p>Although your software may have the functionality you need when you start your business, you’re likely going to want additional applications to provide the features you end up needing later on, as you grow.</p> \n<p>There are many types of integrations, each of which has specific functions to help meet different needs. The easiest way to think about the various types of integrations is by category. Some integrations have several functions, meaning they could technically fit into many categories because they serve more than one main purpose. Other integrations have one specific function.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>Who needs integrations?</h3> \n<p>Integrations are helpful tools for virtually every business, no matter the size or industry. There are integrations suited for every type of company (startups, SMBs, and enterprise companies) with any purpose (advertising, analytics, or content).</p> \n<p>If you sell software, as <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?_ga=2.197914799.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">we do at HubSpot</a>, you’ll find yourself not only using connections for your internal software but also for your customers to use along with your software. This is because your software may not have every feature and function your customers need to run their business. So, by adding an integration, they’ll get that added feature or function while continuing to use your software.</p> \n<p>Referring back to our analogy, without the integration, or connector cable, your laptop wouldn’t be able to communicate with your TV to allow you to watch Friends on the big screen. You need that integration, or cable, to allow for added functionality and watch the show on TV — without it, this wouldn’t be possible.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>How do you get integrations?</h3> \n<p>Integrations are almost always located in some type of marketplace, where customers can review and browse all of their options. The <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations\">Hu</a><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations?_ga=2.197914799.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">bSpot App Marketplace</a> is an example of this. Our marketplace allows visitors to search and learn more about the various integrations and their functions, and then connect HubSpot to their integration of choice.</p> \n<p>(No, you can’t go to Best Buy to pick up your integration as you would with your connector cable to watch Friends on your TV… you’re right, the example doesn’t quite work here.)</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>How do integrations work with APIs?</h3> \n<p>API stands for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/8341/a-marketer-s-guide-to-apis.aspx?_ga=2.197914799.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">application programming interface</a>. An API is an interface that software uses to receive information (whether that’s data, servers, applications, etc.).</p> \n<p>All of the integrations we’re going to discuss below are built on APIs. By building integrations on APIs, you can connect your integrations to your software and use them in tandem with one another. The integration allows for the flow of information to and from apps and devices in real-time — APIs allow them to talk to one another.</p> \n<p>Think about this in terms of our analogy from above: The application is the TV, the programming allows your laptop to communicate with the TV, and the interface is how you (the user) are able to interact with the application (by watching Friends on your TV). In this example, the API is the port on the side of your laptop in which you actually insert your integration (the cable) to then connect your laptop to your TV.</p> \n<h3>Integration vs. iPaaS Solution</h3> \n<p>If you’ve heard of integrations before, chances are you’ve also heard about <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ipaas-guide?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">iPaaS, or Integration Platform as a Service</a>. The difference between the two is an important distinction to make when determining which one you need for your business. While an integration is a one-to-one, direct connection solution, an iPaaS solution is <em>not</em>.</p> \n<p>Instead, iPaaS is a cloud-based platform that connects your applications and systems — whether that’s in the cloud or on-premise — between an organization and third-party software <em>without</em> the use of middleware.</p> \n<p>So, if you look for an integration solution on your software’s marketplace and don’t find the connection you’re looking for, then you’d turn to an iPaaS solution to solve your need for that connection. There are a few integrations available today (called “connector integrations”, which we’ll look at an example of below) that can help you build custom integrations..</p> \n<p>So, which integrations should you actually use? Let’s look at a list of some of the most popular integrations available.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2>Popular Integrations</h2> \n<p>The following integrations are categorized by business need to help you browse through your options. (Almost all of these integrations fit into multiple categories, as they have functions that allow them to do multiple things. Below, we placed them in the category they’re best suited for.)</p> \n<p>It’s important to note these are just <em>some</em> of today’s popular integrations — there are hundreds of more integrations to learn about and choose from as your business grows.</p> \n<p>The list we’ve compiled below is of integrations that connect with <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">HubSpot</a>. This isn’t to say these <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/hubspot-platform-update-q1-2019\">HubSpot integrations</a> don’t also work with other software. In fact, most of these integrations <em>are</em> compatible with dozens of programs in addition to HubSpot.</p> \n<p>Let’s take a look.</p> \n<h3>Advertising Integrations</h3> \n<p>Advertising integrations help you market to and reach your target audience. Data about the success of your ads and/ or the leads obtained from them is automatically added to your <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">HubSpot CRM</a> so you can learn more about the people who interact with your ads and nurture them into customers.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/facebookads?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Facebook Ads</a></h4> \n<p>The Facebook Ads integration allows you to connect your <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/ads\">Facebook Ads account</a> to HubSpot. This integration gives you the ability to attribute your ads directly to the contacts who interact with them. It also allows you to review real data about which ads impact your bottom line. This simplifies the reporting process for all of your Facebook Ad efforts.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/adroll?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">AdRoll</a></h4> \n<p>Different businesses and products have various buyer personas. The AdRoll integration gives you the opportunity to create personalized retargeting ads for different lead segments in your HubSpot contacts. You can personalize several parts of the ads, such as content and formatting, that will best relate to your prospect.</p> \n<p>This allows you to focus on your audience’s attributes so you can effectively reach your prospects — you can gather intricate details about your prospects from your CRM via the integration so you’re able to successfully retarget them.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/instapage?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Instapag</a><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/instapage\">e</a></h4> \n<p>If you’re not a developer, creating your website’s landing page might sound like an overwhelming task. The Instapage integration provides a straightforward option for anyone who wants to create and personalize their landing page and then send lead information straight to HubSpot. These details are automatically placed under the associated contact in HubSpot for you— meaning, there’s no need to perform this transfer manually.</p> \n<h3>Account-Based Marketing (ABM) Integrations</h3> \n<p>ABM stands for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/account-based-marketing-guide\">account-based marketing</a>. ABM integrations help you leverage your account and audience data so you can tailor your messaging, CTAs, and marketing strategies to close deals and attract customers.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/orgcharthub?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">OrgChartHub</a></h4> \n<p>The OrgChartHub integration allows you to efficiently build customer organization charts without ever leaving HubSpot. You can create customer organization charts while in HubSpot so you’re able to easily identify unknown contacts, visualize key stakeholders, and customize your sales personas without manually sending any of this information back and forth.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/calibermind?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">CaliberMind</a></h4> \n<p>With the CaliberMind integration, you’ll be able to look at your cross-channel account engagement and create alerts for your reps about which deals they should focus on closing to meet quota. The integration takes your contacts directly from HubSpot and automatically matches them to their associated accounts so you don’t have to.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/metadata?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Metadata</a></h4> \n<p>The Metadata integration provides account-based advertising services. You can automatically identify specific target accounts and contacts from HubSpot to create personalized advertisements at scale to help you close more deals and reach your target audience more effectively.</p> \n<h3>Analytics and Data Integrations</h3> \n<p>These integrations help you measure your success across a number of analytics platforms. You can look at your data in different ways and ensure all of this information is well-organized in HubSpot so your team can review it at any time. These integrations help you learn more about which of your efforts are working and which ones need to be modified.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/databox?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Databox</a></h4> \n<p>With the increase of remote employees across businesses and the number of people who access their work while on-the-go, having the ability to review and manage your key performance indicators (KPIs) from anywhere can be quite helpful.</p> \n<p>The Databox integration provides you with access to all of your analytics data in HubSpot from a wide variety of sources including Google Analytics, SEMRush, mobile, desktop, Facebook, and more.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/hotjar?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Hotjar</a></h4> \n<p>In a world where many website visitors are uninterested in completing forms and providing their personal information, Hotjar is a great way to learn about who your visitors are and what they’re looking for on your site. The Hotjar integration gives you insight into who your website and mobile visitors are and what their needs consist of directly from HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/klipfolio?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Klipfolio</a></h4> \n<p>The Klipfolio integration shows you your most important metrics in real-time and creates easy-to-read dashboards in HubSpot so you can track and analyze performance across all of your platforms from one location. This allows you to improve your data transparency and reach your targets faster.</p> \n<h3>Calling Integrations</h3> \n<p>Whether it’s a meeting with fellow employees or your prospective and current customers, calling integrations will make all phone and video call interactions simple. Your contact’s information and details about the call will be recorded in HubSpot for easy access. This also provides sales reps and support team members with the necessary background information to assist the prospect or customer appropriately.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/uberconference?_ga=2.203029905.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">UberConference</a></h4> \n<p>With UberConference, it takes just seconds to schedule your meetings with colleagues and prospective customers so you can focus on tasks that require more attention. The integration allows you to schedule meetings quickly and easily without ever having to leave your HubSpot portal.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/aircall?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Aircall</a></h4> \n<p>Phone calls remain one of the most effective ways to interact with your prospective and current customers. Whether it’s a sales or support call, the Aircall integration allows you to manage your call flows and attentively assist your leads and customers all within HubSpot so your contact’s information lives in one, central location.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/callrail?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">CallRail</a></h4> \n<p>The CallRail integration is a call tracking and analytics system which allows you to customize segments and actions based on your specific calls with prospects and customers. All of your call and text data will automatically be added and organized in HubSpot under the associated contact so you don’t have to manually enter any data.</p> \n<h3>Connector Integrations</h3> \n<p>Connector integrations provide you with access to dozens of applications which sync to HubSpot to save you time and add functionality. Some connector integrations offer a wide range of applications and some have more specific types of applications. Additionally, some connector integrations can assist in creating a custom integration to suit your needs.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/automateio?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Automate.io</a></h4> \n<p>The Automate.io integration connects to HubSpot to give you access to over 80 applications. By syncing with these apps, you’ll be able to transfer data to them to create customized integrations so you can manage all of your data in a way that works for your business all within HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/zapier?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Zapier</a></h4> \n<p>The Zapier integration allows you to automatically connect your software to over 1,000 applications.
