It links your apps to HubSpot for you in just a few clicks to save you time. There’s no coding required and your apps will be able to begin sharing data in an easy-to-read workflow format in your HubSpot portal.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/piesync?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">PieSync</a></h4> \n<p>The PieSync integration provides real-time, two-way contact sync. This means every time you add a contact to HubSpot, it automatically syncs to an application (such as Google Contacts or Outlook), and vice versa — you don’t need to worry about any importing or exporting, expediting and simplifying your contact syncs.</p> \n<h3>Content Integrations</h3> \n<p>Content integrations help you create, design, and share custom content for your website. They also help you learn about <em>who’s</em> interacting with the content and <em>how</em> they’re interacting with it. That information is then synced to HubSpot so you can organize it and add it to specific contacts.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/beacon?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Beacon</a></h4> \n<p>If your website has a collection of blog posts, the Beacon integration might be a good option for you. The integration ensures your content looks professional and allows you to drive more leads by getting more value out of your existing content — it connects to HubSpot to automatically convert your blog posts into downloadable content such as eBooks.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/brix?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">briX</a></h4> \n<p>The briX integration connects to HubSpot so you can design and personalize web pages for your site. You don’t need a background in web design or coding to create beautiful pages — the drag-and-drop template and 100+ customizable features make it easy to organize your content in any way you choose. This integration is ideal for easily designing and personalizing web pages directly from HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/belchio?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Belch.io</a></h4> \n<p>Customized landing pages, web pages, and emails provide a professional look and feel for your visitors, leads, and customers while interacting with your business online. The Belch.io integration connects to HubSpot so you can personalize and brand all of these things in just minutes.</p> \n<p>It’s a great option for anyone without a background in coding or web development who wants to design and customize their site pages and emails to complement their brand all from HubSpot.</p> \n<h3>Customer Success Integrations</h3> \n<p>Customer success integrations connect to HubSpot to make your internal and external interactions with employees (cross-team) and customers straightforward. They simplify communication and help you share information and/or data when you need to.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/slack?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Slack</a></h4> \n<p>The Slack integration is a digital workspace and communication tool that allows you to connect and talk with your team members. The integration is ideal for team collaboration and coordination from anywhere.</p> \n<p>By connecting the integration to your software, you can use Slack’s and HubSpot’s features in either the application <em>or</em> the software so you don’t have to waste time toggling back and forth — the same information will be found in both locations in real-time.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/zendesk?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Zendesk</a></h4> \n<p>Zendesk offers a ticketing system to keep track of customer inquiries and allows you to keep details about all of your customer interactions in one place. It helps you provide consistent customer experiences among your fellow employees and customers.</p> \n<p>By connecting HubSpot to the Zendesk integration, you’ll be able to bring the work of your sales, marketing, and support teams together in a central location. It also allows these departments to communicate with each other while in HubSpot as well.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/livechat?_ga=2.227161245.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">LiveChat</a></h4> \n<p>The LiveChat integration allows you to communicate with potential customers in real-time when they need assistance or guidance while on your website from HubSpot. Whether it’s a question about your product or the need for help in the checkout process, LiveChat allows you to walk them through the information they need to help you boost conversions and build strong relationships with prospects and customers.</p> \n<h3>Ecommerce Integrations</h3> \n<p>If you have an online store, ecommerce integrations are a great way to learn about what your customers and visitors are doing while they’re on your website. By connecting these integrations to HubSpot, you’ll know when your visitors are most frequently abandoning your site or their carts so you can create re-engagement content to regain their interest.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/shopify?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Shopify</a></h4> \n<p>The Shopify integration allows you to easily incorporate all of your ecommerce data and customer data within HubSpot. It automatically syncs customer, product, and deal information in HubSpot under the associated customer’s profile, so your entire team can view all of these details in one location. You can also create cart abandonment nurturing tactics, re-engagement ads for your website from HubSpot once you connect the integration to the software.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/typeform?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Typeform</a></h4> \n<p>The Typeform integration helps you create and design web and mobile forms for your leads. You can create contact forms, sign up forms, quizzes, and more, and all of your responses will automatically be sent directly to HubSpot so you can easily review your results and responses and compile them under the associated contact in HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/magento-by-eyemagine?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Magento</a></h4> \n<p>The Magento integration helps you create and send upsell, cross-sell, and reorder emails as well as develop abandoned cart nurturing tactics to boost your conversions. It automatically sends all of your customers’ ecommerce-related data, as well as emails between you and your customers, straight to their respective HubSpot contact record.</p> \n<h3>Email Integrations</h3> \n<p>Email integrations help you track a prospect’s interactions with sales reps, personalize your email automation with certain contacts, and measure the success of your email campaigns among your target audience — all from HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/mailchimp?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">MailChimp</a></h4> \n<p>The MailChimp integration allows you to sync HubSpot with your email service provider. You can build email campaigns and rest easy knowing the Intelligent Error Handling feature will continue engaging your contacts even if a syncing error occurs between the software and application.</p> \n<p>By connecting MailChimp to HubSpot, you’ll have the ability to automatically add contacts from HubSpot into your application’s email lists and vice versa so you never have to do it manually.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/privy?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Privy</a></h4> \n<p>Privy helps you make more sales and turn more prospects into delighted customers. The integration uses targeted pop-up ads, banners, bars, and more to help you boost conversions and decrease page abandonment. It also automatically syncs all of your new leads from your website to HubSpot so the software can help you nurture them and convert them into customers.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/front?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Front</a></h4> \n<p>The Front integration is a collaborative inbox, meaning all members of your team can see and access your contacts, review deals, and see all activity history while working in HubSpot. All of these details are automatically synced in Front <em>and</em> your CRM. This helps you improve your customer experience and ensure it remains consistent no matter which employees your customers work with.</p> \n<h3>Event and Webinar Integrations</h3> \n<p>Whether it’s an in-person event, a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-a-webinar\">webinar</a>, an online meeting, or a video conference, the following integrations simplify every aspect of hosting an event. They allow your contacts to book meetings with you and you can update all information related to your contacts post-event or meeting in HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/eventbrite?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Eventbrite</a></h4> \n<p>Eventbrite helps you use inbound marketing tactics to attract more prospects and customers to your in-person events. Once connected to your software, the integration automatically takes data from your contact lists in HubSpot to help you uncover effective ways to connect with your target audience, face-to-face.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/gotowebinar?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">GoToWebinar</a></h4> \n<p>No matter the type of event you’re hosting, the GoToWebinar integration automatically syncs all of your registrant and participant information in HubSpot under the associated contact. You’ll never have to worry about manually importing data about your webinar contacts again — instead, you’ll have more time to focus on the event itself.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/setmore?_ga=2.227679389.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Setmore</a></h4> \n<p>The Setmore integration simplifies appointment scheduling for you. It automatically imports your booked appointments (and information about the customer who booked the appointment) to HubSpot under the correct contact’s profile so you don’t have to do it manually.</p> \n<h3>Lead Generation Integrations</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/beginner-inbound-lead-generation-guide-ht\">Lead generation</a> integrations help you transition early-stage leads into delighted customers. All of your leads’ information will automatically be synced to HubSpot so you can view it at any point during the buyer’s journey. This is helpful to learn more about your target audience and to manage customer information so your sales and support teams can refer to it if needed, all from one location.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/wordpress?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">WordPress</a></h4> \n<p>The WordPress integration helps you optimize and align your WordPress website with the data about your contacts and business goals you have in HubSpot. Your HubSpot account and all of your growth tools will automatically be connected to your WordPress site so you can work to attract, engage, and delight site visitors and customers on your site from either WordPress or HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/unbounce?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Unbounce</a></h4> \n<p>The Unbounce integration helps you with the lead capturing and nurturing processes. You can create lead generation forms and send all data collected about your leads directly to HubSpot. At any point in time, you can take this data about your leads and use it to create campaigns. You’ll also have the ability to export any data in just seconds from your Unbounce account and share it anywhere.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/surveymonkey?_ga=2.260324493.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">SurveyMonkey</a></h4> \n<p>With the SurveyMonkey integration, you can create and distribute custom surveys to your prospects and customers, collect all data obtained, and view your responses within HubSpot. This is ideal because you can then segment and organize all your contacts based on their survey responses to easily manage the type of content and/or follow up they receive.</p> \n<h3>Live Chat Integrations</h3> \n<p>By adding <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/live-chat?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">live chat integrations</a> to your website, you’ll be able to communicate with prospects in real-time and nurture them into customers. You can answer their questions, respond to their concerns, and assist them in their purchase decisions. Then, this data is compiled into HubSpot under the specific contact it belongs to so you can follow up appropriately.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/intercom?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Intercom</a></h4> \n<p>The Intercom integration allows you to capture new leads and prospective customers with the help of live chat on your website. Intercom allows you to convert more leads by actively engaging with them at any time while they’re on your website once connected to HubSpot. You can then qualify your leads with custom bots, talk with them directly, and track them — then, all of this information is automatically organized under their contact in HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/manychat?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">ManyChat</a></h4> \n<p>Once connected to HubSpot, the ManyChat integration allows you to automate your messenger marketing so you can easily organize, nurture, and track your leads from the software. You can also take any HubSpot form and submit information obtained from it by sending custom field data to HubSpot Form Submissions.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/drift?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Drift</a></h4> \n<p>The Drift integration provides live chat for your website so you can assist your leads in real-time form HubSpot. The integration allows you to watch and save all of the lead’s activity on your site in HubSpot under the correct contact. Additionally, your sales reps can use Drift to customize their outreach and follow-ups based on that activity to improve the chances of conversion.</p> \n<h3>Sales Integrations</h3> \n<p>Sales integrations help you bring your sales tools, tactics, and prospects’ information together using HubSpot. You’ll be able to keep your marketing, support, and sales details in a central location for all teams to access, analyze, and refer to as needed.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/hellosign?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">HelloSign</a></h4> \n<p>Once connected to HubSpot, you’ll automatically be notified of any action a prospect takes on any document you send them with the HelloSign integration. Examples of the actions you’ll be notified about include when a prospect or customer receives, opens, or signs the document.</p> \n<p>Then, this activity data is sent to the contact it belongs to in HubSpot so reps know where the prospect or customer is in the buyer’s journey and how they should go about following up with them.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/salesforce?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Salesforce</a></h4> \n<p>If you’re a Salesforce user, you can automatically sync all of your contacts’ information from the database into HubSpot once connected to the Salesforce integration. This allows you to work with reps to get strong lead intelligence and revenue reporting. You can mesh your marketing and sales work, content, and information so you and your team can access any information from either system at any point in time.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/pandadoc\">PandaDoc</a></h4> \n<p>When it comes to sales work, there are many tasks involved that don’t necessarily include the process of actually closing a deal. The PandaDoc integration automatically organizes and reviews information from HubSpot about your prospect to help you with non-selling tasks like creating and sending quotes, proposals, and contracts.</p> \n<h3>Social Media Integrations</h3> \n<p>Understanding your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">social media following is a huge part of successful marketing</a>. Social media integrations help you learn about your followers, understand the type of content they interact with and share, and automate specific parts of your social media strategy.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/facebook?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Facebook</a></h4> \n<p>With the Facebook integration, you can automatically connect your business’s Facebook account to HubSpot. Schedule Facebook posts ahead of time analyze and measure post’s performance. This integration is ideal if you want to manage your Facebook marketing strategy alongside your other social media marketing strategies directly from HubSpot.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/linkedin?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">LinkedIn</a></h4> \n<p>By connecting your LinkedIn account to HubSpot through the LinkedIn integration, you can easily engage with your network and communicate with all of your contacts from HubSpot. You can also auto-publish your blogs and share specific content with your followers to nurture them into leads and customers. This integration is also great for tracking engagement along with all of your other social media channels and marketing efforts all from HubSpot’s social media tool.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/twitter?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Twitter</a></h4> \n<p>Schedule Tweets ahead of time, monitor Twitter streams, view Tweets and Twitter interactions of your competitors, and monitor accounts that are important to your brand from HubSpot with the Twitter integration. All information about your current and new followers will be added to your contact lists in HubSpot so everything is organized appropriately.</p> \n<h3>Video Integrations</h3> \n<p>With the rise of video and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/video-marketing?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">video marketing</a> in business today, integrations that help you incorporate this media on your website have become quite useful. They allow you to create and implement videos on your site pages and forms as well as measure the success of your video marketing efforts.</p> \n<h4>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/wistia?_ga=2.261306765.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Wistia</a></h4> \n<p>The Wistia integration provides you with the ability to integrate videos on your website, and then incorporate HubSpot forms with those videos to improve video engagement (and hopefully, conversion) rates. If any lead converts on a video, their information is automatically sent to HubSpot so you’ll have their video-viewing data paired with their contact details.</p> \n<h4>2. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/youtube?_ga=2.30498111.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">YouTube</a></h4> \n<p>The YouTube integration connects your YouTube channel to HubSpot. This way, you can easily report on your video and channel success and compare this data to that of your other social platforms using HubSpot’s analytics and social media tools and dashboards.</p> \n<h4>3. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/promo-by-slidely?_ga=2.30498111.1611654906.1563289844-1493293515.1553017609\">Promo</a></h4> \n<p>With the Promo integration, you can choose from over three million clips, templates, and music options to use to create a video for your site directly from HubSpot. You can easily throw in custom messaging, branding, or logos to personalize the video for your business based on a specific prospect’s needs and interests, found under their specific contact in HubSpot.</p> \n<h2>Get Integrated to Grow Better</h2> \n<p>Integrations have the power to enhance all aspects of your business. No matter the software you use to run your company, you can find integrations that can help simplify your processes, optimize your efforts, and empower your fellow employees. So, find the right integration marketplace for your software and begin connecting to the applications suited for your business needs.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in July 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fintegrations&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 20 Oct 2020 12:17:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://docs.google.com/a/hubspot.com/drawings/d/svOKAAijuEee1UcTkqY-knQ/image?parent=1xU9AVbjLRDDV78t5W6AdknVJodSYBCEmypuNSfrElCk&rev=68&h=110&w=616&ac=1","linkMd5":"d4ef9771ed30b9f0eb0c7bab5575628c","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-45-802_c401d6fb0a1502f3.jpg","destWidth":0,"destHeight":0,"sourceBytes":17251,"destBytes":17251,"author":"krbaker@hubspot.com (Kristen Baker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://docs.google.com/a/hubspot.com/drawings/d/svOKAAijuEee1UcTkqY-knQ/image?parent=1xU9AVbjLRDDV78t5W6AdknVJodSYBCEmypuNSfrElCk&rev=68&h=110&w=616&ac=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-45-802_c401d6fb0a1502f3.jpg","https://docs.google.com/a/hubspot.com/drawings/d/srHPCIh1I_ca6aV951yxUfQ/image?parent=1xU9AVbjLRDDV78t5W6AdknVJodSYBCEmypuNSfrElCk&rev=132&h=125&w=624&ac=1":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn83@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-51-647_1171155196fba790.jpg","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fintegrations&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn45@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-59-715_373d9b73f409c2d9.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624901},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"Learning SEO? The Beginner's List of Resources to Get Started","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo","description":"<p>You can't get a degree in SEO. Books on SEO quickly become out-of-date.</p> \n<p>Plus, there are hundreds of thousands of self-professed \"SEO experts\" out there, but far fewer people who actually understand what they're talking about, and can apply it.</p> \n<p>And you can't swing a spreadsheet without hitting an article about SEO that's either misleading, or just plain wrong.</p> \n<p>So — how do you learn about SEO? Luckily, there <em>are </em>resources you can count on to always have trustworthy, valuable, and well-researched information.</p> \n<p>To help you find them, I've put together a huge list of credible SEO resources in every category. If it's on this list, you can trust what it says.</p> \n<p>Please note: If you try to listen, read, or engage with every resource on this list, you'll never have time for anything else. Think of it like a buffet — take a few things from the podcast section, enroll in a course or two, subscribe to three or four blogs ... you get the drift.</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo#seo-podcasts\">SEO Podcasts</a></strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo#seo-newsletters\">SEO Newsletters</a></strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo#seo-courses\">SEO Courses</a></strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo#seo-blogs\">SEO Blogs</a></strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo#seo-slack-groups\">SEO Slack groups</a></strong></li> \n <li><strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/learn-seo#seo-subreddits\">SEO Subreddits</a></strong></li> \n</ul> \n<p></p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>SEO Podcasts</strong></h2> \n<p>In the past few years, there's been an explosion of high-quality SEO-focused podcasts — which is great for anyone with a commute, dog who requires walking, partiality for learning on the go, or all of the above.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/podcasts/skill-up\">Skill Up</a></h3> \n<p>HubSpot's first season of Skill Up is all about SEO. In this series, HubSpot Director of Acquisition (and co-founder of <a href=\"https://trafficthinktank.com/\">Traffic Think Tank</a>) Matthew Howells-Barby and Academy professor Jorie Munroe dive into everything a search-oriented marketer or SEO needs to know this year. They start with searcher intent, move to modern ranking and conversion strategies, review international SEO, share successful link-building plays, and end with the future of SEO.</p> \n<p>Not too shabby for less than six hours of content.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://webmasterradio.fm/shows/seo-101/\">SEO 101</a></h3> \n<p>This beginner-friendly show is designed to familiarize you with SEO concepts and best practices without overwhelming you with information. Each episode covers a few different topics. For example, <a href=\"https://webmasterradio.fm/episode/seo-101-ep-350-seo-for-image-search-domain-authority-javascript-and-seo\">episode 350</a> goes over image search, the validity of Moz's Domain Authority score, and JavaScript and SEO.</p> \n<p>It's a good pick if you're just getting your feet wet.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"http://www.evolvingseo.com/category/podcast/\">Experts on the Wire</a></h3> \n<p>On this podcast, SEO expert and consultant Dan Shure interviews big names and fresh faces in search. Former guests include AJ Kohn, Dawn Anderson, Marie Haynes, Barry Schwartz, Kevin Indig, and more. And as that lineup suggests, Experts on the Wire covers a diverse range of topics — from mobile-first indexing and structured data to unique link-building strategies and even SEO for the music industry.</p> \n<p>The episodes typically run an hour to an hour and a half. There are currently more than 110 in the archive, so if you enjoy this show, you've got a lot to listen to.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/the-authority-hacker-podcast/id1073349789\">Authority Hacker</a></h3> \n<p>Is SEO just one piece of the puzzle for you? Authority Hacker might be the podcast for you. The hosts, Gael Breton and Mark Webster, draw heavily on their own experiences running effective online businesses.</p> \n<p>You'll learn how to drive traffic to your store or website, nurture those visitors, and convert them into customers. Breton and Webster drop tons of SEO nuggets, but there's also lots of general advice, like how to hire a solid team, pick an expanding niche, or set your own salary.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>SEO Newsletters</strong></h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.kevin-indig.com/tech-bound/\">Tech Bound</a></h3> \n<p>I'm always excited to see a fresh edition of Kevin Indig's Tech Bound newsletter in my inbox.</p> \n<p>Each week, Indig dissects a trend, idea, or piece of marketing news. To give you an idea, past newsletters have covered Google's push into the online travel agency (OTA) market, how to hire a great digital marketing team, and takeaways from Google's near-constant algorithm tweaks.</p> \n<p>He also shares several links from around the web worth reading.</p> \n<p>Indig has also started doing a lot of interviews (which he shares with the Tech Bound audience weeks before publishing them elsewhere). Previous interviewees include the former Director of SEO for eBay and Nick Eubanks, co-founder of Traffic Think Tank and FromTheFuture (there's some list overlap here!).</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://sparktoro.com/trending\">SparkToro Trending</a></h3> \n<p>Here's how it goes most weeks:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>10 a.m.: I see a cool link on SparkToro Trending</li> \n <li>11 a.m.: Someone shares the same link in HubSpot's SEO Slack channel</li> \n <li>12 p.m.: I log onto Twitter and see several people I follow have tweeted the same link</li> \n <li>4 p.m.: Someone shares the same link in one of the SEO Slack channels I'm in</li> \n</ul> \n<p>In other words, if something appears on SparkToro's list of buzzy articles or tools, it's usually something I should be reading — which makes sense, as links are algorithmically chosen based on their popularity with the SEO and marketing Twitter community.</p> \n<p>If you don't want to get addicted to refreshing Trending, subscribe to the email newsletter. You'll get the top links in your inbox every Tuesday and Friday.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://nickleroy.com/newsletter/\">#SEOForLunch</a></h3> \n<p>#SEOForLunch, a weekly newsletter from Nick LeRoy, has a great format. LeRoy shares a timely link, tells you what's important about said article, then gives you his take.</p> \n<p>Following that, he recommends four to five posts from around the web worth your time.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://tldrmarketing.com/\">tl;dr Marketing</a></h3> \n<p>In newsletter years, tl;dr Marketing has definitely been around a while — this one's been going strong since 2015. It's a curated collection of articles and resources that's perfect if you're short on time: each link has a straightforward explanation tagged by topic, so if you're not interested in, say, social media, you can skip over anything with that tag.</p> \n<p>Absorb information best when you've got some visuals? Good news, there's plenty of screenshots in tl;dr.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>SEO Courses</strong></h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/build-search-insights-report\">How to Build a Search Insights Report to Grow Organic Traffic to Your Blog</a></h3> \n<p>Want to learn how to recreate the process that helped HubSpot grow organic traffic to its blog by several million users per month in just a year? In this Academy course, I'll walk you through the exact workflow we use, sharing examples and actionable tips along the way.</p> \n<p>It's broken up into two sections: the fundamentals of an effective content strategy, and building your own Search Insights Report.</p> \n<p>Each lesson includes a few interactive exercises, making the process of putting together a Search Insights Report for your own property much simpler and more straightforward.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/seo-training\">SEO Training</a></h3> \n<p>For a higher-level intro to SEO, try HubSpot's free SEO course.</p> \n<p>It takes a little over an hour and a half to complete. In that time, you'll discover how to determine your site's SEO potential and develop a strategy, create content that'll rank, and build links to that content.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://academy.serpstat.com/\">Serpstat Academy</a></h3> \n<p>You don't need to use Serpstat's SEO platform to take any of its short courses, which include Advanced Competitor Research, Backlink Analysis, How to Cold Pitch SEO courses, and more. While most of the lessons incorporate Serpstat, you can easily recreate the processes in the tool of your own choice.</p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/academy/\">Google Analytics Academy</a></h3> \n<p>If you're in SEO, you're almost certainly using Google Analytics. Google provides several different courses for getting yourself up to speed or taking your skills to the next level:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/academy/course/6\">Google Analytics for Beginners</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/academy/course/7\">Advanced Google Analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/academy/course/9\">Google Analytics for Power Users</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/academy/course/8\">Getting Started With Google Analytics 360</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>Successfully completing these courses will earn you certifications, which will boost your application during the job search.</p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://academy.moz.com/\">Moz Academy</a></h3> \n<p>Each of Moz's 16 paid courses cover a different fundamental aspect of SEO: local SEO, reporting, on-page optimization, backlinks, keyword research, etc. The price of each course ranges from $49 (SEO fundamentals) to $595 (also SEO fundamentals, but with a certificate for completion).</p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://www.semrush.com/newacademy/\">SEMrush Academy</a></h3> \n<p>Like the other options on our list, SEMrush offers both courses and certifications. The cool thing about the latter? If you don't want to take the course before getting certified, you can take the exam immediately. This is a fun way of testing your knowledge in different areas of SEO — especially if you're preparing for an upcoming interview.</p> \n<p>But back to the courses. Along with the usual suspects of topics (keyword research, link building, rank tracking, and so on), SEMrush also has courses on social media fundamentals, reporting and project management, and PPC.</p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://www.distilled.net/u/\">DistilledU</a></h3> \n<p>Distilled's online \"SEO university\" encompasses two courses: an intro to SEO course that covers topics like information architecture, competitive research, and on-page SEO, and an intermediate one that goes over Excel skills, HTML, international SEO, and more.</p> \n<p>Examples and exercises are weaved in throughout the videos, which makes the content more engaging and sticky.</p> \n<p>Access costs $33 to $44 per month, depending on your plan. That might sound steep (especially considering many of the other courses on this list are free), but you also get to see every presentation given at SearchLove events — a well-regarded series Distilled runs. It's like a conference ticket that never expires.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>SEO Blogs</strong></h2> \n<p>Starting my career in blogging may have biased me, but blogs are by far my favorite way to keep up on SEO trends, new strategies, and interesting case studies.</p> \n<p>For better or for worse, there's far more <em>great </em>content out there than you could possibly read — even if you did nothing else. Below are my favorite blogs (but please keep in mind, just because one isn't on this list doesn't mean it's unworthy of your time):</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://searchengineland.com/\">Search Engine Land</a></h3> \n<p>Whenever I'm looking for \"breaking news\" in the SEO world, I head to Search Engine Land. This website always has the latest information on all things search, from algorithm updates (both confirmed and unconfirmed) to Google My Business updates and DuckDuckGo changes.</p> \n<p>There's also a good mix of evergreen content and opinion pieces.</p> \n<p>One last note: You know a site is great when its founder decides to move on — and <a href=\"https://searchengineland.com/video-danny-sullivan-google-public-liaison-of-search-on-his-transition-from-search-engine-land-to-google-324855\">take a job as Google's Public Search Liaison</a>. If that's not a sign of authority, I don't know what is.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://searchengineland.com/seotable\">The Periodic Table of SEO Factors (updated for 2019)</a> (This is downloaded over 50,000 times <em>a year</em>)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://searchengineland.com/how-to-prioritize-seo-tasks-by-impact-301409\">How to prioritize SEO tasks by impact</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://searchengineland.com/heres-what-happened-when-i-followed-googlebot-for-3-months-308674\">Here's what happened when I followed Googlebot for 3 months</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/\">Search Engine Journal</a></h3> \n<p>Search Engine Journal is another reliable source for the latest news in SEO, SEM, and social media. Several posts are published each day — typically one more timely article, such as <a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/google-chrome-speed-badges/335261/\">\"Chrome May Warn Users of Slow Pages Before They Click,\"</a> and two or three evergreen pieces, like <a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/website-bounce-rate/332439/\">\"11 Reasons Your Website Can Have a High Bounce Rate.\"</a></p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/how-to-choose-domain-name/252285/\">How to Choose a Domain Name That Will Stand the Test of Time</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/seo-guide/search-authority/\">The Three Pillars of SEO: Authority, Relevance, and Trust</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.searchenginejournal.com/seo-101/seo-experts/\">140 Top SEO Experts You Should Be Following in 2019</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.seroundtable.com/\">Search Engine Roundtable</a></h3> \n<p>Barry Schwartz — who also contributes frequently to SEJ — runs this forum coverage site. What does \"forum coverage\" mean? Schwartz reports on the most relevant, interesting SEO discussions happening around the web.</p> \n<p>And it's not just a recap. He connects the conversation to a larger trend or idea, so you always understand how it fits into the big picture.</p> \n<p>There are also lots of fun pictures from the Google offices (it's nice to remember there are people behind the algorithm!).</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.seroundtable.com/vlog-025-28514.html\">Vlog #25: Danny Sullivan On Working At Google &amp; What He Sees Differently Now</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.seroundtable.com/vlog-022-28447.html\">Vlog #22: Eric Enge On SEO Testing, Structuring Content &amp; Managing Client Expectations</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.seroundtable.com/google-bert-no-optimization-28435.html\">Google: There Is Nothing To Optimize For With BERT</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://www.distilled.net/resources/\">Distilled.net</a></h3> \n<p>Distilled, an online marketing agency, has a reputation for running a fantastic advanced SEO conference where every session is valuable and fresh — and its blog is no different.</p> \n<p>From in-depth posts on technical SEO best practices and tool tutorials to thoughtful opinion pieces, Distilled's blog is a gold mine.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.distilled.net/technical-seo-audit-checklist/\">Comprehensive Technical SEO Audit</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.distilled.net/difference-between-url-structure-and-information-architecture/\">Search basics: the difference between URL structure and Information Architecture</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.distilled.net/how-to-present-recommendations/\">How to Present a Recommendation</a> (these tips completely changed how I deliver recommendations both at HubSpot and with freelance clients!)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"http://www.blindfiveyearold.com/\">Blind Five Year Old</a></h3> \n<p>I try to read everything written by AJ Kohn, owner of SEO agency Blind Five Year Old. It's just that good. His posts are thought-provoking, insightful, and meaty. As if that weren't enough, he's funny!</p> \n<p>Kohn doesn't publish too often — probably because each post is typically a mini-thesis — so I recommend going through the archives and then making sure you keep up with his new stuff.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"http://www.blindfiveyearold.com/algorithm-analysis-in-the-age-of-embeddings\">Algorithm Analysis in the Age of Embeddings</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://www.blindfiveyearold.com/the-invisible-attribution-model-of-link-acquisition\">The Invisible Attribution Model of Link Acquisition</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://www.blindfiveyearold.com/analyzing-position-in-google-search-console\">Analyzing Position in Google Search Console</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://moz.com/blog\">Moz</a></h3> \n<p>Who <em>hasn't </em>cut their teeth on the Moz blog? It's a classic for a reason. Imagine you're in a meeting with your developers, and they hit you with a question about hreflang tags. You have no idea what an hreflang tag is — sounds like an unsuccessful sneeze — but you also know this is a tough crowd, and if you're clueless, you'll lose valuable internal capital.</p> \n<p>So you quickly search \"what are hreflang tags\", find a Moz post, skim it, and glean enough in 15 seconds to look up and announce confidently, \"Yes, we should use hreflang tags to help users searching in different languages find the localized pages on our site.\"</p> \n<p>That's what Moz content does: it saves the day when you need to know something, ASAP. In addition to clear, comprehensive, trustworthy content, you should also check out Whiteboard Fridays. These weekly videos always break down interesting and relevant topics.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://moz.com/beginners-guide-to-seo\">Beginner's Guide to SEO</a> (If you haven't read this, are you really <em>in </em>SEO?)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://moz.com/blog/machine-learning-101\">Machine Learning 101 - Whiteboard Friday</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://moz.com/blog/how-to-create-10x-content-whiteboard-friday\">How to Create 10x Content - Whiteboard Friday</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/\">HubSpot</a></h3> \n<p>Our team has doubled down on posts about SEO in the past two years, and I'm proud of the results. Content falls into two main categories: experiments/case studies and best practices/foundational concepts.</p> \n<p>This seminal <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/content-marketing-strategy\">post on topic clusters</a> influenced an industry-wide shift in how websites organized their content, while this early <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/historical-blog-seo-conversion-optimization\">post on updating old content</a> helped marketers optimize their existing pages before that was a tried-and-true conference topic.</p> \n<p>You can browse all of our SEO-related content — organized by level of expertise — on our <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/topic-learning-path/seo\">SEO Topic Learning Path</a> or check out the recommended articles below.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-we-octupled-image-search-traffic-on-the-blog\">How We Octupled Image Search Traffic to the HubSpot Blog in 1 Year</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/technical-seo-guide\">The Ultimate Guide to Technical SEO</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-analytics\">The Ultimate Guide to Google Analytics</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.seerinteractive.com/blog\">Seer Interactive</a></h3> \n<p>Seer Interactive, a digital marketing agency, publishes new posts nearly every day—and proving that quantity doesn't need to come at the expense of quality, all the content is helpful, easy to read, and most importantly, well-researched.</p> \n<p>Many of their in-depth guides are in my bookmarks.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.seerinteractive.com/blog/data-studio-tips-for-non-designers/\">Data Studio Tips for Non-Designers</a> (this helped me put together some stunning reports)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.seerinteractive.com/blog/how-to-calculate-your-own-click-through-rate/\">How to Calculate Your Own Click-Through Rate</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.seerinteractive.com/blog/screaming-frog-guide/\">Screaming Frog Guide to Doing Almost Anything: 55+ Ways of Looking at a Tool</a> (if you're new to Screaming Frog, this article is gold)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://sparktoro.com/blog/\">SparkToro</a></h3> \n<p>Officially, this is the SparkToro blog — but it's called Rand's Blog, and Rand Fishkin is the only one who posts.</p> \n<p>Which is cool, because it means you get a lot of (thoughtful, well-argued) opinions in the mix, along with interesting data and case studies.</p> \n<p>Fishkin shoots from the hip, and the industry is better for it.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://sparktoro.com/blog/less-than-half-of-google-searches-now-result-in-a-click/\">Less than Half of Google Searches Now Result in a Click</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://sparktoro.com/blog/demand-creation/\">Why Web Marketers Should Invest in Demand Creation</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://sparktoro.com/blog/can-you-still-blog-your-way-to-visibility-credibility/\">Can You Still Blog Your Way to Visibility &amp; Credibility?</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"http://www.seobythesea.com/\">SEO by the Sea</a></h3> \n<p>A lot of SEO blogs regurgitate the same ol' tips and tricks that everyone else is sharing. Not SEO by the SEA.</p> \n<p>On this blog, Director of SEO Research at Go Fish Digital Bill Slawski summarizes and explains SEO-related patents. I won't lie, sometimes I have to read his posts a few times for the information to sink in, but it's always worth it.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"http://www.seobythesea.com/2006/10/20-ways-search-engines-may-rerank-search-results/\">20 Ways Search Engines May Rerank Search Results</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://www.seobythesea.com/2019/07/how-google-may-handle-question-answering-when-facts-are-missing/\">How Google May Handle Question Answering when Facts are Missing</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"http://www.seobythesea.com/2019/07/how-google-may-handle-question-answering-when-facts-are-missing/\">Using Ngram Phrase Models to Generate Site Quality Scores</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/\">Google Webmaster Central Blog</a></h3> \n<p>To stay on top of all the latest announcements from Google, check out the official webmaster blog. Every time a big change comes out — like when <a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2019/09/making-review-rich-results-more-helpful.html\">Google decreed you could only use the stars review schema for businesses that </a><a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2019/09/making-review-rich-results-more-helpful.html\">weren't </a><a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2019/09/making-review-rich-results-more-helpful.html\">yours</a> — the SEO community publishes hundreds of hot takes, analyses, and predictions.</p> \n<p>Follow-up posts are definitely worth looking at, but I recommend always going to the Google announcement first. Some takes are less accurate than others. If you've read the original post, you won't be misled.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2018/03/rolling-out-mobile-first-indexing.html\">Rolling out mobile-first indexing</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2019/08/core-updates.html\">What webmasters should know about Google's core updates</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://webmasters.googleblog.com/2019/05/the-new-evergreen-googlebot.html\">The new evergreen Googlebot</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>12. <a href=\"https://www.mariehaynes.com/blog/\">Marie Haynes</a></h3> \n<p>I discovered Marie Haynes in the aftermath of the August 2018 \"core update\" — a.k.a. The MEDIC update. Haynes published an incredible <a href=\"https://www.mariehaynes.com/the-august-1-2018-google-update-strongly-affected-ymyl-sites/\">analysis of MEDIC</a> that was shared, well, everywhere.</p> \n<p>She's become one of my go-to sources for learning more about specific algorithm updates and changes.</p> \n<p>Recommended posts:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.mariehaynes.com/eat/\">E-A-T and SEO</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.mariehaynes.com/google-updated-qrg-quality-2019/\">What can Google's Updated QRG tell us about quality in 2019?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.mariehaynes.com/june-3-2019-core-quality-update/\">The June 3, 2019 Core Quality Update was a big one</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>13. <a href=\"https://builtvisible.com/blog/\">Builtvisible</a></h3> \n<p>Digital agency Builtvisible's blog posts always manage to demystify confusing and technical topics in just a few thousand words.</p> \n<p>The team also has a knack for publishing primers on interesting topics just as I'm thinking, \"It would be useful to know how to do X,\" or, \"I waste so much time on Y.\"</p> \n<p>If you want to work smarter, this blog will be invaluable.</p> \n<p>Recommended posts:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://builtvisible.com/seo-guide-to-xpath/\">An SEO's guide to XPath</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://builtvisible.com/log-file-analysis/\">The Ultimate Guide to Log File Analysis</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://builtvisible.com/how-to-use-google-advanced-search-operators-to-find-indexation-and-technical-seo-issues/\">How to use Google advanced search operators to find indexation and technical SEO issues</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>14. <a href=\"https://searchwilderness.com/\">Search Wilderness</a></h3> \n<p>Paul Shapiro posts new content to Search Wilderness a few times a year. And I don't blame him — he's got a full plate! He's head of SEO for Catalyst, co-runs <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/bigseo/\">/r/BigSEO</a>, and founded the <a href=\"https://onlinegeniuses.com/\">Online Geniuses</a> Slack community.</p> \n<p>His credentials probably give you a good idea why the posts that <em>do </em>come out are worth every minute of your time.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://searchwilderness.com/keyword-tagging/\">How to tag your keywords 10X faster and beat your SEO competition on insights</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://searchwilderness.com/google-trends-api-slope/\">Calculate Keyword Growth Using Google Trends, Python, and the Slope Formula</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>15. <a href=\"https://www.onely.com/blog/\">Onely</a></h3> \n<p>Confused by the impact JavaScript has on SEO? Yeah, me too. Onely's blog has been a lifesaver. The technical SEO agency publishes a lot of JavaScript-related content, from introductory guides to experiments and case studies.</p> \n<p>Because Onely does so much work around JavaScript SEO, they have plenty of current data and examples to share.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.onely.com/blog/how-much-content-not-indexed-google-2019/\">How Much Content is Not Indexed in Google in 2019?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.onely.com/blog/javascript-seo-backfire-hulu-com-case-study/\">JavaScript &amp; SEO Backfire – A Hulu.com Case Study</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.onely.com/blog/giphys-visibility-drops-conspiracy-or-consequence/\">Giphy's Visibility Drops: Conspiracy or Consequence?</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>16. <a href=\"https://www.siegemedia.com/blog\">Siege Media</a></h3> \n<p>The Siege Media blog sure is easy on the eyes. But even if the design looked straight out of 2009, I'd still read it: because the content is also really, really good.</p> \n<p>Posts range from detailed case studies and expert round-ups to best practices and guides. You'll also find a lot of videos and podcasts (with transcripts and time stamps, in case you prefer reading to watching or listening).</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.siegemedia.com/seo/image-snippets-on-mobile\">How to Get Image Snippets on Mobile</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.siegemedia.com/seo/skyscraper-technique\">When and Why the Skyscraper Technique Can Fail</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.siegemedia.com/strategy/2x-content-not-10x-content\">Why You Need 2x Content Not 10x Content</a> (interesting countertake to <a href=\"https://moz.com/blog/how-to-create-10x-content-whiteboard-friday\">the Moz post</a> I recommended above)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>17. <a href=\"https://www.portent.com/blog\">Portent</a></h3> \n<p>Portent, a digital marketing agency, puts out a great range of content. From podcasting and link-building to Amazon and PPC, its blog will be useful to every type of marketer.</p> \n<p>We're here, however, for the SEO posts, and luckily, Portent has that in spades. Like the best SEO advice, it's simple (to read) but sophisticated (in practice).</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.portent.com/blog/seo/developers-seo-guide.htm\">A Developer's Guide To SEO</a> (this should be required reading for every SEO, designer, and developer)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.portent.com/blog/analytics/how-to-choose-attribution-models.htm\">How to Choose the Right Attribution Model for Your Vertical</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.portent.com/blog/seo/long-tail-seo-101-defined.htm\">SEO 101: Defining the long tail</a> (a critical concept that I don't hear talked about much)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>18. <a href=\"https://www.annielytics.com/\">Annielytics</a></h3> \n<p>To brush up on your analytical skills — or take them to the next level — beeline to Annie Cushing's blog. Cushing just released a book series called <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Making-Data-Sexy-Step-Step/dp/1733049118\">Making Data Sexy</a>, so rest assured she knows her stuff.</p> \n<p>While her blog was fairly quiet while she worked on the book, the archives are chock-full of great resources.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.annielytics.com/blog/analytics/regular-expressions-dont-use-google-analytics-without-them/\">Regular Expressions: Don't Use Google Analytics Without Them</a> (Everyone in SEO should know RegEx)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.annielytics.com/blog/excel-tips/how-to-pull-domains-out-of-a-list-of-urls-in-excel-video/\">How To Pull Domains Out Of A List Of URLs In Excel [VIDEO]</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.annielytics.com/blog/excel-tips/excels-index-match-alternative-vlookup-marketers-video/\">Excel's INDEX MATCH Alternative To VLOOKUP For Marketers [VIDEO]</a> (Not to be hyperbolic, but Index Match has changed my life)</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>19. <a href=\"https://gofishdigital.com/blog/\">Go Fish Digital</a></h3> \n<p>This digital marketing and reputation management agency has educated SEOs and marketers since 2009.</p> \n<p>Bill Slawski, the agency's director of SEO research (and author of SEO by the SEA, which is also on this list) publishes lots of great technical SEO content, like <a href=\"https://gofishdigital.com/contextual-knowledge-panels-at-google/\">Contextual Knowledge Panels at Google</a> and <a href=\"https://gofishdigital.com/a-crowdsourcing-evaluation-of-clustered-search-results/\">A Crowdsourcing Evaluation of Clustered Search Results</a>. (There's no overlap between Slawski's articles for Go Fish Digital and his own blog — he's just prolific.)</p> \n<p>You'll also find posts from other members of the team, from intern Kalina McKay (<a href=\"https://gofishdigital.com/guide-first-link-building-campaign-go-fish-digital/\">An Intro to Your First Link Building Campaign</a>) to COO Daniel Russell (<a href=\"https://gofishdigital.com/article-11-impact-search-engine-optimization/\">What Does Article 11 or \"The Link Tax\" Mean for SEO in the EU</a>).</p> \n<p>Many companies <em>say </em>they have a content-driven culture; Go Fish Digital actually walks the walk.</p> \n<p>Recommended article (in addition to the ones linked above):</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://gofishdigital.com/new-universal-search-results/\">Google's New Universal Search Results</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>20. <a href=\"https://www.sterlingsky.ca/blog/\">Sterling Sky</a></h3> \n<p>Joy Hakwins is one of the foremost experts on local SEO and Google My Business — and luckily for everyone who works in local search, she frequently publishes her wisdom to her agency's blog.</p> \n<p>You'll appreciate Hawkins and her team members' clear, matter-of-fact writing style as they demystify confusing, often contradictory Google My Business policies and local SEO best practices.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.sterlingsky.ca/interpret-google-business-gmb-insights/\">How to Interpret Google My Business (GMB) Insights</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.sterlingsky.ca/multiple-google-my-business-listings/\">When Can Service-Based Businesses Have Multiple Google My Business Listings?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.sterlingsky.ca/2019-local-seo-black-belt-quiz/\">[Quiz] The 2019 Local SEO Black Belt Quiz</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>21. <a href=\"https://www.deepcrawl.com/blog/\">DeepCrawl</a></h3> \n<p>I've never attended a Google Webmaster Hangout live, but I've read nearly every recap DeepCrawl has posted. The company has recapped nearly virtual Hangout for more than five years.</p> \n<p>These recaps alone are worth the price of admission (or subscription), but you'll also find interviews with experts, best practices, and explanations of fundamental SEO concepts.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.deepcrawl.com/blog/tag/google-webmaster-central-hangout/\">Webmaster Hangout recaps</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.deepcrawl.com/knowledge/technical-seo-library/search-engine-crawling/\">How Do Search Engine Crawlers Work?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.deepcrawl.com/blog/events/hamlet-batista-automated-text-generation-q-and-a/\">Ask the Expert: Hamlet Batista Answers Your Automated Text Generation Questions</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>22. <a href=\"https://www.botify.com/blog\">Botify</a></h3> \n<p>Want technical SEO and nothing but technical SEO? You'll appreciate the Botify blog. Apart from the occasional product-focused announcement, every blog post is tactical, in-depth, and data-backed.</p> \n<p>Most articles include step-by-step instructions and screenshots, as well as handy breakdowns of relevant ideas or terms. Check this blog out when you're looking for inspiration or experiment ideas.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.botify.com/blog/orphan-pages\">Orphan Pages and SEO: Stop Hurting Yourself</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.botify.com/blog/page-click-depth-ranking-factor\">Is Page Depth a Ranking Factor?</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.botify.com/blog/from-crawl-budget-to-render-budget\">From Crawl Budget to Render Budget: How to Be an SEO in the Age of JavaScript</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>23. <a href=\"https://merj.com/blog\">Merj</a></h3> \n<p>Hat tip to Ahrefs for introducing me to this blog. Every month, Merj publishes a roundup of technical SEO news, such as, \"New Features Described in Chrome 76 Beta,\" and \"Wayback Machine Adds Changes Feature.\"</p> \n<p>If you're coming back from vacation, an intense, heads-down work period, or a cruise with no internet access, it's a fantastic resource for catching up again.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles (in addition to the monthly roundup):</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://merj.com/blog/dynamic-classifications-with-excel-lookup-and-search\">Dynamic Classifications with Excel: LOOKUP + SEARCH</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://merj.com/blog/technical-seo-teardown-of-uniqlo\">A Technical SEO Teardown of UNIQLO</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>24. <a href=\"https://www.gsqi.com/marketing-blog/\">Internet Marketing Driver</a></h3> \n<p>Glenn Gabe, who leads the internet marketing agency GSQi, started this blog in 2012. Impressively, since then he's published at least once a month — usually more. His posts are in-depth, conversational, and packed with informative screenshots.</p> \n<p>Gabe specializes in Google algorithm changes and SERP updates, analyzing victims and victors with a true zeal. He also shares SEO tool recommendations, improvements, and use cases.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.gsqi.com/marketing-blog/lyrics-in-serps-google-case-study/\">When The Hammer Falls – Analyzing Lyrics in the Google SERPs and Its Impact on Traffic [Case Study]</a> (From 2015, but still incredibly relevant)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.gsqi.com/marketing-blog/remove-versus-improve-low-quality-thin-content/\">Should You Remove Low-Quality Or Thin Content Versus Improving It? Seeing The Forest Through The Trees</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.gsqi.com/marketing-blog/how-to-use-google-analytics-understand-user-happiness/\">How To Use Scroll Depth Tracking, Adjusted Bounce Rate, and Average Time On Page As A Proxy For User Engagement and Content Quality</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>25. <a href=\"https://ipullrank.com/blog/\">iPullRank</a></h3> \n<p>The iPullRank blog comes to you from the fine folks at the eponymous digital marketing agency. It has a healthy mix of marketing content, from local SEO and link building to UX and PR, and features custom videos, infographics, and visuals.</p> \n<p>New posts go up approximately three times per month.</p> \n<p>Recommended articles:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://ipullrank.com/your-analytics-data-isnt-real-and-its-only-getting-worse/\">Your Analytics Data Isn't Real And It's Only Getting Worse</a> (the analytics apocalypse is here — get ready!)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://ipullrank.com/mobile-ux-75-best-practices-for-a-masterful-mobile-web/\">Mobile UX: 75 Best Practices For A Masterful Mobile Web</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://ipullrank.com/10-ways-brands-forfeit-their-branded-search/\">10 Ways Brands Forfeit Their Branded Search</a></li> \n</ul> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>SEO Slack Groups</strong></h2> \n<p>SEO Slack communities are fantastic platforms for meeting other professionals, hearing about job opportunities and/or recruiting for your own team, sharing and discovering resources, and, of course, learning.</p> \n<p>In my experience, there is <em>too </em>much of a good thing. If you're a member of several active groups, you might be overwhelmed by all the information and discussion. I'd recommend being an active participant in one or two groups versus a somewhat silent member of three or four.</p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://twitter.com/techseowomen\">Women in Tech SEO</a></h3> \n<p>I'm a member — and ardent supporter — of the Women in Tech SEO Slack group. Areej Abuali, the founder and leader, does a great job leading virtual meetups, moderating conversations, and keeping the group active.</p> \n<p>Channels include Coding, Events, Analytics, Jobs, and Motivation.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://trafficthinktank.com/\">Traffic Think Tank</a></h3> \n<p>Traffic Think Tank is a private community of SEOs that's available for a monthly or yearly fee. The content is designed to more than pay for itself — in addition to a network of marketers, consultants, and business leaders, you also get access to Q&amp;As and webinars with the founders, as well as 300+ hours of tutorials, templates, and other resources.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://onlinegeniuses.com/\">Online Geniuses</a></h3> \n<p>This free SEO and marketing-focused community has more than 20,000 members. That scale can be both overwhelming and invaluable — while you may need to log off every now and again, the size means you can join local events, learn from hundreds of other people with your job title or facing similar challenges, and participate in AMAs with the likes of Nir Eyal and Guy Kawasaki.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>SEO Subreddits</strong></h2> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/bigseo/\">/BigSEO</a></h3> \n<p>More than 43,000 people belong to this subreddit, which, despite the name, encourages discussion and debate about all things inbound marketing. However, I've noticed most people tend to stick to SEO.</p> \n<p>The most popular posts get anywhere between 20 and 300 comments; not bad for a more niche subreddit. While the quality of the advice can vary (as you'd expect from any open community), <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/bigseo/wiki/amas\">the AMAs</a> are consistently excellent. Previous guests include Rand Fishkin, Aleyda Solis, and Bill Slawski.</p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/TechSEO/\">/TechSEO</a></h3> \n<p>TechSEO is far smaller than /BigSEO, hovering around 6,500 members. Its focus is \"the tech nerd side of SEO.\"</p> \n<p>This subreddit also hosts a lot of AMAs. There's some overlap with the guests on /BigSEO; however, /TechSEO has also gotten <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/TechSEO/collection/07fc4c2c-c580-4cc0-86cf-5cdec9c45508\">Alexis Sanders, Gary Illyes, and John Meuller</a>.</p> \n<p>If you're looking for a good place to find and share technical resources, ask advanced questions, and learn from the tech SEO greats, join this subreddit.</p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/SEO\">/SEO</a></h3> \n<p>At 113,000 subscribers, /SEO is the largest subreddit of the group. That's both a blessing and a curse: the typical posts gets more engagement, but there's more misinformation.</p> \n<p>/SEO does not host official AMAs, although occasionally someone will do an impromptu one (like <a href=\"https://www.reddit.com/r/SEO/comments/ahuzme/ama_seod_a_site_from_0mo_to_30000mo_in_earnings/\">AMA: SEO'd a site from $0/mo to $30,000/mo in earnings within 3 years</a>).</p> \n<p>Newer SEOs will get the most out of this subreddit.</p> \n<p>I hope this helps you as you continue to learn more about SEO. If you've discovered a helpful resource from the list, let me know on Twitter @ajavuu.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Flearn-seo&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 27 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"62c93f77e917bb784194d7045060114b","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"afrost@hubspot.com (Aja Frost)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Flearn-seo&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn36@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-48-749_8b5d2db60d41e99a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624885},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"How to Post to Instagram From Your Computer [6 Easy Steps]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/post-to-instagram-from-computer","description":"<p>I'll admit it: this post is incredibly timely for me.</p> \n<p>I recently watched <a href=\"https://www.imdb.com/title/tt11464826/\" style=\"font-style: italic;\">The Social Dilemma</a> on Netflix, a docu-drama that explores the potentially addictive qualities of social media.</p> \n<p>Considering I spend 3+ hours a day on Instagram, I was already all-too-familiar with the habit-forming nature of social media apps.</p> \n<p>As a result of watching the film, I immediately deleted the Instagram app from my phone — but not my computer. I'm still allowing myself to check out friends' posts, or post my own content, via my desktop. I just don't want it within easy reach on my phone.</p> \n<p>If you'd prefer to post your Instagram content from a computer, you're in luck. Here, we'll explore how you can post images and videos from your desktop computer.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2><strong>Can I post to Instagram from my computer?</strong></h2> \n<p>Yes, you can post to Instagram from your PC or Mac desktop, as well as a browser on your phone instead of in-app.</p> \n<p>Instagram doesn't offer an official desktop desktop version, however. The social platform is primarily meant to be consumed in-app, which means some features can be a little trickier from your computer.</p> \n<p>Having said that, it's absolutely possible to post to Instagram from your computer. There are a few different reasons you might want to do this — for one, if you work as your company's social media manager, it might be easier to upload company posts and videos via your desktop, rather than having your smartphone open at work.</p> \n<p>Plus, your company's files might be more easily accessible via desktop than mobile. For instance, if you use Photoshop to edit company photos, it's likely easier to click \"Upload\" from your desktop when you're done editing, rather than sending that same photo or video to your personal phone.</p> \n<p>Alternatively, perhaps you simply prefer the larger screen of desktop. Or, maybe you don't have access to a smartphone so you can't download the app on your phone.</p> \n<p>Whatever the reason, don't worry — there's a solution for you. Let's dive into that, next.</p> \n<h2><strong>How do I post to Instagram from my computer? [PC and Mac]</strong></h2> \n<h3>How to Post a Photo on Chrome Browser</h3> \n<p><strong>1. Go to <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/\">https://www.instagram.com/</a> in your Chrome browser. Click on your Settings (click the three dots in the top right corner of your browser).</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/click%20on%20settings%20in%20chrome%20browser.png?width=2872&amp;name=click%20on%20settings%20in%20chrome%20browser.png\" alt=\"click on settings in chrome browser\" width=\"2872\" style=\"width: 2872px;\"></p> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><strong>Instagram Account Credit: @<a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/goodtomicha/\">Goodtomicha</a></strong></p> \n<p><strong>2. Scroll down to \"More Tools\" in the drop-down menu, and then click \"Developer Tools\".</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/find%20developer%20tools%20on%20google%20chrome%20copy.jpg?width=2862&amp;name=find%20developer%20tools%20on%20google%20chrome%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"find developer tools on google chrome copy\" width=\"2862\" style=\"width: 2862px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>3. Click the \"Toggle Device Toolbar\" mobile button.</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/clicking%20on%20mobile%20toggle%20to%20change%20the%20desktop%20version%20to%20mobile%20instagram%20copy.jpg?width=2876&amp;name=clicking%20on%20mobile%20toggle%20to%20change%20the%20desktop%20version%20to%20mobile%20instagram%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"clicking on mobile toggle to change the desktop version to mobile instagram copy\" width=\"2876\" style=\"width: 2876px;\"></p> \n<p><strong>4. Choose which mobile device you'd like on the drop-down menu, as well as how zoomed in you want to be. Then, r<span style=\"color: #33475b;\">efresh the page. Now, you're seeing the mobile interface of Instagram from your browser.</span></strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/changing%20responsive%20design%20on%20desktop%20so%20it%20resembles%20instagram%20on%20mobile%20copy.jpg?width=2876&amp;name=changing%20responsive%20design%20on%20desktop%20so%20it%20resembles%20instagram%20on%20mobile%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"changing responsive design on desktop so it resembles instagram on mobile copy\" width=\"2876\" style=\"width: 2876px;\"></p> \n<p><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">5.&nbsp;</span></strong><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">You can </span><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-post-on-instagram?_ga=2.232727451.546482764.1602518588-990910495.1602518588\">upload a Instagram post the same way you would via mobile</a><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"> — by clicking the \"+\" button:</span></strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/clicking%20add%20post%20on%20desktop%20.jpg?width=2876&amp;name=clicking%20add%20post%20on%20desktop%20.jpg\" alt=\"clicking add post on desktop \" width=\"2876\" style=\"width: 2876px;\"></span></p> \n<p><strong>Then, choose filters or other editing features like you would normally, then click \"Next\" in the top right of your screen:</strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/instagram%20filters%20on%20desktop.png?width=2864&amp;name=instagram%20filters%20on%20desktop.png\" alt=\"instagram filters on desktop\" width=\"2864\" style=\"width: 2864px;\"></span></p> \n<p><strong>Finally, add a caption, location, or tag people. When you're ready, click \"Share\" in the top right of your screen.</strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/typing%20a%20caption%20on%20my%20instagram%20post%20on%20desktop%20copy.jpg?width=2880&amp;name=typing%20a%20caption%20on%20my%20instagram%20post%20on%20desktop%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"typing a caption on my instagram post on desktop copy\" width=\"2880\" style=\"width: 2880px;\"></span></p> \n<h3>How to Post a Photo on Safari Browser</h3> \n<p><strong>1. Go to <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/\">https://www.instagram.com/</a> in your Safari browser. Select \"Safari\" and then \"Preferences\" in your menu bar.</strong></p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/safari%20prefences%20drop-down%20menu%20copy.jpg?width=2876&amp;name=safari%20prefences%20drop-down%20menu%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"safari prefences drop-down menu\" width=\"2876\" style=\"width: 2876px;\"><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">2. Toggle over to \"Advanced Features\" and check the box that reads \"Show develop menu in menu bar\".</span></strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/safari%20advanced%20preferences%20copy.jpg?width=1544&amp;name=safari%20advanced%20preferences%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"safari advanced preferences copy\" width=\"1544\" style=\"width: 1544px;\"></span></p> \n<p><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">3. Click \"Develop\" in your menu bar and then scroll to \"User Agent\". Choose which mobile device you'd like on the drop-down menu.</span></strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.11%20PM-min.png?width=2866&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.11%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 1.06.11 PM-min\" width=\"2866\" style=\"width: 2866px;\"></span></p> \n<p><strong><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">4. Refresh the page. Now, you're seeing the mobile interface of Instagram from your browser.</span></strong></p> \n<p><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.29%20PM-min.png?width=2666&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.29%20PM-min.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 1.06.29 PM-min\" width=\"2666\" style=\"width: 2666px;\"></span></p> \n<p><em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\">(From here on, the instructions for posting an image to Instagram are the same as they are for the Chrome browser instructions, listed above. You can upload a Instagram post the same way you would via mobile — by clicking the \"+\" button, adding a filter or editing the photo, adding a location and caption, and clicking \"Share\" when you're ready for your post to go live.)</span></em><span style=\"color: #33475b;\"></span></p> \n<h3>How to Post a Video on Desktop</h3> \n<p>To upload a video to Instagram from your desktop, you'll need to use a third-party service that offers social media scheduling software.</p> \n<p>There are a few you might try, including the <a href=\"https://flumeapp.com/\">Flume App</a> for Mac (Pro version is $20) or <a href=\"https://latelysocial.com/\">Lately Social</a> ($14 per user per month for Agency plan).</p> \n<p>For our purposes, I used Lately Social's free personal plan to upload and post a video directly to my Instagram:</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/lately%20social%20tool%20dashboard%20copy.jpg?width=2864&amp;name=lately%20social%20tool%20dashboard%20copy.jpg\" alt=\"lately social tool dashboard\" width=\"2864\" style=\"width: 2864px;\"></p> \n<p>Of course, if you're doing this regularly it might be worthwhile to explore all the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-tools?_ga=2.232727451.546482764.1602518588-990910495.1602518588\">social media scheduling tools</a> at your disposal to choose the one best-suited for your business' needs.</p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fpost-to-instagram-from-computer&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\"
