r.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn63@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-53-48-931_2e1268d42de09fc0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/safari%20prefences%20drop-down%20menu%20copy.jpg?width=2876&name=safari%20prefences%20drop-down%20menu%20copy.jpg":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/safari%20advanced%20preferences%20copy.jpg?width=1544&name=safari%20advanced%20preferences%20copy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn49@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-58-387_5f58ff5a23c11185.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.11%20PM-min.png?width=2866&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.11%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn41@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-59-882_f675d063b87c05e6.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.29%20PM-min.png?width=2666&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-12%20at%201.06.29%20PM-min.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn16@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-14-804_c594c8b5b25a66fa.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/lately%20social%20tool%20dashboard%20copy.jpg?width=2864&name=lately%20social%20tool%20dashboard%20copy.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn49@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-05-701_eac4c5358994f672.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fpost-to-instagram-from-computer&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn39@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-47-838_0c3943f571249a23.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624903},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"The 16 Best Digital Marketing Tools in 2020","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/digital-marketing-tools","description":"<p>I'm a big fan of finding the latest and greatest digital marketing tools.</p> \n<p>While digital marketing tools will only <em>help</em> you execute a proper strategy (they won't do the work for you), the right technology stack can really help you zoom past the competition.</p> \n<p>Some tools out there are foundational -- things like email marketing, web forms, analytics, and a CRM. However, other tools are more specialized, including keyword rank trackers, or design tools.</p> \n<p>To take your marketing strategy to the next level, we've outlined the following 16 digital marketing tools every marketer should have in their tool belt.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing?_ga=2.86734928.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">HubSpot Marketing</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Free to $3,200/month for enterprises, depending on your plan</p> \n<p>HubSpot has several tools to help you grow your business, no matter what stage you're at.</p> \n<p>Starting out, there are several tools available for free. You can set up <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/forms?_ga=2.86734928.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">web forms</a>, <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/pop-up-form?_ga=2.86734928.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">popup forms</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm/live-chat?_ga=2.86734928.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">live chat software</a> for lead capture. Then, you can send <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/email\">email marketing</a> campaigns, pipe all of your data into the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?_ga=2.86734928.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">free CRM</a>, and analyze site visitors' behavior.</p> \n<p>When you expand into the paid tiers, things get really sophisticated with advanced marketing automation.</p> \n<p>From managing your content and social media to tracking emails and connecting with your leads, HubSpot is an all-in-one solution -- although it works well with other point solutions you may use (Typeform, HotJar, etc.).</p> \n<p>Ultimately, the tool allows you to:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Grow your traffic, convert leads, and prove ROI for your inbound marketing campaigns.</li> \n <li>Shorten deal cycles and increase close rates with the provided sales tools.</li> \n</ul> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-1.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/crm?_ga=2.86734928.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://ahrefs.com/\">Ahrefs</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Tiered pricing, ranging from $99 to $399</p> \n<p>Ahrefs is a comprehensive SEO tool to help you punch up your website traffic. They have data for around 150 million keywords in the U.S., and even more for 150 other countries.</p> \n<p>Ahrefs is great for competitive analysis, allowing you to check out who is linking to your competitors, what their top pages are, and more. You can see where their content ranks and, using the Content Gap tool, identify key weaknesses for your content areas.</p> \n<p>The Top Pages tool lets you see which pages get the most traffic, and you can see the amount of traffic going to competitors' sites.</p> \n<p>Ahrefs is one of my favorite SEO tools. It constantly impresses me with features I use daily, and I learn about new features all the time. It's easily the most robust product in this space.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019.jpeg\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://ahrefs.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://useproof.com/?utm_source=hubspot&amp;utm_content=digital-marketing-tools\">Proof</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Tiered pricing based on the volume of your website traffic, starting at $24/month</p> \n<p>Proof connects to your CRM or website and uses social proof to boost conversions on your site. They implement social proof messaging (i.e. \"25 people are viewing this post right now\"), reviews, and videos geared towards targeted customers once they visit your site.</p> \n<p>The popular Live Visitor Count and Hot Streak notification features boost customers' perception of your brand, and lets prospects get a look at how other people respond to your product. Additionally, it's super easy to install -- you just copy and paste their pixels into your site.</p> \n<p>You can identify your visitors and examine their journey throughout your site, which can help optimize your site design for higher conversions. It integrates with an impressive amount of other software systems and is optimized for mobile.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-6.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://useproof.com/?utm_source=hubspot&amp;utm_content=digital-marketing-tools\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://surveyanyplace.com/\">Survey Anyplace</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Free trial available | Pricing starts from $33 per month</p> \n<p>If you’re looking for a powerful lead generation tool, Survey Anyplace is a software your marketing team should consider.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>With their ReportR pack, respondents can walk away with a personalized PDF report based on their answers immediately after completion. They also integrate smoothly with your existing marketing stack either via webhooks, Zapier or Integromat. So you can easily transport leads through to your CRM or email marketing tool and start building nurturing campaigns.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Survey%20Anyplace%202.png?width=650&amp;name=Survey%20Anyplace%202.png\" alt=\"Survey Anyplace 2\" width=\"650\" style=\"width: 650px;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://surveyanyplace.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>5. <a href=\"https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/\">Yoast</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: The Yoast plugin for WordPress is free, but the paid premium plans range based off the number of sites you need monitored</p> \n<p>Yoast is a very popular plugin that works with both Gutenberg and the Classic editor in WordPress. Yoast is an excellent tool to help you optimize your content for search engines.</p> \n<p>Yoast helps you choose cornerstone content, focus keywords to help you rank, individual content URLs, and internal links for an additional boost. The plugin also evaluates your page readability and gives it a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/flesch-reading-score\">Flesch Reading Ease</a> score.</p> \n<p>It's updated to reflect Google's algorithm every two weeks, so you can always stay up-to-date on your SEO.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-8.png\" alt=\"\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://yoast.com/wordpress/plugins/seo/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://slack.com/\">Slack</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Free for small or medium companies, custom pricing for enterprises</p> \n<p>Slack is one of the favored communication services in business today.</p> \n<p>It operates in channels designated for certain information, so business conversations don't get distracted or cut-off by tangents about where everyone wants to go for team lunch. It facilitates, de-silos, and focuses collaboration between employees and teams.</p> \n<p>It's an excellent tool for networking and meeting others in the digital marketing space, and gives you the freedom to join or leave channels as needed.</p> \n<p>Because it's such a popular communication channel, it has wide-ranging <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/slack-apps-integrations?_ga=2.183229550.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">integrations with plenty of other tools</a>. You can tack on a seemingly unlimited amount of integrations and Slack applications to make the tool even more powerful -- for instance, many teams will pipe in A/B test results, analytics notifications, new customer or transaction notifications, or even sales or customer support bots. While undeniably powerful, Slack is easy to start using immediately.</p> \n<h3><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-22%20at%2011.23.42%20AM.png?width=1292&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-22%20at%2011.23.42%20AM.png\" alt=\"Screen Shot 2019-05-22 at 11.23.42 AM\" width=\"1292\" style=\"width: 1292px;\">&nbsp;</h3> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://slack.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://trello.com/\">Trello</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Paid plans range from free to $20.83 per month for enterprise</p> \n<p>Trello is a content management tool that many organizations use for brainstorming and strategizing content -- in fact, we use Trello at HubSpot to know when our blog posts are scheduled for publication.</p> \n<p>The reason Trello is so appealing is that it's free for small teams and businesses, and it provides a visual way to brainstorm and schedule content online -- even if your team is remote or global. Additionally, it's easy to assign multiple employees to a card, so you know who's in charge of writing, editing, or adding CTA offers to a post.</p> \n<p>Users can create cards and include notes on the card topic, as well as create deadlines and assign topics to certain teams. Trello facilitates collaboration and provides clarity on projects in the pipeline.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-2.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://trello.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://www.canva.com/learn/business/\">Canva Business</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Plans start free, $12.95/month for teams, or custom pricing for enterprises</p> \n<p>Canva is a drag-and-drop design platform that allows users to create images using custom pictures, icons, shapes, and fonts from the Canva catalog. It offers an aesthetically-pleasing, simple way to design your own logos, presentations, images, or graphs based off your team's needs.</p> \n<p>Additionally, Canva cuts out the need for an experienced designer and enables you to create the exact visual you have in mind using their vast image collection.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-11.png?width=465&amp;name=The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-11.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"465\" style=\"width: 465px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.canva.com/learn/business/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://ads.google.com/home/\">Google AdWords</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: AdWords run on a pay-per-click model</p> \n<p>Google AdWords is one of the most popular options for advertising your business on Google's search engine results' pages. Payment is based on either a pay-per-click or pay-per-call structure.</p> \n<p>Google AdWords hosts the Google Keyword Planner, where you can research which keywords you want to include in your ad and your other content. You can set budget caps on how much you want to spend. Ultimately, the tool helps you funnel more prospects to your website.</p> \n<p>AdWords is an excellent way to display your products or services on Google's results pages for very specific queries. For instance, let's say someone searches for \"best CrossFit gym in Austin\". Sure, you could work on your SEO and hope to appear organically -- but you can also bid on the keyword and appear at the top of the page, enabling you to capture tons of high intent visitors.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-3.png?width=348&amp;name=The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-3.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"348\" style=\"width: 348px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://ads.google.com/home/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/provision/?authuser=0#/provision\">Google Analytics</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Free</p> \n<p>Google Analytics is the gold standard for website analytics. Nowadays, it's hard to operate as a digital marketer if you don't have some level of Google Analytics expertise.</p> \n<p>At its most basic level, Google Analytics can show you who is coming to your website, from where, and on which pages they're spending most of their time. Beyond that, you can set up goals to track conversions, build an <a href=\"https://klientboost.com/analytics/ecommerce-analytics/\">enhanced ecommerce setup</a>, and track events to learn more about user engagement.</p> \n<p>Truthfully, barely a day goes by that I don't use Google Analytics. To learn more, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/google-analytics?_ga=2.119414593.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">The Ultimate Guide to Google Analytics in 2019</a>.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-1.jpeg\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://www.simoahava.com\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/\">MailChimp</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Tiered pricing, plans start free and range up to $199</p> \n<p>MailChimp is an email marketing and social advertising tool designed to automate and orchestrate campaigns.</p> \n<p>You can track the traffic garnered from your campaigns -- additionally, MailChimp offers multiple integrations with other SaaS companies. The tool is especially powerful for email drip campaigns. Ultimately, it's a good option for engaging with your audience.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-5.png?width=301&amp;name=The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-5.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"301\" style=\"width: 301px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>12. <a href=\"https://asana.com/?noredirect\">Asana</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Tiered pricing, free to $19.99/month, with custom enterprise options</p> \n<p>Asana is a collaborative workflow management system with a visual emphasis designed to streamline and de-silo information and goals between teams.</p> \n<p>Asana allows you to do several things:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Record and visualize projects to be completed</li> \n <li>Map out deadlines and prioritize tasks</li> \n <li>Assign tasks to certain team members</li> \n <li>Identify points of friction and bottlenecks</li> \n <li>Report on projects quickly and openly</li> \n <li>De-silo data between teams</li> \n</ul> \n<p>The Portfolios function also lets you keep track of every project's status, ensuring that your team members have the support and motivation to get out their digital marketing initiatives on time.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://asana.com/?noredirect\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>13. <a href=\"https://app.buzzsumo.com/research/content\">BuzzSumo</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: Paid plans start at $79/month</p> \n<p>BuzzSumo is a unique content research tool that identifies top influencers in your industry and helps you connect with them.</p> \n<p>You can look up trending topics and define the scope of your search to generate both evergreen content, or trending content aimed at your desired audience.</p> \n<p>From there, you can look at your content's analytics and social mentions, and then measure performance accordingly.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-7.png\" alt=\"\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://app.buzzsumo.com/research/content\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>14. <a href=\"https://meetedgar.com/\">MeetEdgar</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price</strong>: $49/month</p> \n<p>MeetEdgar is an excellent social media management tool.</p> \n<p>Using the browser extension, it can write posts and extract up to five important highlights from your posted content for you to easily share. You can sort your content into categories and decide when you want content shared from each category.</p> \n<p>It allows you to schedule posts 24/7, and if your queue runs out, it will mine previous posts and re-share them -- which you can start and stop at any time. You can also use MeetEdgar to <a href=\"https://help.meetedgar.com/edgar-integrations/shorten-links-and-track-clicks-with-edgar/link-shortening-click-tracking-and-variation-performance\">run A/B tests</a> on your content to find the most optimal language and content for your posts.</p> \n<p>MeetEdgar is integrated with LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-9.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://meetedgar.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>15. <a href=\"https://buffer.com/\">Buffer</a></h3> \n<p><strong>Price:</strong> Starts free and goes up to $199/month</p> \n<p><span class=\" author-d-16z86ztz122z98z81zz82zz85zunv3z82zpqfnl8z66zjz87zz84zrc9z78zpauz87zz122zhz82zbz78zqwz65zniz90zz74z5z75ze\">Managing all your social media marketing in one place can be a huge time saver. Buffer certainly fits the bill with its clean and simple interface and intuitive setup flow. Plus, there are plenty of advanced features for the many social media jobs you need to do.</span></p> \n<p><span class=\" author-d-16z86ztz122z98z81zz82zz85zunv3z82zpqfnl8z66zjz87zz84zrc9z78zpauz87zz122zhz82zbz78zqwz65zniz90zz74z5z75ze\">With Buffer, you get a full social media management solution: plan, create, and schedule your social media posts; follow up on post performance with smart analytics; and engage with your followers from a social media inbox. Plus, you can work together with your team to run all your organic social strategy through Buffer.</span></p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/buffer%202.png\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://buffer.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<h3>16. <a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/\">Hootsuite</a></h3> \n<h3><strong>Price</strong>: Starts at $29 per month, or custom enterprise pricing</h3> \n<p>Hootsuite is more of an enterprise social media management solution, but it's quite powerful and very popular. Hootsuite is able to store your approved content in a cloud that team members can access 24/7 for social media posting needs. It allows multiple posts to be scheduled at once with developed tags and keywords.</p> \n<p>Using Hootsuite, you can track the performance of your social media content. Hootsuite can calculate ROI, conversions, and track public conversations about your brand or specific subject matter. Plans have tiered pricing, starting at $29 per month and ranging toward $599 per month for enterprise.</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-10.png\" alt=\"\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 11px; text-align: center;\"><em><a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/\">Image Source</a></em></p> \n<p>There are plenty of different tools for you to tackle your marketing problems head-on -- you just need to decide where to focus first. Which tool works best with your company structure and ultimate goals?</p> \n<p>If you want a free, comprehensive, all-in-one marketing service, check out <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/free?_ga=2.123476803.993379860.1558305817-1451183703.1557949920\">HubSpot's free marketing tools</a>.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in May 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdigital-marketing-tools&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-1.png","linkMd5":"b7d01d44bdfcbe43d46a009c44d98899","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn52@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-53-45-256_2d2c025f18914276.webp","destWidth":1600,"destHeight":1008,"sourceBytes":233532,"destBytes":233532,"author":"lindytolberts@gmail.com (Lindy Tolbert)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn52@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-53-45-256_2d2c025f18914276.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn44@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-13-622_2ddde01c8238ddc6.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-6.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn42@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-07-003_631836ee6bef807d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Survey%20Anyplace%202.png?width=650&name=Survey%20Anyplace%202.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn47@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-53-47-839_20b95f6c2819f950.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn83@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-12-012_c8da552c8e6c52c3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202019-05-22%20at%2011.23.42%20AM.png?width=1292&name=Screen%20Shot%202019-05-22%20at%2011.23.42%20AM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn65@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-58-659_3e3ded4dae6a5a08.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn69@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-56-553_99d31d8fee034800.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-11.png?width=465&name=The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-11.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn13@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-01-430_344263a49755d91b.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-3.png?width=348&name=The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-3.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-1.jpeg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn29@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-56-168_bbdb8b92721707c5.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-5.png?width=301&name=The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-5.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn74@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-12-721_46e026ebbb80dcdd.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn53@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-05-653_127b2dd1535f17d0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn75@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-08-878_7d5bcb17a9865ffc.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-9.png":null,"https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/buffer%202.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn42@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-02-086_4e499d5181fb53cd.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/The%2016%20Best%20Digital%20Marketing%20Tools%20in%202019-10.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn29@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-06-826_872d6ea3a31d94f4.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fdigital-marketing-tools&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn79@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-08-940_4040430acb6801ea.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624912},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"How to Tweet on Twitter: 12 Templates to Get You Started","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tweet-formulas-to-get-you-started-on-twitter","description":"<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>How to write and post a Tweet:</h2> \n <ol> \n  <li>Sign into Twitter.</li> \n  <li>Begin compsing your Tweet above the feed, or click on the new Tweet button at the top of your screen.</li> \n  <li>Compose your Tweet with less than 140 characters.</li> \n  <li>Include a #hashtag so relevant followers can find your account.</li> \n  <li>Tag a person using '@' followed by their twitter handle.</li> \n  <li>Follow a Tweet formula as a starting point for ideas.</li> \n </ol> \n</div> \n<p><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0px; background-color: transparent;\">Not sure what to tweet to <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/lessons/your-ticket-to-twitter-content\">get your followers to engage with you</a>? Whether you're just getting started&nbsp;with Twitter or you've&nbsp;been using it&nbsp;for a while, but feel like you're in a rut, it can be hard to come up with new ideas for what to publish.</span></p> \n<p>Sometimes, it can help to follow some tried-and-true tropes. Here&nbsp;are several Twitter \"formulas\" you can follow.&nbsp;</p> \n<p> Just make the following changes to each one:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Fill in the \"blanks\" where the <strong>[BRACKETS]</strong> are.</li> \n <li>Edit the <strong>#hashtag</strong> with the actual hashtag you'd like to use (e.g. #marketingtips). <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/twitter-hashtag-tips\">Hashtags make it easy</a> for people to find your tweets when they're tracking that hashtag, so you can find more relevant followers.</li> \n <li>Replace <strong>@TwitterHandle</strong> with a person's real Twitter handle (e.g. @HubSpot).</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Download our free guide to generating more Twitter followers here for even more helpful Twitter tips.</p> \n<p><strong>Note:</strong> Each audience is different, so you may find that some of these formulas work better than others to grow your following.</p> \n<h2><strong>How To Tweet:&nbsp;Here Are 12 Templates You Can&nbsp;Customize</strong></h2> \n<h3>1. Use \"The Basic Shared Content Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[ARTICLE TITLE]: http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag by @TwitterHandle</em></h4> \n<p>This go-to tweet style is the easiest to execute, but many times, people forget to include a relevant hashtag and the author's Twitter handle. The hashtag could get your tweet more exposure to people following that hashtag. And always credit your information source (the author or the site you got the post from) on social media. It'll show appreciation to the original content creator -- and they might return the favor by sharing some of your content with their followers.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><strong>Example:</strong>&nbsp;12 Tweet Formulas to Get You Started on Twitter: <a href=\"http://hub.am/Sgsvt5\">http://hub.am/Sgsvt5</a> #twittertips by @HubSpot</p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">2. Try \"The Shared Content Tweet With Commentary\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[YOUR OPINION]&nbsp;&gt; [ARTICLE TITLE]: http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag by @TwitterHandle</em></h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[ARTICLE TITLE]: http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag by @TwitterHandle &gt; [YOUR OPINION]</em></h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Like the basic shared content tweet, this tweet includes the article title (or a shortened version), a relevant hashtag, and the author's Twitter handle. But in addition, you'll add your opinion -- whether it's a quick \"+1\" or something a little more in-depth. Something personal like that might&nbsp;increase engagement rate with your tweet.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><strong>Example:&nbsp;</strong>Bookmarking this. &gt; 12 Tweet Formulas to Get You Started on Twitter: <a href=\"http://hub.am/Sgsvt5\" class=\"twitter-timeline-link\">http://hub.am/Sgsvt5</a> #twittertips by&nbsp;<span>@HubSpot</span></p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">3. Retweet With Commentary</h3> \n<p>Typically, when you want to retweet someone's tweet, you'll simply click the retweet button and share the content with your followers. But if you want to&nbsp;know <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/27675/How-to-Retweet-the-Right-Way-in-4-Easy-Steps.aspx\">how to retweet</a> with a little flavor, we're going to show you. There are two ways to add commentary to a retweet: using the \"retweet with comment\" feature or composing&nbsp;a new tweet and publishing it manually.</p> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: left;\">a) Using the \"retweet with comment\" feature.</h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[YOUR OPINION]</em> #hashtag</h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\">[EMBEDDED ORIGINAL TWEET]</h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">The \"retweet with comment\" feature allows you to embed an original tweet within your own message, and then comment on it in up to 116 characters. To do this,&nbsp;click the retweet icon at the bottom of the tweet.&nbsp;In the window that appears, add your comment to the \"Add a Comment\" section (and include a hashtag, if you so desire).</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\"><strong>Example:</strong></p> \n<img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/retweet-with-comment.png?width=568&amp;name=retweet-with-comment.png\" alt=\"retweet-with-comment.png\" title=\"retweet-with-comment.png\" width=\"568\">\n<br>   \n<p>(For more details on how this feature works, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/27675/How-to-Retweet-the-Right-Way-in-4-Easy-Steps.aspx\">read this blog post</a>.)</p> \n<h4>b) Manually retweeting with commentary.</h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[YOUR OPINION]</em> #hashtag<em> - RT @TwitterHandle [ARTICLE TITLE] - http://url.com&nbsp;</em></h4> \n<p>To retweet with commentary in this way, simply copy and paste the person's tweet into a brand new tweet, preface the tweet with RT @TwitterHandle, and add commentary to the beginning. If you modify their tweet at all (e.g. to make the tweet a bit shorter, allowing more room for your comment), use MT -- which stands for \"modified tweet\" -- instead of RT.</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong>&nbsp;#7 is important but often forgotten. - RT @mvolpe&nbsp;\"10 Things Great Marketers Do Every Day\"&nbsp;<a class=\"twitter-timeline-link\" title=\"http://hub.am/1m6RPK4\" href=\"http://t.co/GMlxKnnrU5\">http://hub.am/1m6RPK4</a>&nbsp;by @kellykranz</p> \n<h3>4. Use \"The .@TwitterHandle&nbsp;Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>.@TwitterHandle&nbsp;[REST OF TWEET]</em></h4> \n<p>If you put someone's Twitter handle&nbsp;at the very beginning&nbsp;of your tweet, Twitter assumes you're @replying to that person -- so they omit that tweet from&nbsp;showing up on your Twitter followers' feeds. While this is usually a good thing (otherwise, your feed might get taken over by&nbsp;@reply tweets), there may be times when you want your followers to see that tweet on their feeds.&nbsp;To do that, simply add a period right before their Twitter handle.</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong>&nbsp;.@HubSpot&nbsp;redesigned their blog! Check it out here: <a href=\"http://t.co/xP44vA6vnj\" class=\"link customisable\" title=\"http://blog.hubspot.com\"><span class=\"u-hiddenVisually\">http://blog.hubspot.com</span></a>&nbsp;#webredesign</p> \n<h3>5. Try \"The Problem/Solution Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>Don't let your [ASSET] [NEGATIVE RESULT]. Find out how to [GOAL] here: http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag</em></h4> \n<p>Fear is a powerful motivator. Nobody wants to suck, or fail, or flounder, or fall short, or whatever [negative result] you use. And if they do, they want to learn how to remedy the situation, fast -- that's where you can help them. Also, if there's a relevant hashtag you can use here, don't forget to include it!</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong> Don't let your blog fall into a rut. Find out how to churn out new blog posts quickly:&nbsp;<a href=\"http://hub.am/1nD3y5M\">http://hub.am/1nD3y5M</a>&nbsp;#blogging</p> \n<h3>6. Utilize \"The Stat or Fact Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>Did you know that [STAT]?&nbsp;http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag</em></h4> \n<p>Don't just find any old data point here -- find something that will really intrigue your target audience. Once they get this little preview, they could want to read the full story to understand (1) why this data point is true, and (2) what they should do about it. Just be sure your statistic is recent and from a reputable source.</p> \n<p><strong>Example:&nbsp;</strong>Did you know 6.5% of blog posts are published on the weekends &amp; they get 18% of all social shares? <a href=\"http://hub.am/1otH7QF\">http://hub.am/1otH7QF</a> #blogging</p> \n<h3>7. Tweet \"The Endorsement Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>I loved this article by @TwitterHandle about [TOPIC] - <a href=\"http://url.com\">http://url.com</a>&nbsp;#hashtag</em></h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>Lots of valuable info on [TOPIC] in this article by @TwitterHandle - http://url.com #hashtag</em></h4> \n<p>This tweet can take many forms, but instead of tweeting a basic shared content tweet, you're adding your endorsement to the tweet and possibly including info on why you enjoyed the piece.</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong> I loved this article by @lkolo25 about how to not screw up your landing pages -&nbsp;<a href=\"http://hub.am/1p2LQwy\">http://hub.am/1p2LQwy</a>&nbsp;#leadgen</p> \n<h3>8. Embed a SlideShare in a Tweet</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[PRESENTATION&nbsp;TITLE]: http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag by @TwitterHandle</em></h4> \n<p>Did you know you can embed a SlideShare presentation directly into a tweet? That way,&nbsp;your followers can flip through the presentation without ever having to leave Twitter (or the page a tweet is embedded on).</p> \n<p>To embed a SlideShare presentation into a tweet, all you have to do is link to the presentation and it will embed automatically. This is also true for documents and videos from SlideShare as well.</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong></p>  \n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"> \n <p>20 Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn &amp; Pinterest Features You Didn't Know Existed: <a href=\"http://t.co/yLFzTr392P\">http://t.co/yLFzTr392P</a> via <a href=\"https://twitter.com/HubSpot\">@HubSpot</a> <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/socialmediatips?src=hash\">#socialmediatips</a></p> — Lindsay Kolowich (@lkolo25) \n <a href=\"https://twitter.com/lkolo25/status/592791212060454912\">April 27, 2015</a>\n</blockquote>   \n<h3>9.&nbsp;Ask a Question in a Tweet</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[QUESTION] #hashtag</em></h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[QUESTION] - http://url.com&nbsp;#hashtag</em></h4> \n<p>Twitter, like all social networks, is a two-way conversion. You should regularly ask your followers questions. These can be tied to an article you've read or could be something a little more random (though still tied to your brand). <strong>Not every tweet needs to drive traffic to a website page.</strong></p> \n<p><strong>Example:&nbsp;</strong>What tool do you use to schedule your social media posts? #socialmedia</p> \n<h3>10. Use \"The Tip or Advice Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[YOUR OWN WORDS OF WISDOM] #hashtag&nbsp;</em></h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[QUESTION] #hashtag 1) [ANSWER #1] 2) [ANSWER #2] 3) [ANSWER #3]</em></h4> \n<p>Again, not every tweet needs to drive traffic to a website page -- in fact, tweeting bits of advice that obviously aren't traffic drivers is a great way to build credibility. Tweets like this are retweeted frequently and can get you more engagement and followers, so don't look as a \"sacrifice.\"</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong> Do you pass reshare test? Be valuable on #socialmedia: 1) Provide information 2) Provide analysis 3) Provide assistance 4) Be entertaining.</p> \n<h3>11. Try \"The Inspiring Quote\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>\"[QUOTE]\" - @TwitterHandle #quote</em>&nbsp;</h4> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>\"[QUOTE]\" - [NAME OF PERSON NOT ON TWITTER] #quote</em></h4> \n<p>Everyone loves a daily dose of inspiration! It's difficult to research quotes and find the perfect one, so inspirational quotes are best shared when you randomly come across them and get inspired yourself. So keep your eyes peeled for great quotes, takeaways, data, etc. Just make sure to give credit where it's due!</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong> \"Our time is limited so don't waste it living someone else's life.\" - Steve Jobs #quote</p> \n<h3>12. Post \"The Photo&nbsp;Tweet\"</h3> \n<h4 style=\"text-align: center;\"><em>[PHOTO CAPTION] #hashtag [ATTACH PHOTO]</em></h4> \n<p>There are <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/visual-content-variety-social-media\">lots&nbsp;of ways to spice up your tweets with&nbsp;visual content</a>.&nbsp;The simplest of them all is&nbsp;adding a&nbsp;photo to your tweet, using the text part of the tweet as a caption, and sharing that with your followers. This is great for sharing pictures of your office space and employees, or promoting events and webinars.&nbsp;Remember to include any relevant Twitter handles or hashtags.</p> \n<p><strong>Example:</strong></p>  \n<blockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\"> \n <p>Fantastic shot taken by yours truly from the 2014 <a href=\"https://twitter.com/HubSpot\">@HubSpot</a> Inbound Marketing Conference in Boston. <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hashtag/INBOUND14?src=hash\">#INBOUND14</a> <a href=\"http://t.co/cRufJyTH7n\">pic.twitter.com/cRufJyTH7n</a></p> — David Roberts (@DavidatJDR) \n <a href=\"https://twitter.com/DavidatJDR/status/534297502342995968\">November 17, 2014</a>\n</blockquote>  \n<h2><strong>Want to share this post? Here are some ready-made tweets:</strong></h2> \n<p><a href=\"http://ctt.ec/1d6E9\"><strong>Click to tweet:</strong></a>&nbsp;12 Tweet Formulas to Get You Started on Twitter:&nbsp;http://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tweet-formulas-to-get-you-started-on-twitter&nbsp;via @HubSpot #TwitterTip</p> \n<p><a href=\"http://ctt.ec/Iei4X\"><strong>Click to tweet:</strong></a> Check out these fill-in-the-blank tweet formulas:&nbsp;http://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tweet-formulas-to-get-you-started-on-twitter&nbsp;#TwitterTip</p> \n<p><a href=\"http://ctt.ec/Y3aQc\"><strong>Click to tweet:</strong></a> Running out of tweet ideas? Here are some fill-in-the-blank formulas - http://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tweet-formulas-to-get-you-started-on-twitter&nbsp;#TwitterTip</p> \n<p><em>Editor's Note: This post was originally published in June 2014 and has been updated for accuracy and comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ftweet-formulas-to-get-you-started-on-twitter&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 20 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"d7e7f03b820b9fb28ec8ae8d8d654a79","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"lkolowich@hubspot.com (Lindsay Kolowich Cox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/retweet-with-comment.png?width=568&name=retweet-with-comment.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn59@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-53-49-902_572f89d8e213b0fa.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Ftweet-formulas-to-get-you-started-on-twitter&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn32@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-53-53-059_cb4b8d242f3e86b7.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624919},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"7 Australian Companies with Great Taglines [+What Marketers Can Learn From Them]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/australian-taglines","description":"<p>It's no secret that people who live in startup-filled cities have seen some of the wildest brand names.</p>  \n<p>And, that variety in company names makes sense. When many startups in similar industries are founded in one geographic area, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/agency/develop-brand-identity\">brands need to come up with a name</a> that grasps attention, lightly hints at their mission, differentiates them from competitors, or encourages prospects to learn more about them.</p> \n<p>This is especially true in Australia, which <a href=\"https://www.crunchbase.com/hub/australia-startups\">hosts startups from Sydney to Melbourne</a>. These cities are the founding place of uniquely named startups and major brands like Sukin, Canva, and Billabong.</p> \n<p>While the successful companies listed above have made their names noteworthy and easy to recognize, their company titles only hint at what their brands offer. This is why successful brands like these also lean on taglines to give prospects a quick, clear view of a brand's overall mission or purpose.</p> \n<p>With a great name and an effective tagline, prospects will remember your brand's uniqueness, mission, or what types of products you offer. Then, when they're looking for a product in your industry or space, they might think of your brand's name and catchy tagline.</p> \n<p>If you're working in a busy startup hub like Australia, or are starting a business in an already crowded business landscape, take note of these seven Australian companies with taglines that stand out and set them apart from the competition.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>7 Australian Companies With Great Taglines</h2> \n<h3>\"More than Money\" - National Australian Bank (NAB)</h3> \n<p>During a rebrand in 2016, National Australian Bank changed its tagline from <a href=\"https://www.cmo.com.au/article/603094/nab-ushers-new-brand-promise-widespread-national-campaign/#:~:text=The%20initiative%20is%20the%20first,the%20'break%20up'%20campaign.\">\"More give, less take\" to \"More than money.\"</a></p> \n<p>The new tagline came with a series of commercials led by NAB's agency -- <a href=\"https://www.clemengerbbdo.com.au/\">Clemenger BBDO</a>. Each ad highlighted the bank's history, credibility, and how their financial institution still plays a positive role in impacting countless Australian lives.</p> \n<p>In the ad below -- which was part of the \"More than money\" campaign -- NAB invokes nostalgia by showing home video-like clips that follow a new-born baby as she grows into an adult, as well as the milestones her parents will need to budget for, such as violin lessons, schooling, and travel:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 411px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 73.39%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe src=\"https://www.facebook.com/plugins/video.php?href=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2FNAB%2Fvideos%2F1138997696138736%2F&amp;show_text=1&amp;width=560\" width=\"560\" height=\"411\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>In an <a href=\"https://www.cmo.com.au/article/603094/nab-ushers-new-brand-promise-widespread-national-campaign/#:~:text=The%20initiative%20is%20the%20first,the%20'break%20up'%20campaign.\">interview with CMO</a>, Andrew Knott, NAB's Chief Marketing Officer, said the pivot aimed to be more customer-centric.</p> \n<p>“We felt it was time to move on from what has been a very effective brand expression around fair value, and ‘more give, less take’, to something that’s far more reflective of what we stand for today, but that’s also consistent with our heritage,” Knott explained. “When we are at our best is when we take time to understand customers and understand where they are at in their lives and to help them with the financial aspects of doing so.”</p> \n<p>By linking money to major life milestones, NAB's tagline and campaign effectively place emotion behind logistical offerings. To prospects unsure of where to place their money, the tagline makes the financial institution seem more relatable and potentially more trustworthy than other banks with basic emotionless marketing.</p> \n<h3>\"Life's better in boardshorts.\" - Billabong</h3> \n<p>When it comes to taglines, Billabong keeps there's short and sweet. Knowing that most of its customers are looking for swimwear for surfing, beach vacations, or summer sports, Billabong created a tagline just to remind people how much fun they can have in bathing suits.</p> \n<p>Throughout Billabong's history, it has embraced this tagline in a number of its online and print campaigns. Beginning in 2017, the brand began producing a YouTube surf series with the same phrase as its title. Here's one of its chapters:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YcMUQl8OdKA?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Billabong's tagline is a great example of how a bold statement in a tagline can persuade a prospect to buy a product to make their lives more enjoyable. But, depending on the prospect who hears it, the tagline could also either play up a sense of vacation-related <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/make-fomo-work-for-your-ecommerce-company\">FOMO</a> or <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/nostalgia-marketing\">seasonal nostalgia</a>.</p> \n<p>For example, if someone lives in a cold climate and hears that life could be better in boardshorts, they might yearn to go surfing somewhere warm. Or, if someone has been working long hours, they might remember a time they spent on the beach as a child. The emotions or memories invoked by this tagline might not convince someone to buy a ticket to a beachy destination. But, if they do go on vacation, Billabong might be the first brand they remember when making beachwear purchases.</p> \n<h3>\"Skincare that doesn't cost the Earth\" - Sukin</h3> \n<p>As a budget-minded, environmentally conscious shopper, I can attest to the fact that it's hard to find environmentally-friendly products that meet your skin's health needs and don't cost a fortune.</p> \n<p>Sukin, a Melbourne-founded skincare brand, aims to solve for the dilemma above, by selling <a href=\"https://sukinnaturals.com/pages/brand-values\">affordable, sustainably produced skin products</a>. It's tagline cleverly reflects this mission with a play on words: \"Skincare that doesn't cost the Earth.\"</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D-1.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D-1.png\" alt=\"sukin skincare that doesn't cost the earth tagline\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>Aside from cleverly explaining the brand in just one sentence, Sukin's tagline also lines up well with <a href=\"https://sukinnaturals.com/pages/brand-values\">its overall mission</a>.</p> \n<p>\"Here at Sukin, we're committed to providing skincare that doesn’t cost the earth. This isn’t merely a commitment to creating affordable products, but also with minimal cost to our precious environment. We achieve this by thinking and acting sustainably wherever possible.​ Keep reading for our environmental initiatives,\" <a href=\"https://sukinnaturals.com/pages/brand-values\">Sukin's Brand Values page notes</a>.</p> \n<h3>\"Design anything. Publish anywhere.\" - Canva</h3> \n<p>While Canva seems like a giant global company now, it was once a startup founded in Sydney, Australia.</p> \n<p>For those who haven't used Canva, the website allows individual users or teams to easily create and publish aesthetically-pleasing graphic designs for websites, social media, and other platforms.</p> \n<p>Because Canva is artsy by nature, the brand could've gotten away with an overly creative tagline. But, instead, the company keeps things simple -- but still incredibly effective -- with, <a href=\"https://about.canva.com/\">\"Design anything. Publish anywhere.\"</a></p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png?width=600&amp;name=7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png\" alt=\"canva design anything publish anywhere tagline\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p>In just four simple words, Canva describes its <a href=\"https://product.hubspot.com/blog/the-evolution-of-the-hubspot-knowledge-base\">minimum viable product</a> and entices both designers and artistic novices to try its tools.</p> \n<h3>\"Australians Wouldn't Give an XXXX for Anything Else.\" - XXXX</h3> \n<p>Today, XXXX beer's tagline simply reads <a href=\"https://www.xxxx.com.au/\">\"Pride of Queensland.\"</a> But, before the brand became globally known, they had another great tagline that caught attention from Australian masses due to the light curse-related controversy around it.</p> \n<p>For decades, XXXX -- formerly known as Castlemaine XXXX -- embraced Australia's edgy sense of humor and slang with the memorable tagline, \"Australians Wouldn't Give an XXXX for Anything Else.\"</p> \n<p>The tagline, which cleverly uses XXXX to insinuate a four-letter curse word, <a href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/2891632/Ad-of-the-week.html#:~:text=Background%20%22Australians%20wouldn't%20give,campaign%20was%20ditched%20in%201996.\">dates back to 1985</a>. At that time, commercials would present a longer, TV-friendly tagline of \"Australians Wouldn't Give a Castlemaine XXXX for Anything Else.\"</p> \n<p>These early commercials often showed rural Australian residents, farmers, and construction workers getting into humorous, but dangerous, situations just to get XXXX beer. After a wild scene, a narrator would read the tagline, insinuating that Australians wouldn't care so much about any other beer. Here's one classic example:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 459px; max-height: 344px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 74.95%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"459\" height=\"344\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RcgkSSQvVQg?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Moving into the 1990s, the brand began using the shortened headline to express a more eye-popping message.</p> \n<p>Although the tagline was <a href=\"https://www.telegraph.co.uk/finance/2891632/Ad-of-the-week.html#:~:text=Background%20%22Australians%20wouldn't%20give,campaign%20was%20ditched%20in%201996.\">scrapped in a 1996 rebrand</a>, it's still a historically great example of how a company can be cheeky, attention-grabbing, and memorable while still tastefully marketing a product.</p> \n<h3>\"Tastes like Australia.\" - Vegemite</h3> \n<p>For generations, many Australians and Australian visitors have spread on Vegemite on to bread and sandwiches for extra flavor.</p> \n<p>Not only is Vegemite a common snack in Australia, but it's also been featured in global content such as <a href=\"https://media.fandom.com/wiki/Vegemite\">films or TV shows</a> that discuss the continent. And, when people who aren't from Australia see or taste Vegemite, they might ask, \"What is this made of?\"</p> \n<p>Knowing that people link Australian to Vegemite, while also wondering what's in the iconic snack, the brand launched, <a href=\"https://campaignbrief.com/vegemite-launches-first-new-ca/\">\"Tastes like Australia.\"</a> -- a new tagline and commercial in 2018.</p> \n<p>The commercial, which explains the tagline, opens with a confused person wondering how Vegemite is made. A narrator with an Australian accent then presents videos of Australian scenes -- such as sporting events, crocodiles, and destinations -- along with photos of fruit-based ingredients. Ultimately, the ad insinuates that Vegemite is metaphorically made of fruits, vegetables, cheese, and iconic scenes of Australian pride.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/11uyT7tVssE?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<h3>\"Find your thing.\" - Redbubble</h3> \n<p>Redbubble is a store chain and online store where people, organizations, or small businesses can sell clothing, art, or other items that might be considered zany, humorous, or unique. When scrolling through the site, you might find T-Shirts with pizza cat memes on them, strangely decorated pottery or pants with sparkles or brightly colored patterns.</p> \n<p>Because you can buy all sorts of unique or funny independently-made treasures on the site, Redbubble keeps its tagline broad -- but still motivating.</p> \n<p>With, \"Find your thing,\" Redbubble insinuates that there's something for everyone on the site. It also embraces that everyone has an independent style and can look to this site for the clothing or items that will allow them to embrace their inner uniqueness.</p> \n<p>Aside from including \"Find Your Thing\" in videos like the one below, Redbubble also includes a <a href=\"https://www.redbubble.com/shop/find+your+thing\">section with the same name</a> on its website.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/VHk7SX3E3O4?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>\"Find your thing.\" is a great example of how a company with many offerings can create a broad tagline that hints what their company is about without being too vague.</p> \n<h2>Crafting a Great Tagline</h2> \n<p>If you've been inspired to change or create your own tagline, here are a few themes you can take from the Australian examples above:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Keep it simple:</strong> You don't need to be vague or overly clever to persuade someone to check out your brand. Sometimes, simply reiterating your MVP -- as Canva does -- is effective enough to win over an audience.</li> \n <li><strong>Be Bold:</strong> Is your company or product known by locals, award-winning, or potentially iconic. If so, you can try incorporating your company or product achievements into a bold phrase, like Vegemite's \"Tastes like Australia.\"</li> \n <li><strong>Get clever: </strong>If you can't cram your entire mission into a short concise phrase, consider using an easily recognized metaphor or play on words, like Sukin's \"Skincare that doesn't cost the Earth.\"</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Want to learn more about brainstorming and crafting catchy taglines or slogans, check out <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/write-brand-slogan-video\">this helpful guide</a> or download the free resource below.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faustralian-taglines&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 22 Oct 2020 12:23:35 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"8251a9af44ea5979d5b14afcf633e3b1","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"pbump@hubspot.com (Pamela Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D-1.png?width=600&name=7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn16@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-49-233_c979156d20b5414e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png?width=600&name=7%20Australian%20Companies%20with%20Great%20Taglines%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn35@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-08-284_bbf42e6d54519408.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faustralian-taglines&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn54@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-09-972_391d3d384769fa4d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624891},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"The 8 Types of Social Media Community Managers (+ Job Descriptions)","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-social-media-manager-job-description","description":"<p>In the last decade, the need for social media managers has boomed. According to the U.S. Department of Labor statistics, this trend is not slowing down any time soon.</p> \n<p>The role of a social media manager or specialist is categorized within the \"Advertising, Promotions, and Marketing Manager\" sector of the labor force, which is projected to <a href=\"https://www.bls.gov/ooh/management/advertising-promotions-and-marketing-managers.htm\">grow by 10% before 2026</a>.</p> \n<p>Although more companies are hiring social media community managers, the role hasn't evolved much towards goal-oriented, metrics-driven marketing. This could be because many companies haven't figured out the right way to measure the ROI of their efforts. Because of this, they don't know how to hire someone who can help them drive real business results.</p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/ready-to-use-marketing-job-descriptions\">Download a ready-made job description for the social media manager role here.</a></h3> \n<p>With little focus on bottom-line social media efforts, companies relegate the social media role to people with little experience. Once hired, those social media specialists aren't ready to lead successful goal-oriented efforts.</p> \n<p>While a social media job might center around posting strategies, companies should broaden their search and look for experts who are also creative or strategic. Here's an example of what a strong job description for a social media role might look like:</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>A strong social media manager should have versatile skills that span from copywriting to design, but each type of social role usually requires a primary focus or expertise.</p> \n<p>If you're a manager trying to hire your next social media maven, it's important to identify how your company needs to grow first. For example, if you want to expand your brand on visual platforms, you will want to hire a social media expert with knowledge and experience related to multimedia production.</p> \n<p>If you're an aspiring social media manager, it's also important to know which skills you should hone in on to become in expert in your field.</p> \n<p>To help businesses managers and young social media specialists, we've crafted a list of eight social media job roles that could help a company grow.</p> \n<h2>Social Community Manager Jobs</h2> \n<h3>1. Copywriter</h3> \n<p>Content is a key component in any marketing strategy, especially when social media is involved. Even if you have dedicated bloggers or ebook writers, text-based content still needs to be adapted to each social network. For example, a strong social media manager might write Instagram captions with a relaxed and relatable voice, but might write in a more business-oriented voice for LinkedIn</p> \n<p>This role is typically responsible for the creation and adaptation of written content for specific social media networks. This person should be comfortable writing social posts that are as short as 140 characters or blogs over 200 words.</p> \n<h4>Skills Necessary</h4> \n<ul> \n <li>Copywriting</li> \n <li>Understanding of Brand Voice</li> \n <li>Adaptability</li> \n <li>Positioning</li> \n <li>Creativity</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How This Drives Results</h4> \n<p>Writing generic posts for all platforms might make your brand seem out of touch, so it's important to have a social media manager who can maintain a brand voice while still adapting it to different platforms. A great caption or piece of written content that speaks directly to your audience could lead to more engagement.</p> \n<h3>2. Digital or Multimedia Producer</h3> \n<p>In 2018,<a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/visual-content-marketing-strategy?_ga=2.204426264.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\"> 80% of marketers</a> used visual assets as part of their social media strategy, and 63% were regularly using video.</p> \n<p>With the growth of visual platforms like Snapchat and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/gain-instagram-followers\">Instagram</a>, and the launch of Story and Live Video features on most major social media sites, there is now a greater need for social media managers with multimedia skills.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/content%20creator%20small.jpg?width=598&amp;name=content%20creator%20small.jpg\" alt=\"Social media community manager works as a content creator by preparing a photo for a social media post\" width=\"598\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 598px;\"></p> \n<p>This type of social media manager might focus on <span><span><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ultimate-guide-social-media-image-dimensions-infographic?_ga=2.230255892.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">creating images or graphics</a></span></span><span> to accompany Facebook posts, taking and curating photos </span><span>or</span><span><span> </span>videos for Instagram, producing mobile-optimized stories for <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-create-a-snapchat-story\">Snapchat</a>, and creating other content from scratch that helps to</span><span><span> </span></span><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/building-a-social-media-following?_ga=2.207635610.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">grow your following</a><span>.</span></p> \n<h4><span>Skills Needed</span></h4> \n<ul> \n <li><span>Experience with Design Software</span></li> \n <li><span>Basic Photography and Videography</span></li> \n <li><span>Adaptability</span></li> \n <li><span>Creativity</span></li> \n</ul> \n<h4><span>How This Drives Results</span></h4> \n<p>Adapting visual content specifically for each social network yields more clicks and leads. For example, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tweet-images-improve-lead-gen-ht?_ga=2.236930953.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">in an A/B test</a>, we found that tweets including both a link and an image optimized for the platform yielded <strong>55% more leads than tweets with just a link</strong>. Adapting and creating content for each specific network is critical to driving results.</p> \n<h3>3. Social Media Metrics Analyst</h3> \n<p><span>As all marketing roles become more and more data-driven, a</span> social media community manager needs to be able to dig into the data, analyze that data, and draw actionable insights.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/analyst.jpg?width=598&amp;name=analyst.jpg\" width=\"598\" style=\"width: 598px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" alt=\"Social media community manager showing his team marketing analytics.\"><span>That includes macro data, such as overall reach and leads generated, and micro data </span><span>like individual experiments around content positioning. This person<span> should also be able to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/smart-goal-examples?_ga=2.203909400.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">set goals that are just out of reach</a> -- and find a way to hit them.</span></span></p> \n<p>A successful social media community manager enjoys looking at data and knows how to use it to make informed decisions. At the same time, this person shouldn't be so stuck in the data that it prevents experimentation and risk-taking.</p> \n<p>It's important for a social media community manager to constantly test new strategies, new content, and new campaigns. This person will be skilled at running experiments, such as <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-posting-frequency?_ga=2.203909400.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">post frequency tests</a>, and refining their social strategy based on the results.</p> \n<h4>Skills Necessary</h4> \n<ul> \n <li>Data Analysis</li> \n <li>Curiosity</li> \n <li>Experience with Running Scientific Experiments</li> \n <li>Strong Presentation Skills</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How This Drives Results</h4> \n<p>Constantly testing and analyzing results helps social media community managers build more effective standards in their routines. For example, that <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/tweet-images-improve-lead-gen-ht?_ga=2.232678551.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">Twitter image test</a> discussed above was designed, implemented, and measured by one social media manager. That experiment's results have had a serious impact on our social media efforts.</p> \n<h3>4. News Commentator and Curator</h3> \n<p>A successful social media community manager will be able to find new opportunities for the company by keeping track of their industry, news, and social media trends. They need to know where to look for the news and what people are saying about it. They also need to know what's changing on social networks and in the industry. When shifts or new trends occur, they must be able to react and respond accordingly.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/news%20small.jpeg?width=603&amp;name=news%20small.jpeg\" alt=\"A social media community manager reviews news and trends regularly.\" width=\"603\" style=\"width: 603px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">They should be skilled at \"tactful newsjacking,\" meaning the ability to (tactfully) capitalize on a news story, trend, or hashtag. And if something goes awry, they need to be able to mitigate the issue calmly and diplomatically.</p> \n<p>Recently, Netflix capitalized on the news that IHOP was changing its name to IHOB. The <a href=\"https://twitter.com/netflix/status/1006225471812468736?lang=en\">Netflix US Twitter account</a> simply tweeted, \"brb changing my name to Netflib.\" See <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/34141/10-Innovative-Social-Media-Newsjacks-of-the-Super-Bowl-Power-Outage.aspx?_ga=2.161906740.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">this list</a> for a few other great examples.</p> \n<p>The social media community manager can act as an extension of the PR team, connecting your team directly with journalists and reporters, which can result in increased coverage for the company. For<span> global brands, it will also be important for the social media community manager to be able to think outside their own region.</span></p> \n<h4>Skills Necessary</h4> \n<ul> \n <li>Content Curation</li> \n <li>Hungry for Information</li> \n <li>Effective Monitoring</li> \n <li><span>Quick Decision-making</span></li> \n <li><span>Good Judgment</span></li> \n <li>Can Think Globally</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How This Drives Results</h4> \n<p>Staying on top of trends as they rise allows your social media community manager to newsjack. Posts relating to news or trends can boost social media traffic, encourage more engagement from followers who might re-share or retweet your content, and could even gain attention from journalists looking for story fodder.</p> \n<h3>5. Customer Service Representative</h3> \n<p>When someone runs social media, they are perceived as the voice of the company. They'll constantly get questions and comments about their company's products, services, and content which might not always be positive.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/small%20customer%20service.jpeg?width=598&amp;name=small%20customer%20service.jpeg\" alt=\"A social media community manager opens his platform's messenger app to answer follower messages.\" width=\"598\" style=\"width: 598px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">The social media community manager needs to be able to communicate with people in different buying stages and mood dispositions. They're the \"traffic director.\" They must be able to understand where a follower's question or comment is coming from, address it appropriately, and provide a course of action or solution.</p> \n<p>To successfully communicate with followers, they should be intimately familiar with their company's brand, products, and services.</p> \n<h4>Skills Necessary</h4> \n<ul> \n <li>Strong Communication</li> \n <li>Adaptability</li> \n <li>Calmness</li> \n <li>Desire to Solve Others' Problems</li> \n <li>Ability to Troubleshoot</li> \n <li>Knows @here to Pass Complex Questions,</li> \n <li>Knowledge of the Company, Products, and Services</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How This Drives Results</h4> \n<p>Having a link to customer service on social media allows you to respond to customer issues on your audience's preferred platform. Responding to someone's concerns on social media, rather than over a phone call, can also save your company time, money, and other resources.</p> \n<p>Because social media is a public forum, your community manager can use these opportunities to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/service/customer-service-tweets?_ga=2.171534248.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">showcase your company's quality of customer service</a>. For example, if a company is happy with your product or tweets about a positive experience, you can retweet or share the post.</p> \n<h3>6. Community Manager and Facilitator</h3> \n<p>Part of building a following on social media is helping that following connect with each other and become a community.</p> \n<p>True communities don't simply engage with the company or moderator; they engage with <em>each other --</em> which actually scales the social media community much better, too. But <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/community-management-expert-advice?_ga=2.226002066.966289747.1558623644-1894039831.1558108101\">community management</a> takes work, including asking questions to seed discussions and kicking out people who spam or otherwise detract from the community.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/small%20community.jpg?width=598&amp;name=small%20community.jpg\" alt=\"A social media community manager responds to posts in an online discussion. \" width=\"598\" style=\"width: 598px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\">A good facilitator asks relevant and thought-provoking questions in an engaging way. Another part is setting the tone for the community, being present, enforcing community guidelines, and sometimes even removing members or deleting posts when appropriate.</p> \n<h4>Skills Necessary</h4> \n<ul> \n <li>Resourcefulness,</li> \n <li>Ability to Connect People</li> \n <li>Can Stimulate Discussion</li> \n <li>Firm but Empathetic</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How This Drives Results</h4> \n<p><span>If your followers like your community, they'll recommend it to others -- either on purpose or inadvertently by commenting and having it show up on their timeline. This leads to more exposure, which leads to more reach.</span></p> \n<p>To grow a social following, the social media community manager needs to help the company's community get value from each other.</p> \n<h3>7. Funnel Marketing Manager</h3> \n<p>Social media is a powerful tool that can help the whole funnel, not just the top. It expands the reach of your content, attracts visitors to your website, generates leads, and nurtures those prospects into becoming customers. That means a social media manager needs to be able to pick and share content in a way that will accomplish each of those goals.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/funnel-3.jpg?width=598&amp;name=funnel-3.jpg\" alt=\"A funnel marketing social community manager plans a strategy around the company's funnel.\" width=\"598\" style=\"width: 598px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\"></p> \n<p>At the top of the funnel, they need to share social content that generates leads. As they get further down the funnel, the social media expert needs to engage one-on-one with potential customers who are considering a product or service.</p> \n<p>Social media is also particularly effective as a lead nurturing tool because prospects use multiple media to consume information. Because social channels are more fast-paced than traditional media, like email, you can engage with leads in a more timely manner.</p> \n<p>Social media community managers need to have a strong understanding of the sales and marketing funnel. Then, they must understand which content is appropriate for each level of the funnel.</p> \n<p>To be effective, this manager will need to keep in touch with multiple teams in their company. For example, they'll need to pass appropriate leads to the sales team or product feedback to customer service.</p> \n<h4>Skills Necessary</h4> \n<ul> \n <li>Funnel Understanding</li> \n <li>Knowledge of Content for Each Funnel Stage</li> \n <li>Basic Sales Skills</li> \n <li>Strong Communication</li> \n</ul> \n<h4>How This Drives Results</h4> \n<p>Sharing conversion-oriented content on social media can attract more visitors to your site and convert them into leads for your sales team.
