00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"Social Media Marketing: The Ultimate Guide","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing","description":"<p>As I scroll through my Instagram feed every day (cough, cough...multiple times a day), I consistently notice new posts and stories by <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/thefryecompany/?hl=en\">The Frye Company</a>. I’ve always been a fan of their boots, clothing, and accessories, but I also love the content they share on their Instagram profile.</p> \n<p>Their posts are on-brand, creative, and aesthetically pleasing. All of their photos have the same filter on them to ensure they match — this makes their Instagram profile look professional, artistic, and organized when visitors, like myself, browse their page.</p> \n<p>Frye’s Instagram account also encourages interaction between the company and their followers by providing them with a specific <a href=\"https://www.instagram.com/explore/tags/inmyfrye/?hl=en\">hashtag</a> to use so they can be featured on the account when they post a photo with a Frye product.</p> \n<p>Frye’s Instagram account is a great example of successful social media marketing — it’s attractive, distinctly Frye, engages their 197K followers, and promotes their products.</p> \n<p><strong>But why is social media marketing so important?</strong> Why should you spend time creating social media accounts for your business? And how do you actually <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=social_media\">build a social media marketing strategy</a> that’ll work for your specific type of business?</p> \n<p>In this guide, we’ll cover the answers to all of these questions — but first, let’s define social media marketing.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p class=\"p1\"></p> \n<a></a> \n<p class=\"p1\"></p> \n<p class=\"p1\">Social media marketing is all about meeting your target audience and customers where they are and as they socially interact with each other and your brand.</p> \n<p class=\"p1\">While social media marketing as a whole is incredibly valuable and beneficial to your business growth (as you'll see in the following section), your strategy will differ based on <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing#determine-which-social-platforms-youll-market-on\">which social networks your audience spends their time on</a>.</p> \n<p class=\"p1\">Before we dig deeper into social media marketing, let's <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5EG1TNEsMvQ&amp;feature=youtu.be\">segment the strategy by platform</a>.</p> \n<h3>Facebook</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/346167/facebook-global-dau/#:~:text=During%20the%20first%20quarter%20of,percent%20of%20monthly%20active%20users.&amp;text=With%20over%202.6%20billion%20monthly,most%20popular%20social%20network%20worldwide.\">1.79 billion</a> <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">daily</span> active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Generation X and millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Brand awareness; advertising</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Twitter</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/970920/monetizable-daily-active-twitter-users-worldwide/\">186 million</a> <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">daily</span> active users worldwide<a href=\"https://awario.com/blog/36-surprising-social-media-statistics-you-should-know-in-2019/\"></a></li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2B and B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Public relations; customer service</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Instagram</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/253577/number-of-monthly-active-instagram-users/\">1 billion</a> <em>monthly</em> active users</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Natural-looking media, behind-the-scenes, and user-generated content; advertising</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>LinkedIn</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/resources/digital-2020\">675 million</a> <em>monthly</em> active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Baby boomers, Generation X, and millennials</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2B</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: B2B relationships, business development, and employment marketing</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>YouTube</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/about/press/#:~:text=Global%20Reach,watchtime%20comes%20from%20mobile%20devices.\">Over 2 billion</a> logged-in <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">monthly</span> users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Millennials, closely followed by Generation Z</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Brand awareness; entertainment, and how-to videos</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Snapchat</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/545967/snapchat-app-dau/#:~:text=With%20an%20estimated%2046%20million,such%20as%20Twitter%20or%20Facebook.\">249 million</a> <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">daily</span> active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily Generation Z</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Brand awareness; advertising</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>Pinterest</h3> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Users</strong>: <a href=\"https://www.statista.com/statistics/463353/pinterest-global-mau/\">416 million</a> <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">monthly</span> active users worldwide</li> \n <li><strong>Audience</strong>: Primarily older millennials and younger baby boomers</li> \n <li><strong>Industry impact</strong>: B2C</li> \n <li><strong>Best for</strong>: Visual advertising; inspiration</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Now that we've detailed the fundamentals of each social media network, let's discuss why social media marketing is beneficial for your business.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>Benefits of Social Media Marketing</strong></h2> \n<p>There are a variety of reasons why your company should use social media marketing. We’ve created a list of the four most beneficial reasons to consider.</p> \n<p>Let's dive in.</p> \n<h3>1. Increase Brand Awareness</h3> \n<p>In 2018, there were over <a href=\"https://awario.com/blog/36-surprising-social-media-statistics-you-should-know-in-2019/\">3.2 billion people on social media globally</a>. Due to the sheer amount of people on social media, you can see why ensuring your business is sharing content related to your products as well as details about your company via a platform or two has the potential to help you improve <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/brand-awareness#establish\">brand awareness</a>.</p> \n<p>In fact, social media has been proven to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/powerful-techniques-boost-brand-social-media-list\">boost brand awareness</a> by driving up engagement. Social engagement includes things like comments, likes, shares, and re-posts. Social media also helps you increase brand awareness by directing traffic straight to your site. You can do this by including direct links to your website in your profile, bio, and posts.</p> \n<p><strong>Featured Resource</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-build-a-brand?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">How to Build a Brand for Your Company</a></li> \n</ul> \n<a></a> \n<h3>2. Generate Leads and Boost Conversions</h3> \n<p>Promoting and sharing your products on social media is a simple way to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/beginner-inbound-lead-generation-guide-ht\">improve lead generation</a>, boost conversions, and increase sales because you’re advertising to people who have opted to engage with you by following your account.</p> \n<p>Here are some examples of ways you can <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/insiders/generate-more-leads-on-social-media\">use social media to generate more leads.</a></p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Create contests</strong> for your visitors and followers to participate in on your social media profiles.</li> \n <li><strong> Include links to your website and offers</strong> in the bio sections of your profiles.</li> \n <li><strong>Host live videos </strong>to make announcements about products and provide updates or details about exciting news at your company.</li> \n <li><strong>Implement a </strong><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-campaigns\">social media marketing campaign</a> on one of your channels.</li> \n <li><strong>Sell your products through your social profiles</strong>. For example, you can enable <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/business/help/912190892201033\">Facebook’s Shop Section</a> or <a href=\"https://business.instagram.com/a/shopping-on-instagram\">Instagram's Shopping feature</a> on your profiles. These features allow your visitors and followers to click on products you’ve shared in posts to view information such as price, material, and size. Then, visitors can easily proceed to checkout through the platform and buy the product directly from you.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. Foster Relationships With Customers</h3> \n<p>By connecting and engaging with your social media followers, you’ll be able to build lasting relationships between them and your business. You can do this by interacting with them on your posts, responding to their questions and comments, and providing them with any help they may need.</p> \n<p>You can also ask your followers questions about your products, their pain points, or create giveaways to help you build trust and show them how much you value their input and support.</p> \n<h3>4. Learn From Competitors</h3> \n<p>Social media is a great way to keep tabs on your competitors — whether that’s in reference to their social media tactics, the products they’re promoting, the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-campaigns\">campaigns</a> they’re implementing, or their level of interaction with followers.</p> \n<p>Social media allows you to get a look at what is and isn’t working for your competition, and therefore helps you decide what should or shouldn’t change in terms of <em>your</em> company’s approach. Lastly, reviewing the social accounts of your competitors can help you make sure your marketing stands out and is unique to your brand.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/competitive-analysis-kit?hubs_post-cta=pillar_allphrase\"><em>Learn how to conduct a competitive analysis to discover how you can beat the competition.</em></a></p> \n<p>Now, let’s talk strategy — there are five steps to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/customers/sustainable-social-media-strategy\">ensure your social media marketing plan is sustainable</a> and positively impacts your business.</p> \n<a></a> \n<p class=\"p1\"></p> \n<p>Let’s cover these steps in more detail so you can begin applying them to your business.</p> \n<h3>1. Research your buyer personas and audience.</h3> \n<p>The first step to creating a social media marketing strategy is to determine who your <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/buyer-persona-research\">buyer personas</a> and audience are so you can target their needs and interests appropriately. To do this, think about the people you’re trying to reach and why, and how you would classify them as a group. For example, if your company sells trendy leggings and joggers, you might classify your target audience as millennials who like to wear stylish athletic apparel regularly — a style known as <a href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/terms/a/athleisure.asp\">athleisure</a>.</p> \n<p>By considering your buyer personas and audience, you’ll then be able to determine what content will attract the type followers and customers you hope to gain and how you can create engaging content to keep your followers interested.</p> \n<p><strong>Featured Resource</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/persona-templates?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">Buyer Persona Templates</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/make-my-persona?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">Make My Persona Tool</a></li> \n</ul> \n<a></a> \n<h3>2. Determine which social platforms you’ll market on.</h3> \n<p>As a social media marketer, it’s crucial you determine which platforms you’re going to share your content on. There’s not necessarily a right or wrong answer when it comes to which social channels your business should use — it’s more about the needs of your target audience and where they tend to spend their time.</p> \n<blockquote> \n <p>“It's important to be where your audience of potential customers is today, and where they might be tomorrow. It's better to be ahead of the curve than behind.” — Andrew Delaney, Social Media Marketing Manager at HubSpot</p> \n</blockquote> \n<p>For example, if you are going for that target audience of athleisure-loving millennials, you may want to focus the majority of your social media efforts on <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/integrations/instagram\">Instagram</a> — this is because <a href=\"https://blog.hootsuite.com/instagram-demographics/\">millennials</a> cover the largest portion of users on the platform.</p> \n<p><strong>Featured Resources</strong></p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/snapchat-for-business?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">A Marketer's Guide to Snapchat for Business</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/facebook-ad-examples?hubs_post-cta=inline-text&amp;_ga=2.166263099.465005662.1556543642-1307414301.1541080541\">50 Facebook Ad Examples We Actually Clicked</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/youtube-for-business?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">YouTube for Business: A 30-Day Roadmap for Growth</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-use-twitter-for-business?hubs_post-cta=inline-text\">How to Use Twitter for Business (+ Follower Tracking Template)</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/how-to-use-pinterest-for-business?hubs_post-cta=author\">12 Pinterest Templates for Business</a></li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. Create unique and engaging content.</h3> \n<p>With the billions of social media users around the globe, there’s no question that at least <em>some</em> of your followers — or the people browsing your profile — have also seen your competitor’s content or that of other businesses in your industry. That’s why you must have <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/proven-social-media-engagement-strategies\">engaging social media content</a> that stands out and provides viewers with a reason to click that “Follow” button and interact with your brand.</p> \n<p>To help you get creative, consider the content your competitors are sharing and how you can uniquely promote your products. Also, take advantage of the features offered by the platform you’re using. For example, you can create live videos on Facebook to share the latest details about a product launch or conduct a giveaway.</p> \n<p>Lastly, use your current customers and promoters to help you generate content. You can do this by re-posting their content or encouraging them to use a hashtag to share their own experiences and pictures with your products (similar to Frye’s Instagram hashtag that I mentioned earlier).</p> \n<a></a> \n<h3>4. Organize a schedule for your posts.</h3> \n<p>One of the easiest ways to ensure your content is shared as planned is to use a social media management solution. These tools allow you to write captions, prepare pictures and videos, and schedule posts in advance. They also automatically share your content on schedule and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/29437/20-free-social-media-and-brand-monitoring-tools-that-rock.aspx?_ga=2.150639797.2053315133.1572189466-237440449.1568656505\">monitor</a> all post interactions and engagement for you. Social media management solutions save you time and allow you to focus on your other tasks.</p> \n<p>There are a number of solution options available — here are a few examples.</p> \n<h5>1) HubSpot</h5> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/social-inbox\">HubSpot</a> offers a social media tool — as part of the <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing\">marketing software</a> — to help you publish and monitor your content and create real connections with your followers. You can schedule and publish your content in advance and compare in-depth reports on your posts’ engagement to understand the performance of various platforms, types of content, and posting times.</p> \n<h5>2) Sprout Social</h5> \n<p><a href=\"https://ecosystem.hubspot.com/marketplace/apps/marketing/social-media/sprout-social\">Sprout Social</a> is a social media marketing and management solution designed to help your team organize and plan content creation, manage campaigns, understand engagement, and review content reports and analysis.</p> \n<h5>3) Hootsuite</h5> \n<p><a href=\"https://hootsuite.com/\">Hootsuite</a> is a social media management platform for finding, scheduling, managing, and reporting on your content. You can schedule posts in advance on <em>all</em> of your channels at once and measure your ROI with comprehensive content analysis.</p> \n<h4>How often should you post on social media?</h4> \n<p>Now, you might be wondering how often you should post content on your social media channels.</p> \n<p>As a rule of thumb, you should only post on social when you have <em>quality</em> content to share. Meaning, there’s a reason you’re posting the content. This is how you’ll strike the right balance when it comes to your posting frequency. If you post too <em>infrequently</em>, you’re bound to be forgotten by your followers. If you post too <em>frequently</em>, you’ll likely become annoying to your followers. Both situations could potentially lead to a loss in followers and a decrease in engagement.</p> \n<p>To avoid this, there are plenty of studies and resources available explaining <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-frequency-industry-benchmarks\">social media post frequency standards by industry</a> and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-frequently-should-i-publish-on-social-media\">platform</a> for you to follow. Every business is different, so find what works for your audience. Then, you can begin experimenting with more or fewer posts, as well as other factors such as the <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-times-post-pin-tweet-social-media-infographic\">time of day you’re posting on social</a>, to determine what provides the highest level of engagement.</p> \n<h3>5. Analyze your impact and results.</h3> \n<p>One of the most important aspects of social media marketing is ensuring your efforts are successful in helping you meet your goals. To determine this, you’ll need to keep track of all of your posts, on every channel. You can do this by reviewing and managing your social media metrics.</p> \n<h4>Social Media Metrics</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://sproutsocial.com/insights/social-media-metrics-that-matter/\">Social media metrics</a> are data related to the success of your posts and your impact on your audience and customers on various platforms. These metrics may include data about your level of engagement, likes, follows, shares, and all other interactions on each platform.</p> \n<p>Here are 10 of the most important metrics for you to track:</p> \n<ol> \n <li><strong>Engagement:</strong> This includes clicks, comments, likes, and replies on your social media posts. There are also platform-specific types of engagement such as “<a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/1744643532522513\">Saved</a>” posts on Instagram and “<a href=\"https://help.pinterest.com/en/article/create-a-pin-from-your-photos\">Pinned</a>” posts on Pinterest.</li> \n <li><strong>Reach: </strong>The number of people who have seen any content associated with your page or profile is your reach.</li> \n <li><strong>Followers: </strong>This is the number of people you have on your profile who have clicked your “Follow” button and see your content in their feeds regularly.</li> \n <li><strong>Impressions: </strong>This is the number of times a post from your profile or page is seen, whether or not your audience members click on it. This is often what happens when someone is scrolling through their newsfeed, but not clicking on anything.</li> \n <li><strong>Video views: </strong>On Facebook, Snapchat, Instagram, or any other social channel with video capabilities, this is the number of views each gets.</li> \n <li><strong>Profile visits: </strong>The number of people who have opened your social media page is your number of profile visits.</li> \n <li><strong>Mentions: </strong>This is the number of times your profile has been mentioned by audience members in their posts.</li> \n <li><strong>Tags: </strong>This is when your audience adds the name of your company’s profile or your hashtag to another post.</li> \n <li><strong>Reposts: </strong>This is when a member of your audience posts a piece of your content on their profile.</li> \n <li><strong>Shares: </strong>These are the posts your followers and audience take from your profile and share with their network.</li> \n</ol> \n<p>You can influence all of these metrics, increase your social following, and improve overall engagement on your profile by using the same tactics you would to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing#Generate-leads-and-boost-conversions\">generate leads and boost conversions</a>. You can also interact with your followers more frequently by talking to them, tagging them in content, responding to their questions, liking their posts, encouraging them to use your hashtags, and share your content (and you can also repost user-generated content).</p> \n<h5><strong>How to Measure Social Media Metrics</strong></h5> \n<p>You can review social media metrics in a variety of ways, For example, you can use the analytics tools built into the various platforms you use. Here are a few examples:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><a href=\"https://business.twitter.com/en/analytics.html\">Twitter Analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://analytics.facebook.com/\">Facebook Analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://help.instagram.com/1533933820244654\">Instagram Insights</a></li> \n</ul> \n<p>You might also choose to use an analytics and tracking tool such as <a href=\"https://analytics.google.com/analytics/web/provision/?authuser=0#/provision\">Google Analytics</a>. This is a great option if you want to track your social media <em>and</em> website metrics. Lastly, many <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/social-media-marketing#social-media-scheduling-solutions\">social media scheduling solutions</a> — as we reviewed earlier — have monitoring and tracking features automatically built in. All of these metrics tracking tools will give you a better understanding of what your followers and audience respond well to and what you should consider modifying to improve engagement.</p> \n<p>Now that we’ve reviewed the benefits of social media marketing and how to build your strategy, let’s talk about the various resources available to help you along the way.</p> \n<a></a> \n<h2><strong>Social Media Marketing Resources</strong></h2> \n<p>There are a plethora of social media marketing resources you can use to build a social strategy for your company. You’re bound to feel more confident about working on your company’s social media marketing initiative with the help of the following courses, training, and books.</p> \n<h3>Social Media Marketing Courses and Training</h3> \n<p>Here are three ways to earn an education in the field of social media marketing if you feel it’s necessary for your specific business situation.</p> \n<h4>1. Earn a degree.</h4> \n<p>Although there isn’t necessarily a “social media marketing degree” for undergraduates, there are online courses offered at a number of different schools and institutions you can take to earn a <a href=\"https://www.fordham.edu/info/24448/digital_and_social_media_certificate\">certificate</a>, <a href=\"https://digital.bu.edu/product/strategic-social-media-marketing/\">MicroMaster's</a> or <a href=\"https://www.snhu.edu/online-degrees/masters/ms-in-marketing/social-media-marketing\">master’s degree</a> in the field.</p> \n<h4>2. Use an online learning website.</h4> \n<p><a href=\"https://www.lynda.com/\">Lynda</a> is another great educational resource. This online learning website offers training, tutorials, and courses on a wide variety of topics within the field of <a href=\"https://www.lynda.com/Social-Media-Marketing-training-tutorials/1366-0.html\">social media marketing</a>.</p> \n<h4>3. Earn a certificate administered by a company.</h4> \n<p>You might choose to earn a certificate from a company — such as <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/social-media?hubs_post-cta=user-blog-bottom-course-social-media-cert&amp;hsCtaTracking=e57a9bd8-9739-400f-b752-8ebbe9349272%7C2f1aaee4-ef3d-4e25-a55b-4b2fb351e97b\">HubSpot's social media certification</a>. This free certification teaches you how to engage with your customers and improve conversions. You’ll also get a better understanding of how to develop your strategy, extend your reach, and measure your social media ROI.</p> \n<h3>Social Media Marketing Books</h3> \n<p>Reading relevant content about social media marketing is another great way to learn more about the field. Here are a few examples of some highly-regarded books on the topic.</p> \n<p><strong>1. <em><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Likeable-Social-Media-Customers-Irresistible/dp/0071762345\">Likable Social Media: How to Delight Your Customers, Create an Irresistible Brand, and Be Generally Amazing on Facebook</a></em> by Dave Kerpen</strong></p> \n<p>This New York Times Bestseller covers the reasons why being likable and engaging with followers on social media is one of the most powerful ways to grow your base of customers and promoters. The book teaches you how to make impactful content for your followers to interact with and share with <em>their</em> networks. Author Dave Kerpen also describes why you need to ensure you’re consistently delighting your followers to avoid losing them at any point in time.</p> \n<p><strong>2. <a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Jab-Right-Hook-Story-Social/dp/006227306X\"><em>Jab, Jab, Jab, Right Hook: How to Tell Your Story in a Noisy Social World</em></a> by Gary Vaynerchuk</strong></p> \n<p>According to author Gary Vaynerchuk, the key to social media marketing success isn’t about pushing out a lot of content — it’s about pushing out specific content tailored towards your target audience and using the right platform to do so.</p> \n<p>In his book, Vaynerchuk covers how to do this as well as connect with your followers and customers on a deeper level through social media. You’ll learn how to create memorable and unique content that stands out in comparison to competition’s content.</p> \n<p><strong>3. <em><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/B2B-Social-Media-Book-Generating/dp/1118167767/ref=asc_df_1118167767/?tag=hyprod-20&amp;linkCode=df0&amp;hvadid=312045876164&amp;hvpos=1o1&amp;hvnetw=g&amp;hvrand=469068391632046674&amp;hvpone=&amp;hvptwo=&amp;hvqmt=&amp;hvdev=c&amp;hvdvcmdl=&amp;hvlocint=&amp;hvlocphy=1018127&amp;hvtargid=pla-593904282434&amp;psc=1\">The B2B Social Media Book: Become a Marketing Superstar by Generating Leads with Blogging, LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook, Email, and More</a></em> by Kipp Bodnar</strong></p> \n<p>HubSpot’s CMO, Kipp Bodnar, writes about the ways B2B businesses can generate more leads and conversions through social media marketing. There are actionable methods you can take to increase your base of followers and drive leads as well as understand the ROI of various B2B social media marketing strategies.</p> \n<h2><strong>Start Marketing on Social Media</strong></h2> \n<p>Considering there are billions of people on social media today, it’s easy to see why so many businesses and marketers use the channel to promote their products and engage with customers.</p> \n<p>Although determining <em>your</em> company’s social media course of action may seem daunting, you can avoid feeling overwhelmed by understanding <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/marketing-trends\">social media marketing trends</a> and using some of the many resources available about the topic. So, start working on your business’ social media marketing strategy today to increase your number of followers, improve engagement, and boost conversions.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in March 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p> \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-marketing&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \" />","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 23 Oct 2020 12:51:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"49e0788d0af1ee5b9ad57b15d093f41e","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"krbaker@hubspot.com (Kristen Baker)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fsocial-media-marketing&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn47@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-53-52-112_3b9b05668901d2a1.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624902},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"5 Brands That Won Australian Advertising Awards [+What Marketers Can Learn From Them]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/australian-advertising-awards","description":"<p>With all the work marketing teams are responsible for, it can be hard to make time to get reinspired and capture <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-stay-creative-under-pressure\">a spark of creativity</a> that leads to a new, marketing strategy. This can be even more problematic for brands in physically isolated areas.</p>  \n<p>Take Australia for example. Its distance from other English-speaking regions like America and Europe can make it challenging for marketers to spread brand awareness globally. Ultimately, to gain even regional awareness, Australian brands must build competitive and innovative marketing strategies to stand out and grab attention from audiences.</p> \n<p>So, what do you do when you work for a brand in a place like Australia, and just can't come up with a marketing idea that takes your company to the next level?</p> \n<p>Look to award-winning brands for inspiration.</p> \n<p>One great place to start could be country-specific award ceremonies. By following these competitions, you can learn more about how brands in your area are effectively working towards national or global awareness.</p> \n<p>In Australia, one major advertising and marketing award competition that brands and agencies look to is <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/worldwide/about\">The Effies</a>.</p> \n<p>The Effies is a marketing and advertising competition that includes regional and global ceremonies. Each year, brands are awarded for <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/worldwide/about\">advertising strategies, rebranding tactics, effective marketing techniques, and innovative campaigns</a>. Brands that win the Grand Effie in their region are also eligible for the global competition. Past global winners include major brands like <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/cases\">Dove, Coca-Cola, and Microsoft</a>.</p> \n<p>While this year's Global Effie Awards have already been announced, Australia's 2020 Effie Winners will be <a href=\"https://www.effies.com.au/home.aspx\">revealed at the end of October</a>.</p> \n<p>To help inspire innovative strategies or campaigns from marketers, advertisers, and agencies in Australia or similar territories, here are five past Effie Award winners, plus two 2020 nominees to learn from.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>5 Australian Effie Award Winners Marketers Can Learn From</h2> \n<h3>Great Northern Brewing Co.'s 2019 Ads - Carlton &amp; United Breweries</h3> \n<h4><strong>Awards:</strong> 2019 Gold and Grand Effie Award</h4> \n<p>Way back in 2015, Carlton &amp; United Breweries' team launched Great Northern Brewing Co. But, the young brand found it difficult to compete with beer brands that already had decades of Australian credibility and brand loyalty behind them.</p> \n<p>But, after the new beer brand teamed up with <a href=\"https://www.clemengerbbdo.com.au/en\">Clemenger BBDO</a> to launch ads targeting young adult adventurers and older Australian beer lovers -- Great Northern became <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/press_room/316/detail\">the top-selling beer in Australia</a>.</p> \n<p>Great Northern's effective advertising strategy involved video content and commercials that embraced young and old beer drinkers, as well as Australia's great outdoors. One of the most memorable pieces of content within the Great Northern strategy was a video called, \"The Great ReCamp.\"</p> \n<p>The mini-documentary, which launched ahead of Father's Day in 2019, tells the story of a real father and adult son who go camping after a life-threatening cancer diagnosis.</p> \n<p>The video begins with the words, \"For most of us, our first memories of the great outdoors begin with our fathers.\"</p> \n<p>After presenting footage of a young boy camping with his dad, the documentary flashes forward into the future where that boy, now an adult, talks about how he loved going camping but eventually lost touch with his family when he moved away to focus on his career.</p> \n<p>After years away, the son explains that he rushed home when his father was battling life-threatening cancer. When his father recovered, the son says he decided to take him on the same camping trip they used to go on.</p> \n<p>The documentary shows visuals of the father and son bonding by the fire, fishing together, swimming in rivers, and subtly drinking Great Northern Beer at multiple points.</p> \n<p>As the camping montage comes to a close, the son narrates, \"We don't need everything we've got these days. Sometimes we need to remind ourselves of that. Camping does that. -- You can't bring everything with you.\"</p> \n<p>The video ends with the two men sitting at their campsite. The father passes his son a Great Northern and asks, \"You know that happy place?\" He looks out at the grassy Australian landscape before clinking beers with his son.</p> \n<p>Text appears that says, \"Sometimes you need to go far and wide to stay close. -- Go camping with Dad this Father's Day.\"</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/z3Tw9RU6H5M?feature=oembed\" width=\"480\" height=\"270\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>With content like that above, Great Northern positions itself as a beer for Australian adventurers of all ages. By telling the story of a nostalgic father-son journey, Great Northern ties emotion, relatability, and Australian pride to its beer. This enables the beer to compete against major breweries that have decades of brand loyalty.</p> \n<p>When the Grand Effie was announced, <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/press_room/316/detail\">the Judges' statement</a> said, \"This is a classic case of how good marketing and advertising can still build a minor brand into a market leader.\"</p> \n<p>\"In 2015, XXXX Gold outsold Great Northern by a factor of six to one. Four years later, Great Northern became Australia’s top-selling beer. This was achieved through well-considered insight, strategy, and execution,\" <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/press_room/316/detail\">the statement</a> added. “The Great Northern case study is a model for all students of advertising.”</p> \n<h3>\"Help is Who We Are\" - NRMA Insurance</h3> \n<h4><strong>Award: </strong>2019 Gold Effie</h4> \n<p>After seeing <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2019_009\">customer decline since 2014</a>, NRMA insurance, a home insurance policy company, teamed up with <a href=\"https://themonkeys.com.au/about/\">The Monkeys</a> to create a campaign that brought a <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2019_009\">\"new purpose\"</a> to its brand and product.</p> \n<p>As <a href=\"https://disasterphilanthropy.org/disaster/2019-australian-wildfires/#:~:text=At%20least%203%2C500%20homes%20and,3%20of%20the%20burned%20area.\">Australian forest fires</a> rendered koala's nearly extinct, NRMA's campaign aimed to market an initiative where the insurance company would plant a tree for every home insurance policy sold. Unsurprisingly, the campaign's mascot was an adorable koala bear.</p> \n<p>The title of NRMA's campaign, which ran <a href=\"https://campaignbrief.com/nrma-insurance-looks-to-protect-koala-homes-with-new-brand-campaign-via-the-monkeys/\">across TV, radio, print, and social media</a> was, \"Help is who we are.\"</p> \n<div>\n <img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/5%20Brands%20That%20Won%20Australian%20Advertising%20Awards%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png?width=200&amp;name=5%20Brands%20That%20Won%20Australian%20Advertising%20Awards%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png\" alt=\"NRMA help is who we are campaign\" width=\"200\" style=\"width: 200px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">\n</div> \n<p style=\"font-size: 10px; text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2019_009\" style=\"font-weight: normal; font-style: italic;\">Image Source</a></p> \n<p>One of the campaign's commercials, titled \"Every Home Is Worth Protecting,\" tells the story of a boy who befriends and tries to save an endangered koala.</p> \n<p>At the beginning of the ad, the boy's riding his bike down a street with no trees when he sees the scared bear holding a wooden powerline pole. After stopping, wondering if he should do something, and ultimately riding away from the bear, the boy lies awake at night with guilt as he stares at a picture of a koala in his bedroom.</p> \n<p>When he returns to the powerline the next day with a wagon, he sees no koala and gets angry -- assuming that it was hurt or killed.</p> \n<p>Luckily, he turns around to find the koala peacefully sitting in his wagon.</p> \n<p>The boy brings the koala to the wilderness, where multiple new trees are planted. The bear climbs up a fully-grown tree as the boy waves goodbye. A text overlay on the screen reads, \"We're planting a tree for every home insurance policy.\"</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/MrRocV-oBgw?feature=oembed\" width=\"480\" height=\"270\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>By working with <a href=\"https://campaignbrief.com/nrma-insurance-looks-to-protect-koala-homes-with-new-brand-campaign-via-the-monkeys/\">Conservation Volunteers Australia</a> to plant trees in Queensland and New South Wales, as well as marketing the initiative on multiple channels, NRMA demonstrates that it's an insurance company that cares about its clients as well as the environment.</p> \n<p>Additionally, by planting a tree for every policy sold, NRMA gives prospects more motivation to choose its insurance company. When customers buy a policy, they protect themselves from home damage, but can also feel good about helping a koala in need.</p> \n<p>\"When it comes to reviving your brand, its original purpose can be easily overlooked. This is an important reminder that sometimes it’s best to go back to your roots, and that exceptional value can be unlocked by reinterpreting what made your brand great to begin with,\" NRMA wrote in <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2019_009\">its Effie submission.</a></p> \n<p>According to the <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2019_009\">submission</a>, \"NRMA Insurance reversed 8-years of declining customer numbers and reached customers for the first time since April 2014, despite a growing price premium.\"</p> \n<p>“For an insurance brand synonymous with helping Australians, it made so much sense when we landed on the idea of home insurance for koalas. A campaign dedicated to protecting the homes of our furry friends,\" said Vince Lagana, executive creative director of The Monkeys, in a <a href=\"https://campaignbrief.com/nrma-insurance-looks-to-protect-koala-homes-with-new-brand-campaign-via-the-monkeys/\">statement to Campaign Brief</a>.</p> \n<h3>\"Coolest Suit on the Planet\" - M.J. Bale</h3> \n<h4><strong>Award:</strong> 2018 Gold Effie</h4> \n<p>Through market research, M.J. Bale, an Australian men's fashion brand, discovered that <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2018_01\">82% of male shoppers think of wool as a winter fabric</a>. Because of this association, M.J. Bale feared that prospects might <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2018_01\">sacrifice a wool suit's classic and professional look</a> for more comfortable attire -- especially in hot climates like Australia.</p> \n<p>To prove that people can comfortably wear suits in any hot climate, M.J. Bale created a line of wool suits -- called \"Cool Wool\" and teamed up with TBWA\\Sydney to launch a partially immersive campaign called, \"Coolest Suit on the Planet.\"</p> \n<p>Half of the campaign featured a video series that was aired in M.J. Bale stores and on its social media channels. This content followed <a href=\"https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3644198/\">Good Morning Britain</a> weatherman <a href=\"https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4316553/\">Alex Beresford</a> as he tracked and traveled to the hottest places on Earth wearing M.J. Bale's Cool Wool suit.</p> \n<p>As the weatherman traveled to areas like China, Africa, and India, which were often over 43 degrees Celsius, M.J. Bale shoppers in Australia could go into the brand's shops, put on a Cool Wool suit, and stand in a heating chamber that enabled them to experience wearing the suit in hot locations around the world.</p> \n<p>You can check out a reel that highlights the overall <a href=\"https://vimeo.com/234929086\">campaign by clicking here</a>.</p> \n<p>According to its <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/case_database/case/AU_2018_01\">Effie submission</a>, ‘The Coolest Suit on the Planet’ campaign increased M.J. Bale suit sales by 78%, rose foot-traffic by 54%, and delivered a 344% ROI</p> \n<p>This was a great example of how videos, influencers, and immersive marketing tactics can be used to address prospects' concerns about a product and persuade them to buy it anyway. By combining in-store experiences and video content, M.J. Bale increased store visits that led to purchases.</p> \n<p>Ultimately, If audiences aren't persuaded to buy an M.J. Bale Cool Wool suit after seeing a weather expert comfortably travel through hot terrain in it, they might be convinced once they actually get to stress-test the outfit for themselves.</p> \n<h3>Dare Iced Coffee's Nonsensical Ads - Lion Dairy and Drinks</h3> \n<h4><strong>Awards:</strong> 2017 Gold and Grand Effies</h4> \n<p>Have you ever felt confused and in a fog before drinking your coffee in the morning? This is a feeling that <a href=\"http://www.dareicedcoffee.com.au/\">Dare Iced Coffee</a> played up to extremes in a series of funny ads that led to Gold and Grand Effies.</p> \n<p>Beginning in 2016, Dare Iced Coffee, and its owner <a href=\"https://www.lionco.com/about-us/our-business/lion-dairy-drinks\">Lion Dairy and Drinks</a>, partnered with <a href=\"https://www.ajfpartnership.com.au/about/\">AJF</a> to create commercials where everyday people do something completely nonsensical because they haven't had their daily dose of iced coffee yet. Once the protagonists in each ad take a sip of the product, they instantly start thinking clearly again.</p> \n<p>In one of the campaign's funniest ads, a father named Dave carries his dog in a baby carrier instead of his infant.</p> \n<p>When Dave's friend sees him, waves, and looks confused, an Australian narrator says, \"Uh oh. Dave's got his fur child mixed up with his real child?\" Dave looks down startled to realize the predicament he's placed himself in. Meanwhile, the dog looks up at the camera and barks, \"Dave-o!\"</p> \n<p>From there, the ad cuts to product shots of iced coffee being poured as the narrator explains the taste-related benefits of Dare's product.</p> \n<p>The narration ends with, \"A Dare fix'll fix it!\", as viewers see the father confidently drinking his coffee with his child back in the carrier.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/4WNQzNFCMCY?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Dare's ads were short, sweet, and memorable for their humor. They also impressively manage to fill short 30-second slots with full comedic storylines and valuable facts about Dare coffee. Not only are the ads entertaining, but they also differentiate Dare from its many competitors.</p> \n<p>\"Dare successfully took on Australian iced coffee brands and international pick-me-ups by creating a new consumption occasion: becoming the habitual choice for whenever people are not thinking straight,\" <a href=\"https://www.effie.org/press_room/236/detail\">notes an article on the Effies' official website</a>. \"Effie judges noted that the strategic challenge was significant given the breadth and strength of competition in the category. The objective was both clear and ambitious, and delivered outstanding growth and ROI.\"</p> \n<h3>Narellan Pools' Data-Driven Ad Campaign - Narellan Pools</h3> \n<h4><strong>Awards:</strong> 2016 Gold Effie</h4> \n<p>Because most of its customers only consider installing pools in the summer months, <a href=\"https://narellanpools.com.au/\">Narellan Pools</a> wanted to create a marketing strategy that would increase conversion earlier in the year.</p> \n<p>Narellan worked with <a href=\"https://affinity.ad/\">Affinity</a>, an Australian agency, to build a database of market research, their company's conversion history, and weather data to determine the times of the year when interested pool prospects were getting serious about home installations.</p> \n<p>Through the data-backed strategy, Narellan and Affinity discovered that the most optimal time for pool-related conversions was during the <a href=\"https://affinity.ad/work/diving-into-data-for-narellan-pools/\">first two consecutively warm days of each calendar year</a>. From there, Narellan increased ad spend and targeting of prospective pool buyers just before the weather started to get warm, with some of the heaviest spend being used during the first two consecutive hot days.</p> \n<p>The content within the targeted ads emphasized the \"bliss\" one feels when diving into a pool. Here's one of the ads, titled, \"A Splash of Bliss.\"</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe src=\"https://player.vimeo.com/video/135936603?app_id=122963\" width=\"480\" height=\"270\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>The short video shows a woman diving into a pool as a narrator describes how magical an early morning swim can feel -- especially in a Narellan Pool.</p> \n<p>Through Narellan and Affinity's data-driven strategy, Narellan reduced its <a href=\"https://affinity.ad/work/diving-into-data-for-narellan-pools/\">annual media spend by 30% while increasing sales by 23%</a>.</p> \n<p>Below is a video case study that describes how the paid ad strategy worked:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 640px; max-height: 360px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe src=\"https://player.vimeo.com/video/204136316?app_id=122963\" width=\"640\" height=\"360\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Narellan's strategy is a great example of how brands can leverage data to learn more about prospective buyers and make their advertising tactics even more effective.</p> \n<p>\"Our data-driven targeting allowed maximized exposure of our insightful campaign to exactly the right audience – and only at their tipping point of purchase consideration – delivering game-changing results,\" <a href=\"https://affinity.ad/work/diving-into-data-for-narellan-pools/\">Affinity notes on its website</a>.</p> \n<h2>Australian Effie Nominees</h2> \n<h3>\"You don't need Australia's Best Network -- Until You Do.\" - Telstra</h3> \n<p>In 2019, <a href=\"https://www.telstra.com.au/\">Telstra</a> -- a telecommunications brand used by millions of Australians -- partnered with <a href=\"https://themonkeys.com.au/\">The Monkeys</a> for a series of advertisements showing how people benefit from a strong network.</p> \n<p>One of the campaign's most emotional and <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/inclusive-marketing-campaigns\">inclusive</a> ads follows a man coming out about his sexuality to his parents by telling them he's engaged to his partner.</p> \n<p>At the beginning of the ad, the couple sits in their car following a proposal. The man who was proposed to nervously wonders how he's going to tell his parents as his supportive partner says, \"You'll have to tell them sometime.\"</p> \n<p>When the nervous man whispers, \"I'm gonna do it,\" and pulls out his phone, he sees he has no reception. His partner says, \"It's okay. Use mine.\"</p> \n<p>Using his partner's smartphone powered by Telstra's network, the man successfully reaches his parents and nervously reveals he's engaged to a male partner. The parents happily congratulate and accept the son for who he is.</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/xqZm-_ESz1E?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Telstra's campaign and the commercial above is effective because it highlights the major milestones or moments when we all want or need our phone service to work properly. Not only does the ad show us how well the service works, but it also allows us to relate to the brand and its mission on a more human level.</p> \n<p>“Whether it’s sharing big news, changing plans in a hurry, or quickly looking up something important, it’s nice to know that Australia’s best network is there for you when you need it,\" said The Monkeys' Creative Director Stuart Alexander <a href=\"https://www.adnews.com.au/campaigns/telstra-demonstrates-moments-where-only-the-best-network-will-do\">in an interview</a>.</p> \n<h3>\"The Bedroom Report\" - Bedshed</h3> \n<p>Working with the Australian agency <a href=\"https://rare.com.au/\">Rare</a>, <a href=\"https://www.bedshed.com.au/\">Bedshed</a> -- an Australian bedding chain -- launched a campaign that merged great video content with market research data.</p> \n<p>The first portion of Bedshed's initiative involved a two-year study where the brand surveyed consumers all over Australia about sleeping habits.</p> \n<p>Once the survey was complete, Bedshed launched a web page -- which looks like a large interactive infographic -- to highlight interesting findings. Many of the facts revealed in this study explain how important sleep is to overall health, what gets in the way of it, and how purchasing a great bed and mattress can help prevent insomnia.</p> \n<p>For example, Bedshed's study found that \"23% of men talk in their sleep,\" while 66% of their partners lie awake listening to what they say. It also revealed that 1.7 million people wake up in the middle of the night due to bad pillows or mattresses.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/the%20bedroom%20report.gif?width=600&amp;name=the%20bedroom%20report.gif\" alt=\"the bedroom report bedshed campaign\" width=\"600\" style=\"width: 600px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\">Along with creating a data-fueled web experience, Bedshed launched a series of ads that present key study findings and direct prospects to its store to learn more or try a new mattress:</p> \n<div class=\"hs-embed-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; width: 100%; height: auto; padding: 0; max-width: 480px; max-height: 270px; min-width: 256px; display: block; margin: auto;\">\n <div class=\"hs-embed-content-wrapper\">\n  <div style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0px;\">\n   <iframe width=\"480\" height=\"270\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/mDCC_doA6GA?feature=oembed\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen style=\"position: absolute; top: 0px; left: 0px; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\"></iframe>\n  </div>\n </div>\n</div> \n<p>Bedshed's campaign is a great example of how a brand can draw audiences with data-driven content. Its detailed research also positions the brand as an expert in the crowded bed industry.</p> \n<p>When a prospect is shopping for an expensive product -- like a bed -- they might want to get recommendations from a person who knows a lot about the product. After seeing Bedshed's content, these prospects might think that a company that knows so much about its industry will sell good quality products.</p> \n<h2>What We Can Learn From Effie Winners</h2> \n<p>Even if you don't have a huge budget or an agency to help you market your brand, here are a few strategies that any brand can use to spread brand awareness and engage new audiences -- just like the companies above:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Be human:</strong> While Great Northern Brewing embraced fatherhood and Australian Pride to market its product, Dare Iced Coffee made ads that were comedically relatable to coffee drinkers. When your brand's content is relatable, it can also be memorable. Not to mention, people who find brands more relatable and authentic trust them more.</li> \n <li><strong>Embrace a bigger purpose: </strong>Although NRMA sells home insurance, they realized helping the environment would allow them to fulfill an even greater purpose. And, through their marketing, people might trust their brand more because they care about something more beyond policy purchases.</li> \n <li><strong>Leverage data: </strong>While M.J. Bale's campaign was inspired by market research, Narellan Pools' advertising strategy was fueled by analytics. While creativity is key to drawing attention from audiences, data can help you optimize your content and share it at just the right time.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>To learn more about the latest Australian marketing tactics, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/australian-websites\">check out this list of the country's most innovative website designs</a>, or these <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/stats-about-australian-instagram-users\">fascinating Australian Instagram stats</a>. Or, download the offer below to get more expert tips on creating a winning campaign.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faustralian-advertising-awards&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 26 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"dd512d3f132bafd1e61380296aeb51ff","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"pbump@hubspot.com (Pamela Bump)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Google%20Drive%20Integration/5%20Brands%20That%20Won%20Australian%20Advertising%20Awards%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png?width=200&name=5%20Brands%20That%20Won%20Australian%20Advertising%20Awards%20%5B+What%20Marketers%20Can%20Learn%20From%20Them%5D.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn11@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-47-845_2cf9b37993965de1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/the%20bedroom%20report.gif?width=600&name=the%20bedroom%20report.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn1@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-10-739_92df424f62e52906.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Faustralian-advertising-awards&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn30@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-12-379_8b2cd8f00f9f8c2a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624891},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"The Ultimate List: 57 Online Local Business Directories","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/10322/the-ultimate-list-50-local-business-directories.aspx","description":"<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>What is a business directory?</h2> \n <p>A business directory is an online list of businesses within a particular niche, location, or category. One way local businesses can get found by online searchers is through inclusion in business directories.</p> \n</div>  \n<p>Today, Google is inserting itself between consumer and local business websites much more often.</p> \n<p>You need look no further than Google My Business conversion points, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/am-guide-accelerated-mobile-pages\">AMP</a>, and featured snippets for proof.</p> \n<p>So it makes sense to get your local business information into the places people are already going to find businesses like yours, rather than simply hoping they'll find you in search results.</p> \n<p>Getting your local business' NAP (Name, Address, Phone number) information listed on directories, online business listing sites, and citation sites helps to improve visibility, but backlinks from these sites can also have a benefit to <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/what-is-seo\">SEO</a>. Here are a few things to make sure your company listing has in it once you add it to a directory:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Consistent NAP</strong>. If you add or update your business on multiple business listing sites, make sure you're providing the same company information across each directory.</li> \n <li><strong>A link to your website</strong>. Backlinks -- also known as inbound links -- are crucial to your company website's domain authority. Consider adding a <a href=\"https://knowledge.hubspot.com/sources-user-guide-v2/how-to-create-and-implement-tracking-urls\">tracking link</a> at the end of this URL as well, so you can see how much traffic your website specifically gets from the business directories that are linking to it.</li> \n <li><strong>A company description</strong>. Make sure you have a detailed description of your business that reflects your organization's mission, culture, and values.</li> \n <li><strong>Multimedia</strong>. Give company searchers a visual taste of your business with a picture or video of your office, your employees, or your daily business operations.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>There are plenty of <a href=\"https://www.brightlocal.com/2018/05/31/local-citation-sites-for-top-100-usa-cities/\">location-specific directories</a> and <a href=\"https://www.brightlocal.com/2018/04/06/top-local-citations-by-business-category/\">industry-specific business listing sites</a> to which you can submit your data, but local businesses should start with the big guns and work their way toward the more niche directories.</p> \n<p>&nbsp;</p> \n<p>With that in mind, we've put together a list of the biggest and most important business listings sites today (based on Domain Authority gathered from Moz Link Explorer in May 2018). Many of these directories are completely free.</p> \n<h2>Local Business Listings &amp; Directories for Small Business Marketing</h2> \n<ol> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.facebook.com\">Facebook</a> (Domain Authority = 100)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://appleid.apple.com/account#!&amp;page=create\">Apple Maps</a> (Domain Authority = 100)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.google.com/business/\">Google My Business</a> (Domain Authority = 100)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/directory/companies/\">LinkedIn Company Directory</a> (Domain Authority = 98)&nbsp;</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://bing.com\">Bing</a> (Domain Authority = 94)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://yelp.com\">Yelp</a> (Domain Authority = 94)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.bbb.org/en/us\">Better Business Bureau</a> (Domain Authority = 93)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://foursquare.com\">Foursquare</a> (Domain Authority = 92)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://mapquest.com\">MapQuest</a> (Domain Authority = 92)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/agency-directory-listing?utm_campaign=Global%20en%20%7C%20AP%20TOFU%20ACQ%20%7C%20Directory%20Users%20%7C%20June%202018&amp;utm_source=blog-promotion\">HubSpot</a> (Domain Authority = 91)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://yellowpages.com\">Yellow Pages</a> (Domain Authority = 91)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://angieslist.com\">Angies List</a> (Domain Authority = 91)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://smallbusiness.yahoo.com/local\">Yahoo! 86)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://superpages.com\">Super Pages</a> (Domain Authority = 84)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://yellowbook.com\">Yellow Book</a> (Domain Authority = 83)</li> \n <li><a href=\"https://www.thumbtack.com/\">Thumbtack</a> (Domain Authority = 82)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://local.com\">Local.com</a> (Domain Authority = 77)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://local.botw.org\">BOTW</a> (Domain Authority = 65)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://worldweb.com\">worldweb.com</a> (Domain Authority = 65)</li> \n <li><a>ibegin.com</a> (Domain Authority = href=\"http://finduslocal.com\">Finduslocal.com</a> (Domain Authority = 60)</li> \n <li><a href=\"http://myhuckleberry.com\">My Huckleberry</a> (Domain Authority = 59)</li> \n <li><a
