ps://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn40@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-08-851_fce4849b395c0b75.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-13%20at%202.28.30%20PM.png?width=778&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-13%20at%202.28.30%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn72@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-52-462_3ab9ce1c50e64edb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(3)-8.png?width=600&name=pasted%20image%200%20(3)-8.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn3@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-07-798_0fdeff1378c66d76.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/pasted%20image%200-27.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn69@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-13-970_8d2446d9e5ef0b30.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/pasted%20image%200%20(4)-7.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn81@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-02-747_1d20b2db297e5bf0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/amazon-stores.jpg?width=600&name=amazon-stores.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn38@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-05-586_a0eb1bd9521289f8.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Famazon-advertising&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn30@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-05-406_c728094838431dd2.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624909},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"The 17 Best College Instagram Accounts (And Why They're So Darn Good)","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/best-college-instagram-accounts","description":"<p><span style=\"letter-spacing: 0px; background-color: transparent;\">It's no question social media is an important part of most college students' lives. </span></p> \n<p>And Instagram is an undeniably important one for teens and young adults — in fact, <a href=\"https://www.omnicoreagency.com/instagram-statistics/\">72% of teens use Instagram</a>, and <a href=\"https://www.omnicoreagency.com/instagram-statistics/\">67% of U.S. adults ages 18-29</a> use the social platform.</p> \n<p>Plenty of universities and colleges have taken note of Instagram's popularity, and now use the social platform as an opportunity to appeal to current students, alumni, and high school prospects alike.&nbsp;</p> \n<p>After all, when it comes to choosing which social platforms to spend time and resources on, it's a best practice to go where your target audience goes.</p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: center;\"><a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/instagram-for-business\">Download the complete guide to using Instagram for business and marketing here.</a></h3> \n<p>We were excited to see many universities and colleges posting awesome Instagram content — <span>shots of campus buildings, live-action photos of sports games, colorful graphics promoting school-sponsored campaigns — </span>on a regular basis.</p> \n<p>While there were many colleges and universities doing well on Instagram, here are 17 of the best ones we saw to inspire your own brand's Instagram content. (And if you're feeling especially motivated, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/photo-video-editing-apps-mobile\">read this blog post for a list of the 11 best photo and video editing apps for mobile</a>.)</p> \n<h2><strong>17 of the Best College Instagram Accounts</strong></h2> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">1. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/coloradostateuniversity/\">Colorado State University</a></h3> \n<p><span><span>When it comes to posting a diversity of Instagram content, Colorado State University covered it all — and everything came out beautifully. We had a hard time choosing from the multitude of adorable pictures of their mascot CAM the Ram, which included playful captions such as \"Our mascot is cuter than your mascot.\" </span></span></p> \n<p><span><span>They also did a great job with campaign graphics, like the one below on ending hazing.<br></span></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/colorado-state-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=colorado-state-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"colorado state university instagram posts\"></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/colorado-state-instagram-4.png?width=523&amp;name=colorado-state-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 523px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"523\" alt=\"colorado state university instagram posts\"></span></p> \n<h3>2. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/dartmouthcollege/\">Dartmouth College</a></h3> \n<p>Located in scenic Hanover, New Hampshire, Dartmouth's campus has a lot to work with — and their social media team doesn't sell it short. Their Instagram account is chock full of breathtaking, high-definition pictures of their campus in every season and at every time of day. We love the drone shots they used to show their campus from a new perspective.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dartmouth-instagram-4.png?width=523&amp;name=dartmouth-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 523px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"523\" alt=\"dartmouth college instagram post\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/dartmouth-instagram-2.png?width=523&amp;name=dartmouth-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 523px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"523\" alt=\"dartmouth college instagram post\"></p> \n<h3>3. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/libertyuniversity/\">Liberty University</a></h3> \n<p>Liberty University's Instagram is a great mix of beautiful campus shots and photos of students, staff, guest speakers, and other members of the Liberty community. When it comes to posting photos of people, they don't rely on generic group pictures of people hanging out around campus.</p> \n<p>Instead, they post photos of people that appeal to followers who don't know the person or people in the photo, like the one with the championship ring below that can ignite school spirit in any student or alum. Check out how they brand each photo with their logo for anyone who might regram.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/liberty-university-instagram-1.png?width=514&amp;name=liberty-university-instagram-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"liberty university instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/liberty-university-instagram-4.png?width=514&amp;name=liberty-university-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"liberty university instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>4. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/cambridgeuniversity/\">University of Cambridge</a></h3> \n<p>University of Cambridge in England has mastered <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/photo-video-editing-apps-mobile\">the art of photo editing</a>. Most of their Instagram photos are landscape photos of areas around their campus, but check out how they've edited them to intensify the colors and bring out the details in each photo.</p> \n<p>We also love how they frame their photos, like the building through the archway and the quad through the window below. You might see certain buildings or areas every day, but when you're taking photos, think about the unique and interesting ways you can photograph them.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cambridge-instagram-4.png?width=514&amp;name=cambridge-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"university of cambridge instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/cambridge-instagram-2.png?width=514&amp;name=cambridge-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"university of cambridge instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">5. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/arizonastateuniversity/\">Arizona State University</a></h3> \n<p style=\"text-align: left;\">Arizona State University lets its school pride shine through its Instagram account, which features a lot of content related to their sports teams. They do a great job of creating cool graphics for game day announcements, and we love that they include all the relevant information both as text in the graphic <em>and </em>in the caption. That way, anyone who wants to re-gram doesn't have to copy the caption, too.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/arizona-state-instagram-2.png?width=514&amp;name=arizona-state-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"arizona state instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/arizona-state-instagram-1.png?width=514&amp;name=arizona-state-instagram-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"arizona state instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>6. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/uai_cl/\">Adolfo Ibáñez University</a></h3> \n<p>Adolfo Ibáñez University is located just beside the beautiful Andes Mountains in Chile, giving them a lot of great scenery to work with for campus and city shots. They do a great job of capturing the closeness of the mountains to the school in photos like the 'regram in the one below.</p> \n<p>We love how the social media team there credits 'regrams not only in the caption, but also in the photo itself using <a href=\"https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/repost-regram-for-instagram/id797818385?mt=8\">the Repost &amp; Regram App</a>. They also use their Instagram account to highlight cool student projects, like the bicycle below that won some of their students a top entrepreneurial prize. They could've chosen to post a photo of the bike in the lab or on display, but instead, they chose to post a particularly cool photo of it outside and at night, probably borrowed from the students themselves.&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/adolfo-ibanez-instagram-2.png?width=514&amp;name=adolfo-ibanez-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"Adolfo Ibáñez University instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/adolfo-ibanez-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=adolfo-ibanez-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"Adolfo Ibáñez University instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>7. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/westvirginiau/\">West Virginia University</a></h3> \n<p>Here's another example of a college Instagram account that publishes cool, new perspectives of their campus. We love the theme of their logo in front of a blurred background, like the keychain below. Alongside gorgeous, high-definition photos of all different parts of campus and student life, they have a few epic shots sprinkled in — like the one on the bottom right of a student who climbed a mountain with a WVU flag. #casual.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/west-virginia-instagram-2.png?width=514&amp;name=west-virginia-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"west virginia instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/west-virginia-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=west-virginia-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"west virginia instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>8. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/theuniversityofsheffield/\">The University of Sheffield</a></h3> \n<p><span><span>The University of Sheffield's photos boast a high level of sophistication we should all aspire to achieve. In addition to playing with perspective and color, they also play with angles and lines in a lot of their photos. </span></span></p> \n<p><span><span>For instance, the photo at the top is a cool bird's eye view of students studying for exams, and it features a lot of lines and rectangles of different shapes and sizes. We were also big fans of the colorful graphics they post, like the \"Good Luck\" graphic on the bottom left.</span></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-sheffield-instagram-1.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-sheffield-instagram-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"University of Sheffield instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\">&nbsp;</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-sheffield-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-sheffield-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"University of Sheffield instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>9. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/aub_lebanon/\">American University of Beirut</a></h3> \n<p>AUB does a lot of things well on Instagram, but what we liked in particular was what they've been doing with their 150th birthday celebration for the school. To celebrate its history, they've interspersed more typical posts with old photos taken in black-and-white, which they've marked with \"AUB/LIBRARY ARCHIVES\" right on the photo to indicate that it was taken from their archives.</p> \n<p>In the captions of each of these photos, they encourage students to send a modern version of the exact same photo by posting it with the hashtag #myaubstory or sending it to a specific email address they set up for the campaign. In addition to this cool campaign, they periodically post beautiful graphics to wish students well for the holidays, like the graphic below for the Muslim holiday Eid al-Adha.</p> \n<p><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.01.23%20PM.png?width=514&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.01.23%20PM.png\" alt=\"AUB instagram posts\" width=\"514\" style=\"width: 514px; display: block; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/aub-instagram-1-1.png?width=514&amp;name=aub-instagram-1-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"American University of Beirut instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>10. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/uniofnottingham/?hl=en\">University of Nottingham</a></h3> \n<p><span><span>Go to University of Nottingham's Instagram account and you'll scroll through an impressive display of beautiful campus photos. We love the creativity and variety in these shots: Note how they play with light, shadows, and color so that no two shots of the same building look too similar. </span></span></p> \n<p><span><span>We also love how they post photos that highlight their school's and city's histories. For example, the photo of the inn below is accompanied by a bit of trivia in the caption: \"Did you know that Nottingham is home to the oldest pub in England?\"<br></span></span></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-nottingham-instagram-4.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-nottingham-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"University of Nottingham's instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-nottingham-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-nottingham-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"University of Nottingham's instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>11. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/urochester/\">University of Rochester</a></h3> \n<p>The University of Rochester lets its personality shine through its Instagram photos. The photo of the empty campus square at bottom left, which \"quotes\" the square, was part of a three-part photo series during the school's winter break that showed how much the school was missing all its students. The folks here also have an ongoing mascot photo campaign, where they have students snap pictures with their mascot all over the country, which they then share with the whole community.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.03.04%20PM.png?width=514&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.03.04%20PM.png\" alt=\"university of rochester instagram posts\" width=\"514\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-rochester-instagram-4.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-rochester-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"University of rochester's instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>12. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/texastech/\">Texas Tech University</a></h3> \n<p>Texas Tech does a lot of really great stuff with their Instagram account, but what really makes them stand out is their videos and their seasonal content. They post a lot of short, simple videos that inspire a lot of Likes — from their football team running onto the field before a game to the Texas Tech NASCAR racing on the track. Their seasonal content is top-notch too. Check out the playful, Texas Tech-themed pumpkins carved for Halloween, below.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/texas-tech-football-flag.png?width=514&amp;name=texas-tech-football-flag.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"texas tech instagram posts\" title=\"texas-tech-football-flag.png\" width=\"514\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/texas-tech-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=texas-tech-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"texas tech instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>13. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/unsw/\">University of New South Wales</a></h3> \n<p>UNSW does a great job mixing beautifully framed, artistic photos and more real-time ones, like the photo of their rugby team below that they regrammed from @unigames.</p> \n<p>They also do a great job creating informative graphics, like the simple one below accompanied by the caption, \"5 days until UNSW Open Day! Tag your Open Day photos with <a href=\"https://instagram.com/explore/tags/unswopenday/\">#unswopenday</a> <span>and we'll print them for you at our Open Day photo booth!\" This is a perfect campaign for college kids, who love to put photos up on their dorm room walls. (Want to create a graphic using icons, like UNSW did in the one below? <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/free-icon-download-design-list\">Check out our list of 135 royalty-free icons here</a>.)</span></p> \n<p class=\"p1\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"s1\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.04.42%20PM.png?width=514&amp;name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.04.42%20PM.png\" width=\"514\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"university of new south wales instagram posts\"></span></p> \n<p class=\"p1\" style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"s1\"> <img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/unsw-instagram-2-1.png?width=514&amp;name=unsw-instagram-2-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"university of new south wales instagram posts\"></span><span class=\"s1\"></span></p> \n<h3>14. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/bostonu/\">Boston University</a></h3> \n<p>Boston University does a great job of adding humor to their plethora of high-end photos of campus and student life. We love photos like the \"Hire Me\" graduation photo below, which is worthy of a 'regram regardless of whether or not you know the graduates in the photo. We also love that they promote the best content from #AwkwardBU Twitter campaign on Instagram alongside relevant photos.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/boston-university-instagram-4.png?width=514&amp;name=boston-university-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"boston university instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/boston-university-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=boston-university-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"boston university instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">15. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/unibarcelona/\">University of Barcelona</a></h3> \n<p>The buildings at the University of Barcelona are gorgeous, both inside and out, and Instagram is the perfect platform for their social media team to showcase all that great design and architecture.</p> \n<p>These folks create fun, lighthearted graphics to promote some of their events, like they did with the \"Vespres UB\" event below. Notice, too, how some of their photos are branded with the \"Universitat de Barcelona\" logo — a nice touch for anything that might be regrammed.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-barcelona-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-barcelona-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"university of barcelona instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-barcelona-instagram-2.png?width=514&amp;name=university-of-barcelona-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"university of barcelona instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">16. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/georgetownuniversity/\">Georgetown University</a></h3> \n<p>While Georgetown's Instagram account includes plenty of high-definition photos, we love that a lot of their photos have the look and feel of well-framed photos taken from an iPhone. This could be because they, like many other colleges on this list, post a lot of photos submitted to them by members of their community.</p> \n<p>We also love that they post in real time and in a chronological manner, making their feed read kind of like a photo journal of a specific time. The #HomeSweetHilltop collage below, posted over Homecoming Weekend, is a great example of a timely photo. Another example is a photo of the Pope in Georgetown during his visit.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/georgetown-instagram-home-sweet-hilltop.png?width=514&amp;name=georgetown-instagram-home-sweet-hilltop.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" alt=\"georgetown university instagram posts\" title=\"georgetown-instagram-home-sweet-hilltop.png\" width=\"514\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/georgetown-instagram-3.png?width=514&amp;name=georgetown-instagram-3.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"georgetown university instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3>17. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/pennstate/\">Penn State University</a></h3> \n<p>Alongside beautiful, high-end photos of campus and student life (are you seeing a theme here?), one of our favorite themes in Penn State's Instagram photos are their \"love stories.\" These are photos of couples that met at Penn State, whether it's one alum proposing to another (as in the photo at bottom) or kissing at graduation after starting to date during freshman orientation. These photos are accompanied by each couple's brief backstory, and always inspire a lot of well-deserved Likes and \"aww\"'s.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/penn-state-instagram-1.png?width=514&amp;name=penn-state-instagram-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"penn state instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/penn-state-instagram-2.png?width=514&amp;name=penn-state-instagram-2.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"penn state instagram posts\"></p> \n<h3 style=\"text-align: left;\">18. <a href=\"https://instagram.com/ouranu/\">Australia National University</a></h3> \n<p>Australia National University nails the whole \"breathtaking landscape photo\" thing. Every single time. Their Instagram feed is an inspiring collection of photos of campus, student performances, and even detailed, up-close photos of animals found in the area. The common theme? Beautiful uses of light and shadow and reflections, as you can see in the photos below.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/anu-instagram-1.png?width=514&amp;name=anu-instagram-1.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"Australia National University instagram posts\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/anu-instagram-4.png?width=514&amp;name=anu-instagram-4.png\" style=\"width: 514px; margin: 0px auto;\" width=\"514\" alt=\"Australia National University instagram posts\"></p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in October 2015 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span class=\"content-post__body\"><em> </em></span></p> \n<div>\n <a class=\"close\"> </a> \n <span e-instagram-1.png?width=514&name=arizona-state-instagram-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn47@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-48-858_94deacfc236f89f1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/adolfo-ibanez-instagram-2.png?width=514&name=adolfo-ibanez-instagram-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn93@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-57-172_cc123bb1deed3244.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/adolfo-ibanez-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=adolfo-ibanez-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn50@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-54-955_bb4d7ae245856708.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/west-virginia-instagram-2.png?width=514&name=west-virginia-instagram-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn6@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-57-880_c8838d6d9e0fa11c.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/west-virginia-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=west-virginia-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn50@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-53-57-323_0c1fdf980f7078a7.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-sheffield-instagram-1.png?width=514&name=university-of-sheffield-instagram-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn21@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-11-024_5edaeab02fe43ff0.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-sheffield-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=university-of-sheffield-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn83@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-47-869_814dccab0e33eca3.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.01.23%20PM.png?width=514&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.01.23%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn73@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-07-527_9b923b8fa940a8ba.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/aub-instagram-1-1.png?width=514&name=aub-instagram-1-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn37@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-06-934_2cf3299efdbfbd83.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-nottingham-instagram-4.png?width=514&name=university-of-nottingham-instagram-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn79@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-48-996_7f4a829994dbc269.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-nottingham-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=university-of-nottingham-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn31@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-13-519_dd6b3cdb2772a0ab.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.03.04%20PM.png?width=514&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.03.04%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn65@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-10-073_cd3fb31159ad8f28.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-rochester-instagram-4.png?width=514&name=university-of-rochester-instagram-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn29@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-09-884_26071c7a68f32b6f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/texas-tech-football-flag.png?width=514&name=texas-tech-football-flag.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn88@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-07-913_ccc0ebf9cb919957.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/texas-tech-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=texas-tech-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn27@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-13-608_6309bbcc47d9ef9d.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.04.42%20PM.png?width=514&name=Screen%20Shot%202020-10-26%20at%202.04.42%20PM.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn59@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-08-763_04bffa6a78395adf.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/unsw-instagram-2-1.png?width=514&name=unsw-instagram-2-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn14@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-06-713_7646fe71248ce833.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/boston-university-instagram-4.png?width=514&name=boston-university-instagram-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn45@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-00-131_505a6e60450b0afb.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/boston-university-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=boston-university-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn5@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-53-57-681_12ad5b4ab9509e15.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-barcelona-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=university-of-barcelona-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn3@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-03-313_33e30ae4455bd346.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/university-of-barcelona-instagram-2.png?width=514&name=university-of-barcelona-instagram-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn35@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-53-50-913_a1ad62429a93d364.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/georgetown-instagram-home-sweet-hilltop.png?width=514&name=georgetown-instagram-home-sweet-hilltop.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn45@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-09-994_3d5ea649c4b9c68a.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/georgetown-instagram-3.png?width=514&name=georgetown-instagram-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn18@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-47-896_7b396eae9e65c33e.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/penn-state-instagram-1.png?width=514&name=penn-state-instagram-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn95@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-54-07-765_bf4df3d8a2af5703.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/penn-state-instagram-2.png?width=514&name=penn-state-instagram-2.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn89@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-11-317_aa52af819641c96f.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/anu-instagram-1.png?width=514&name=anu-instagram-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn34@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-56-179_d44ab1082053bec1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/anu-instagram-4.png?width=514&name=anu-instagram-4.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn67@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-51-064_636e62e4f9bab9e1.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hubfs/hub_generated/resized/6f8af257-874f-48eb-a95e-c448e75c22bc.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn77@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-47-870_e311b275b75ec4b1.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fbest-college-instagram-accounts&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn42@2020_6/2020/10/27/16-54-10-068_5d36e59778b65b70.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624915},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"How to Write a Video Script [Template + Video]","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-write-a-video-script-ht","description":"<p>Movie producers and inbound marketers aren't that different when it comes to creating and editing video content.</p> \n<p>We're both telling a story, and whether that story is about a protagonist or a product, we're both trying to captive our audiences and make them believe in the story we tell.</p> \n<p>What happens at the end of the story is a little different, though.</p> \n<p>Most marketers wear a lot of hats and let's just say, out of all the hats worn, the videographer one isn't always their favorite. That's because creating videos can be intimidating, especially if you're new to it.</p> \n<p>And if you're more of a copywriter than a videographer, as I am, you might overlook how important the planning stage of video production is -- the part where you really solidify your video concept, goals, and script.</p> \n<p>That's what we're going to tackle in this blog post: how to write an effective video script to ensure the best possible product emerges from your editing software, and lives wherever you're publishing.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h3>1. Start with a brief.</h3> \n<p>Although this step might seem trivial, it's extremely necessary to the final script.</p> \n<p>Starting with a brief allows you and your team to document the answers to the most important project questions so everyone involved in creating the video can get on the same page. When you're three-quarters of the way through the editing process, and your boss or colleague wants to completely redo that whole shot where you demonstrate how your product solves a problem, <em>that's</em>a huge problem -- for you.</p> \n<p>When pesky predicaments like this one stand in the way of progress, you can just refer back to the brief that documents the goals and project plan your team mapped out together, and say, \"Actually, that's not what we agreed to.\"</p> \n<p>Then, you can move forward.</p> \n<h4 style=\"display: block;\">Focus on your goals, topic, and takeaways when developing your brief.</h4> \n<p style=\"display: block;\">A brief doesn't have to be fancy, nor does it have to follow a specific formula, but there are several key questions it should include to craft an effective video script.</p> \n<ul> \n <li style=\"display: block;\">What's the <strong>goal</strong> of this video? Why are we making the video in the first place?</li> \n <li>Who is the <strong>audience</strong> of this video?</li> \n <li>What's our video <strong>topic</strong>? (The more specific, the better. For example, if you're in the house painting business, you might choose a topic like, \"buying the right paint brush\").</li> \n <li>What are the <strong>key takeaways</strong> of the video? What should viewers learn from watching it?</li> \n <li>What's our call-to-action? What do we want viewers to do after they've finished watching the video?</li> \n</ul> \n<p>You can easily create a brief in Google Docs to serve as a living, breathing template that you revise over time -- and that your team can collaborate on.</p> \n<h3>2. Use your brief to write an outline.</h3> \n<p>Once you've picked a topic and written a brief, it's time to start constructing your video script. We recommend starting with an outline before diving into the full script -- this way, you can break your video into subtopics and determine how your dialogue (or monologue) will progress.</p> \n<p>Contrary to what I previously thought, you can't just rewrite a blog post and call it a day -- there's a specific way to write a script so that it shapes an effective video. Are you basing your video script on a blog post? <a href=\"https://www.linkedin.com/in/aliciacollins/\">Alicia Collins</a> can teach you a bit more in the video below (and yes, we wrote a script for it!).</p>  \n<div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 560px; max-height: 315px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n  <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.25%; margin: 0;\">\n   <iframe class=\"hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/5zY-JlBESYs\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n  </div> \n </div> \n</div>  \n<p>Like Alicia says in the video above, a video script shouldn't simply regurgitate the blog post word-for-word. Although blog posts are ideally written to be conversational, there are pauses and verbal explanations you need to incorporate into your speech patterns that you wouldn't have on&nbsp;paper.</p> \n<p>But, using the blog post's subsections is a helpful starting point when figuring out how your script will progress from one section to the next. If you're <em>not</em> basing your video script on a blog post, you can still create a well-structured outline. Consider the individual best practices of the subject you're planning to cover in your video. Where do the natural transitions occur when explaining this subject to your audience?</p> \n<p>For example, if the topic of your video is <em>How to Start a Business</em>, you might outline your script by the individual tasks an aspiring entrepreneur needs to tackle when launching a company, such as:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>Perform market research.</li> \n <li>Draft a budget for research and development.</li> \n <li>Meet with potential investors.</li> \n <li>Develop a marketing strategy.</li> \n <li>Develop a sales strategy.</li> \n <li>Identify your office space.</li> \n</ul> \n<h3>3. Introduce yourself and/or the topic at the beginning of your script.</h3> \n<p>Even though videos are the channel of choice for many people who want to learn something new, they need to hook their audience in the first few seconds -- just like written content. After all, you have just as much competition on YouTube as you do in the blogosphere, and your viewers can bounce from your video just as quickly as they would from an article if they don't feel engaged with it.</p> \n<p>To help hook your audience in a video script, use the very first few lines to introduce the narrator (the person on screen) and what the audience is going to learn by the end of the video.</p> \n<p>For example, if you're teaching viewers how to optimize their blog for SEO, your introduction might be:</p> \n<p><em>\"Hi there! I'm [narrator's name] from [company], and in the next [length of video] minutes, I'm gonna teach you how to get your blog ranking on Google.\"</em></p> \n<h3>4. Start writing your script, section by section.</h3> \n<p>Just like the brief, the video script doesn't have to be fancy. You're not trying to submit this script for any awards -- its purpose is strictly functional. A good script makes it easy for the people on camera to get their messages across while sounding and acting naturally.</p> \n<h4>Write conversationally.</h4> \n<p>Writing a script is not the same as writing a college paper or marketing research report. You want to write the script how you want the video subject to speak. Saying, \"I'm gonna create a video after reading this blog post\" on camera will read much better than, \"I am going to create a video after reading this blog post.\" Keep sentences short and crisp -- I recommend avoiding compound sentences, if possible.</p> \n<h4>Make it thorough.</h4> \n<p>A script doesn't just include dialogue. If your video will require multiple shots, characters, or scenes, include these details. Be sure to include any necessary information about the set or stage actions, such as a wardrobe change.</p> \n<p>Basically, you want the script to be thorough enough that you could hand it off to someone else to shoot, and they'd understand it.</p> \n<h4>Write for the audience and the platform.</h4> \n<p>Is your audience made up of young teens, middle-aged professionals, or older retirees? Will your video live on Instagram, YouTube, or your website? Make sure you're keeping it conversational for the people you're trying to connect with -- and infuse humor, tone, and inflection accordingly. Furthermore, if you're writing a short-form video for Facebook, you might want to consider keeping your script choppier with sentence fragments -- but if you're producing a long-form explainer video for your website, make sure you're as thorough as possible.</p> \n<h4>Script every <em>single</em> word.</h4> \n<p>It's understandable to think you can just jot down the main bullet points for a script, and then just wing it on camera, especially if you know your subject matter. This approach makes it tough to communicate a message as clearly and concisely as possible (which you should aim to do in every video you create), and it usually results in a lot of re-dos.</p> \n<p>So, we suggest scripting every last word. Trust me -- doing this will keep you organized during filming and save you loads of time later.</p> \n<h3>5. Support any B-roll with the proper callouts in your main narrative.</h3> \n<p>If your video will transition from a person speaking in front of a camera, to a close-up shot of your product or a demonstration, you'll want to write these cues into in your script so anyone who reads it knows to introduce these things for the viewer. These secondary shots are often referred to as B-roll, which take place while the person continues to speak off-screen. It's one of the main differences between a blog post and a video script.</p> \n<p>For example, if a blog post reads, \"take a look at the graph below,\" it's clearly referring to a graph embedded below that sentence. This phrasing won't work on camera. Instead, your video script might read, \"in the graph you see here\" -- while the graph is shown on-screen instead of the narrator.</p> \n<p>These written exceptions can also help cue the narrator to take certain unspoken actions while reciting the script. For example, take a look at how the folks over at Wistia did that in the video script for <a href=\"http://wistia.com/blog/learning-center-wistias-scripting-tips\">Wistia's scripting tips</a> below. Text overlay is called out with a big, bold \"TEXT,\" audio is called out in all caps (REWIND SOUND), and B-roll or additional details are called out in italics (with glasses on). (Note: It might help to <a href=\"http://wistia.com/blog/learning-center-wistias-scripting-tips\">watch the video</a> first for the excerpt of this script to make sense).</p> \n<p><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" style=\"width: 616px; display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-371940948-png/how_to_write_a_video_script_example_keep_conversational.png?width=616&amp;name=how_to_write_a_video_script_example_keep_conversational.png\" alt=\"how_to_write_a_video_script_example_keep_conversational\" width=\"616\"></p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><span style=\"font-size: 12px;\">Source: <a href=\"https://wistia.com/blog/learning-center-wistias-scripting-tips\"><em>Wistia</em></a></span></p> \n<h3>6. Be as concise as you can.</h3> \n<p>When it comes to marketing, shorter videos tend to be more compelling than longer videos. In fact, <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/state-of-video-marketing-new-data\">68% of people</a> said they'd rather learn about new products and services through a \"short video,\" according to a survey by Wyzowl.</p> \n<p>To make short videos, you need a short script. Don't write a script any longer than two pages. If you can keep it to one page, even better. It's also worth doing two to three rounds of edits solely focused on cutting all unnecessary fat in your writing. Reading it out loud to listen for opportunities to make the language more conversational, or sentences shorter, can also help.</p> \n<p>The result is a video that's succinct, engaging, and allows for a simple editing process.</p> \n<h3>7. Use this video script template.</h3> \n<p>Writing a script from scratch is way harder than starting with an example. To give you a head start, take a look at the scripted video we&nbsp;created with Wistia, below:</p>  \n<div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto; width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 394px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto;\"> \n  <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 60.62%; margin: 0;\">\n   <iframe class=\"wistia_embed hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://fast.wistia.net/embed/iframe/uc8grazxbo?endVideoBehavior=reset&amp;plugin%5BpostRoll-v1%5D%5Brewatch%5D=true&amp;plugin%5BpostRoll-v1%5D%5Bstyle%5D%5BbackgroundColor%5D=%23616161&amp;plugin%5BpostRoll-v1%5D%5Bstyle%5D%5Bcolor%5D=%23ffffff&amp;plugin%5BpostRoll-v1%5D%5Bstyle%5D%5BfontFamily%5D=Gill%20Sans%2C%20Helvetica%2C%20Arial%2C%20sans-serif&amp;plugin%5BpostRoll-v1%5D%5Bstyle%5D%5BfontSize%5D=36px&amp;plugin%5BpostRoll-v1%5D%5Btext%5D=Ready%20to%20create%20an%20awesome%20video%3F%20%3Cbr%2F%3ECheck%20out%20our%20tips%20below%20for%20five%20quick%20wins%20you%20could%20implement%20today.&amp;plugin%5Bsocialbar-v1%5D%5Bbuttons%5D=linkedIn-embed-email-twitter-googlePlus-facebook&amp;version=v1&amp;videoHeight=366&amp;videoWidth=650&amp;volumeControl=true\" name=\"wistia_embed\" width=\"650\" height=\"394\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n  </div> \n </div> \n</div>  \n<p>The script we used to make this video? It's below. Click the image to download your own copy and see how we've applied each of the script elements described throughout this blog post.</p> \n<p><a href=\"https://cdn2.hubspot.net/hubfs/53/Video_Script_Template_from_HubSpot_and_Wistia-2.docx\"><img src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/video-script-template-hubspot.jpg?width=816&amp;name=video-script-template-hubspot.jpg\" alt=\"video-script-template-hubspot\" width=\"816\" style=\"width: 816px;\"></a></p> \n<p>As a refresher, those script elements are:</p> \n<ul> \n <li>An introduction.</li> \n <li>Subsections and natural transitions.</li> \n <li>Thorough descriptions.</li> \n <li>Conversational tone.</li> \n <li>Supporting callouts for B-roll and unspoken actions by the narrator.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Have your script ready? Awesome. Now it's time to review your work with a quick run-through.</p> \n<h3>8. Do a verbal run-through off-camera.</h3> \n<p>Now that you know how to write a script, it's time for a table read -- the part where you practice bringing that script to life on camera. <br><br>Why practice? Because some words look great on paper, but once you read them aloud, they just don't sound right. The table read is where you really get to fine-tune the tone and nix anything that sounds too proper, improper, robotic, or otherwise inappropriate for the message you aim to convey.</p> \n<p>Check out the video below on how to do a table read:</p>  \n<div class=\"video-container-responsive\"> \n <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-wrapper hs-responsive-embed\" style=\"width: 100%; height: auto; position: relative; overflow: hidden; padding: 0; max-width: 650px; max-height: 366px; min-width: 256px; margin: 0px auto; display: block;\"> \n  <div class=\"hs-responsive-embed-inner-wrapper\" style=\"position: relative; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; padding-bottom: 56.31%; margin: 0;\">\n   <iframe class=\"wistia_embed hs-responsive-embed-iframe\" style=\"position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; border: none;\" src=\"http://fast.wistia.net/embed/iframe/gubzj5g7ea?videoFoam=true\" name=\"wistia_embed\" width=\"650\" height=\"366\" frameborder=\"0\"></iframe>\n  </div> \n </div> \n</div>  \n<p>Oh, and one last tip ...</p> \n<h4>When it's time to shoot, use a laptop and a chair as a teleprompter.</h4> \n<p>Since you don't need a fancy script, you don't need a fancy teleprompter to remember your lines. But you do need help remembering your lines. You can actually just use two things you already have -- <a href=\"http://wistia.com/blog/top-hat-tuesday-teleprompter\">a chair and a laptop</a> -- to keep your lines handy as you're shooting.</p> \n<p>For more tips for using the tools at your disposal to make a killer marketing video, check out our video guide to shooting videos with an iPhone.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in May 2019 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p>  \n<div class=\"video-container-responsive\">\n <iframe style=\"margin: 0px auto; display: block;\" src=\"http://www.youtube.com/embed/anWNGQNr8DM\" width=\"560\" height=\"315\" frameborder=\"0\" allowfullscreen></iframe>\n</div>  \n<p></p> \n<div>\n <a class=\"close\"> </a>\n</div>   \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-to-write-a-video-script-ht&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"7441a2370cf84392c898c26d5708ed89","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"sbernazzani@hubspot.com (Sophia Bernazzani)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-371940948-png/how_to_write_a_video_script_example_keep_conversational.png?width=616&name=how_to_write_a_video_script_example_keep_conversational.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn3@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-53-54-266_b41eb392857f9506.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hubfs/video-script-template-hubspot.jpg?width=816&name=video-script-template-hubspot.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn84@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-49-073_d9eb59134aa17234.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fhow-to-write-a-video-script-ht&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn67@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-11-559_331dca9bc04f9d67.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624917},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"6 SEO KPIs Every Search Marketer Should Know","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/seo-kpis","description":"<p>Ever since I was first introduced to search engine optimization (SEO), I've had to use it in every role I've had from editorial writing jobs to marketing blogging.</p> \n<p>While SEO was never my sole focus, I had to learn how to measure the success of my efforts.</p>  \n<p>As a marketer, it's important to look at key performance indicators (KPIs) to show how you're doing.</p> \n<p>Below, let's look at SEO KPIs you should measure to track success.</p> \n<p></p> \n<h2>Organic Search KPIs</h2> \n<h3>1. Organic traffic.</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/organic-search-definition-100-words\">Organic traffic</a> is one of the most important metrics to track for SEO. However, keep in mind that this shouldn't be the only metric you track. You'll track this in combination with other KPIs.</p> \n<p>Aja Frost, the head of SEO content at HubSpot, says, \"Any metric—in isolation—can be misleading. For example, HubSpot's SEO team used to obsess over organic traffic. And it seemed like our focus was paying off: Monthly organic sessions skyrocketed. However, we'd lost sight of the quality of those users... and leads and signups weren't following sessions.\"</p> \n<p>So, while you'll want to know what your organic traffic is doing and how it's trending, it's important to use the other SEO KPIs on this list in addition.</p> \n<h3>2. MRR-based metric.</h3> \n<p>Paired with your organic traffic, you should measure a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/sales/monthly-recurring-revenue\">monthly recurring revenue</a> (MRR) based metric.</p> \n<p>So, what does that mean?</p> \n<p>According to Frost, \"I recommend SEO teams pair organic traffic with one or two MRR-based metrics (if possible). You can figure out which MRR-based metrics are the right ones by talking to leadership and/or the other team(s) you support. What numbers do they care about? How does organic traffic feed into those numbers?\"</p> \n<p>A few examples include:</p> \n<ol type=\"1\"> \n <li>Organic search</li> \n <li>Demo requests</li> \n</ol> \n<p>Or:</p> \n<ol type=\"1\"> \n <li>Organic search</li> \n <li>Purchases</li> \n</ol> \n<p>Or:</p> \n<ol type=\"1\"> \n <li>Organic search</li> \n <li>Percentage of chats that convert into customers</li> \n</ol> \n<p>For HubSpot, we track content leads and user signups in addition to organic traffic.</p> \n<p>Frost says, \"If all three of those metrics are trending in the right direction, we know we're generating the right type of traffic.\"</p> \n<h2>Paid Search KPIs</h2> \n<h3>3. Cost-per-click (CPC).</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/ppc\">Cost-per-click</a> (CPC) is the amount that you'll pay for each click on your ad. You set your CPC at the maximum price you are willing to pay per click on your ad. What you actually pay is determined by the following formula: (Competitor's Ad Rank / Your Quality Score) + 0.01 = Actual CPC.</p> \n<p>Victor Pan, a principal marketer and technical SEO at HubSpot, says, \"When you're just starting to grow organic traffic and you just don't have the full picture on what the return on investment will be, the average cost per click is a great KPI to use as a temporary replacement for average organic traffic value. For example, if there's an average of 2400 searches for X/year and the average CPC is $20, then you can make projections on the advertising value gained from capturing 5%, 10%, or 20% of that traffic in a year to be $120, $240, or $480 per year respectively.\"</p> \n<p>He adds, \"Average CPC is a KPI that can also be used to capture content strategy gaps. There are a lot of high purchase intent keywords where the ROAS (return on ad spend) in pay per click ads does not make business sense. These are golden opportunities to consider longer-term organic search tactics to win as a part of your overall content marketing strategy to become a trusted authority on a particular topic.\"</p> \n<p>Laura Mittelmann, a marketing manager on the paid acquisition team at HubSpot, says, \"CPC tells me how much on average I'm paying for a click. This is important when setting bids and working within the constraints of a set budget, and can also help me decide which keywords and match types to bid on.\"</p> \n<h3>4. Clickthrough rate (CTR).</h3> \n<p>Clickthrough rate reveals how often people who view your ad end up actually clicking it.</p> \n<p>Mittelmann says, \"There are many helpful paid search KPIs to watch depends on the goal of the campaign. CTR helps me to understand how effective and relevant my ad copy is, and if it matches the intent of the user searching for my keywords.\"</p> \n<h3>5. Cost per acquisition (CPA).</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/cost-per-acquisition\">Cost per acquisition</a> is a great metric that can help you track how much you're spending for each acquisition.</p> \n<p>Mittelmann remarks, \"CPA is typically the KPI I use most to optimize on a daily basis. CPA factors in other metrics and ultimately tells me how much I paid for a conversion.\"</p> \n<h3>6. Return on ad spend (ROAS).</h3> \n<p><a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/return-on-ad-spend\">Return on ad spend</a> is a metric that measures the revenue that's generated compared to every dollar of an advertising campaign. For example, let's say you made $10 for every $1 spent on an advertising campaign. That means your ROAS for that campaign is 10:1.</p> \n<p>Mittelmann says, \"While there are many KPIs to track and use for paid search optimizations, at the end of the day I measure the success of a campaign based on its return on ad spend. It's important for me to know that the value of the conversions the campaign is generating outweighs the cost of the campaign.\"</p> \n<p>It's important to keep in mind that any metric in isolation can be misleading. It's critical to track several SEO KPIs to truly measure success. And if you need any help, you can use <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing/seo\">HubSpot's SEO tool</a>.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p></p>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fseo-kpis&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 26 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"ff758fdd6f9fd4fb9081879b61e249d0","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"Rebecca Riserbato","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fseo-kpis&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn26@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-09-399_cddd14a9d35c3d8d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624885},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"Web Design 101: How HTML, CSS, and JavaScript Work","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/web-design-html-css-javascript","description":"<p>Ever wondered how computer programming works, but haven't done anything more complicated on the web than upload a photo to Facebook?</p> \n<p>Then you're in the right place.</p> \n<p>To someone who's never coded before, the concept of creating a website from scratch -- layout, design, and all -- can seem really intimidating. You might be picturing Harvard students from the movie, <em>The Social Network</em>, sitting at their computers with gigantic headphones on and hammering out code, and think to yourself, 'I could never do that.'</p> \n<p>Actually, you can.</p> \n<p></p> \n<p>Anyone can learn to code, just like anyone can learn a new language. In fact, programming is kind of like speaking a foreign language -- which is exactly why they're called programming <em>languages</em><em>.</em> Each one has its own rules and syntax that need to be learned step by step. Those rules are ways to tell your computer what to do. More specifically, in web programming, they're ways of telling your <em>browsers</em> what to do.</p> \n<p>The goal of this post is to, in plain English, teach you with the basics of HTML, CSS, and one of the most common programming languages, JavaScript. But before we begin, let's get an idea of what programming languages actually are.</p> \n<h2>What Is a Programming Language?</h2> \n<p>Programming, or coding, is like solving a puzzle. Consider a human language, like English or French. We use these languages to turn thoughts and ideas into actions and behavior. In programming, the goal of the puzzle is exactly the same -- you're just driving different kinds of behavior, and the source of that behavior isn't a human. It's a computer.</p> \n<p>A<strong> programming language</strong> is our way of communicating with software. The people who use programming languages are often called programmers or developers. The things we tell software using a programming language could be to make a webpage look a certain way, or to make an object on the page move if the human user takes a certain action.</p> \n<h3>Programming in Web Development</h3> \n<p>So, when a web designer is given an end goal like \"create a webpage that has this header, this font, these colors, these pictures, and an animated unicorn walking across the screen when users click on this button,\" the web designer's job is to take that big idea and break it apart into tiny pieces, and then translate these pieces into instructions that the computer can understand -- including putting all these instructions in the correct order or syntax.</p> \n<p>Every page on the web that you visit is built using a sequence of separate instructions, one after another. Your browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, and so on) is a big actor in translating code into something we can see on our screens and even interact with. It can be easy to forget that code without a browser is just a text file -- it's when you put that text file into a <em>browser</em> that the magic happens. When you open a web page, your browser fetches the HTML and other programming languages involved and interprets it.</p> \n<p>HTML and CSS are actually not technically programming languages; they're just page structure and style information. But before moving on to JavaScript and other true languages, you need to know the basics of HTML and CSS, as they are on the front end of every web page and application.</p> \n<p>In the very early 1990s, HTML was the only language available on the web. Web developers had to painstakingly code static sites, page by page. A lot's changed since then: Now there are many computer programming languages available.</p> \n<p>In this post, I'll talk about HTML, CSS, and one of the most common programming languages: JavaScript.</p> \n<h2>HTML, CSS, &amp; JavaScript: A Tutorial</h2> \n<p>An overview:</p> \n<ul> \n <li><strong>HTML </strong>provides the <em>basic structure</em> of sites, which is enhanced and modified by other technologies like CSS and JavaScript.</li> \n <li><strong>CSS</strong> is used to control <em>presentation, formatting, and layout</em>.</li> \n <li><strong>JavaScript</strong> is used to control the <em>behavior</em> of different elements.</li> \n</ul> \n<p>Now, let's go over each one individually to help you understand the roles each plays on a website and then we'll cover how they fit together. Let's start with good ol' HTML.</p> \n<h3>HTML</h3> \n<p>HTML is at the core of every web page, regardless the complexity of a site or number of technologies involved. It's an essential skill for any web professional. It's the starting point for anyone learning how to create content for the web. And, luckily for us, it's surprisingly easy to learn.</p> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>How does HTML work?</h2> \n <p>HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language. \"Markup language\" means that, rather than using a programming language to perform functions, HTML uses tags to identify different types of content and the purposes they each serve to the webpage.</p> \n</div> \n<p>Let me show you what I mean. Take a look at the article below. If I were to ask you to label the types of content on the page, you'd probably do pretty well: There's the header at the top, then a subheader below it, the body text, and some images at the bottom followed by a few more bits of text.</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" style=\"width: 475px;\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1765453003-jpg/magazine-page-example.jpg?width=475&amp;name=magazine-page-example.jpg\" alt=\"magazine-page-example\" width=\"475\"></p> \n<p>Markup languages work in the same way as <em>you </em>just did when you labeled those content types, except they use code to do it -- specifically, they use HTML tags, also known as \"elements.\" These tags have pretty intuitive names: Header tags, paragraph tags, image tags, and so on.</p> \n<p>Every web page is made up of a bunch of these HTML tags denoting each type of content on the page. Each type of content on the page is \"wrapped\" in, i.e. surrounded by, HTML tags.</p> \n<p>For example, the words you're reading right now are part of a paragraph. If I were coding this web page from scratch (instead of using the WYSIWG editor in <a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/products/content-optimization-system\">HubSpot's CMS</a>), I would have started this paragraph with an <em>opening</em> paragraph tag: &lt;p&gt;. The \"tag\" part is denoted by open brackets, and the letter \"p\" tells the computer that we're opening a paragraph instead of some other type of content.</p> \n<p>Once a tag has been opened, all of the content that follows is assumed to be part of that tag until you \"close\" the tag. When the paragraph ends, I'd put a closing paragraph tag: &lt;/p&gt;. Notice that closing tags look exactly the same as opening tags, except there is a forward slash after the left angle bracket. Here's an example:</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-family: 'courier new', courier;\">&lt;p&gt;This is a paragraph.&lt;/p&gt;</span></p> \n<p>Using HTML, you can add headings, format paragraphs, control line breaks, make lists, emphasize text, create special characters, insert images, create links, build tables, control some styling, and much more.</p> \n<p>To learn more about coding in HTML, I recommend <a href=\"https://offers.hubspot.com/html-hacks-for-marketers\">checking out our guide to basic HTML</a>, and using the free classes and resources on <a href=\"https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/web-development\">codecademy</a> -- but for now, let's move on to CSS.</p> \n<h3>CSS</h3> \n<p>CSS stands for Cascading Style Sheets. This programming language dictates how the HTML elements of a website should actually appear on the frontend of the page.</p> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>HTML vs CSS</h2> \n <p>HTML provides the raw tools needed to structure content on a website. CSS, on the other hand, helps to style this content so it appears to the user the way it was intended to be seen. These languages are kept separate to ensure websites are built correctly before they're reformatted.</p> \n</div> \n<p>If HTML is the drywall, CSS is the paint.</p> \n<p>Whereas HTML was the basic <a href=\"https://academy.hubspot.com/courses/website-optimization?utm_source=marketing_blog&amp;utm_medium=blog&amp;utm_campaign=website_optimization\">structure of your website</a>, CSS is what gives your entire website its style. Those slick colors, interesting fonts, and background images? All thanks to CSS. This language affects the entire mood and tone of a web page, making it an incredibly powerful tool -- and an important skill for web developers to learn. It's also what allows websites to adapt to different screen sizes and device types.</p> \n<p>To show you what CSS does to a website, look at the following two screenshots. The first screenshot is my colleague's <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/blog/tabid/6307/bid/23454/The-Ultimate-Cheat-Sheet-for-Mastering-LinkedIn.aspx\">blog post</a>, but shown in Basic HTML, and the second screenshot is that same blog post with HTML <em>and </em>CSS.</p> \n<h4>Example of HTML (with no CSS)</h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1806258563-png/Basic-HTML-1.png\" alt=\"Example of HTML with no CSS resulting in an unformatted HubSpot blog post\"></p> \n<p>Notice all the content is still there, but the visual styling isn't. This is what you might see if the style sheet doesn't load on the website, for whatever reason. Now, here's what the same web page looks like with CSS added.</p> \n<h4>Example of HTML + CSS</h4> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><strong><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1806981694-png/CSS-1.png\" alt=\"Example of HTML + CSS used to format a HubSpot blog post\"></strong></p> \n<p>Isn't that prettier?</p> \n<p>Put simply, CSS is a list of rules that can assign different properties to HTML tags, either specified to single tags, multiple tags, an entire document, or multiple documents. It exists because, as design elements like fonts and colors were developed, web designers had a lot of trouble adapting HTML to these new features.</p> \n<p>You see, HTML, developed back in 1990, was not really intended to show any physical formatting information. It was originally meant only to define a document's structural content, like headers versus paragraphs. HTML outgrew these new design features, and CSS was invented and released in 1996: All formatting could be removed from HTML documents and stored in separate CSS (.css) files.</p> \n<p>So, what exactly does CSS stand for? It stands for Cascading Style Sheets -- and \"style sheet\" refers to the document itself. Ever web browser has a default style sheet, so every web page out there is affected by at least one style sheet -- the default style sheet of whatever browser the web page visitor is using -- regardless whether or not the web designer applies any styles. For example, my browser's default font style is Times New Roman, size 12, so if I visited a web page where the designer didn't apply a style sheet of their own, I would see the web page in Times New Roman, size 12.</p> \n<p>Obviously, the vast majority of web pages I visit don't use Times New Roman, size 12 -- that's because the web designers behind those pages started out with a default style sheet that had a default font style, and then they overrode my browser's defaults with custom CSS. That's where the word \"cascading\" comes into play. Think about a waterfall -- as water cascades down the fall, it hits all the rocks on the way down, but only the rocks at the bottom affect where it will end up flowing. In the same way, the last defined style sheet informs my browser which instructions have precedence.</p> \n<p>To learn the specifics of coding in CSS, I'll point you again to the free classes and resources on <a href=\"https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/subject/web-development\">codecademy</a>. But for now, let's talk a bit about JavaScript.</p> \n<h3>JavaScript</h3> \n<p>JavaScript is a more complicated language than HTML or CSS, and it wasn't released in beta form until 1995. Nowadays, JavaScript is supported by all modern web browsers and is used on almost every site on the web for more powerful and complex functionality.</p> \n<div class=\"hsg-featured-snippet\"> \n <h2>What is JavaScript used for?</h2> \n <p>JavaScript is a logic-based programming language that can be used to modify website content and make it behave in different ways in response to a user's actions. Common uses for JavaScript include confirmation boxes, calls-to-action, and adding new identities to existing information.</p> \n</div> \n<p>In short, JavaScript is a programming language that lets web developers design interactive sites. Most of the dynamic behavior you'll see on a web page is thanks to JavaScript, which augments a browser's default controls and behaviors.</p> \n<h4>Creating Confirmation Boxes</h4> \n<p>One example of JavaScript in action is boxes that pop up on your screen. Think about the last time you entered your information into an online form and a confirmation box popped up, asking you to press \"OK\" or \"Cancel\" to proceed. That was made possible because of JavaScript -- in the code, you'd find an \"if ... else ...\" statement that tells the computer to do one thing if the user clicks \"OK,\" and a different thing if the user clicks \"Cancel.\"</p> \n<h4>Triggering Slide-In CTAs</h4> \n<p>Another example of JavaScript in action is a <a href=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/how-to-add-a-slide-in-call-to-action-to-your-blog-posts\">slide-in call-to-action (CTA)</a>, like the ones we put on our blog posts, which appears on the bottom right-hand side of your screen when you scroll past the end of the sidebar. Here's what it looks like:</p> \n<p style=\"text-align: center;\"><img class=\"alignCenter shadow\" src=\"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1807844259-gif/JavaScript-SlideIn.gif\" alt=\"Slide-in CTA using JavaScript to appear in a HubSpot blog post\"></p> \n<h4>Storing New Information</h4> \n<p>JavaScript is particularly useful for assigning new identities to existing website elements, according to the decisions the user makes while visiting the page. For example, let's say you're building a landing page with a form you'd like to generates leads from by capturing information about a website visitor. You might have a \"string\" of JavaScript dedicated to the user's first name. That string might look something like this:</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-family: 'courier new', courier;\">function updateFirstname() {</span></p> \n<p style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><span style=\"font-family: 'courier new', courier;\">let Firstname = prompt('First Name'); </span></p> \n<p><span style=\"font-family: 'courier new', courier;\">}</span></p> \n<p>Then, after the website visitor enters his or her first name -- and any other information you require on the landing page -- and submits the form, this action updates the identity of the initially undefined \"Firstname\" element in your code. Here's how you might thank your website visitor by name in JavaScript:</p> \n<p><span style=\"font-family: 'courier new', courier;\">para.textContent = 'Thanks, ' + Firstname + \"! You can now download your ebook.\"</span></p> \n<p>In the string of JavaScript above, the \"Firstname\" element has been assigned the first name of the website visitor, and will therefore produce his or her actual first name on the frontend of the webpage. To a user named Kevin, the sentence would look like this:</p> \n<p><em>Thanks, Kevin! You can now download your ebook.</em></p> \n<h4><i>Security, Games, and Special Effects</i></h4> \n<p>Other uses for JavaScript include security password creation, check forms, interactive games, animations, and special effects. It's also used to build mobile apps and create server-based applications. You can add JavaScript to an HTML document by adding these \"scripts,\" or snippets of JavaScript code, into your document's header or body.</p> \n<p>If you want to learn more about JavaScript, <a href=\"https://www.codecademy.com/catalog/language/javascript\">codecademy has free online courses</a> you can take, too.</p> \n<p>The hardest part of coding is getting started -- but once you learn the basics, it'll be easier to learn more advanced programming languages. And if you ever feel overwhelmed, head over to <a style=\"font-size: inherit;\" href=\"http://hackertyper.net/\">hackertyper.net</a> and hit random keys on your keyboard.</p> \n<p>Trust me, you'll feel better.</p> \n<p><em>Editor's note: This post was originally published in November 2018 and has been updated for comprehensiveness.</em></p> \n<div></div> \n<div>\n <a class=\"close\">&nbsp;</a>\n</div>  \n<img src=\"https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&amp;k=14&amp;r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fweb-design-html-css-javascript&amp;bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&amp;bvt=rss\" alt=\"\" width=\"1\" height=\"1\" style=\"min-height:1px!important;width:1px!important;border-width:0!important;margin-top:0!important;margin-bottom:0!important;margin-right:0!important;margin-left:0!important;padding-top:0!important;padding-bottom:0!important;padding-right:0!important;padding-left:0!important; \">","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 19 Oct 2020 11:00:00 +0000","feedId":54,"bgimg":"","linkMd5":"0efe9dbf2e54fc9192974fb56c703fe3","bgimgJsdelivr":"","metaImg":"","author":"lkolowich@hubspot.com (Lindsay Kolowich Cox)","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1765453003-jpg/magazine-page-example.jpg?width=475&name=magazine-page-example.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn93@2020_1/2020/10/27/16-54-14-421_53ba401238891ba7.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1806258563-png/Basic-HTML-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn71@2020_4/2020/10/27/16-53-51-135_e79b547a38a60c58.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1806981694-png/CSS-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn56@2020_2/2020/10/27/16-54-09-208_799365adad238ae7.webp","https://blog.hubspot.com/hs-fs/hub/53/file-1807844259-gif/JavaScript-SlideIn.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn7@2020_5/2020/10/27/16-54-05-429_ae18297adf687468.webp","https://track.hubspot.com/__ptq.gif?a=53&k=14&r=https%3A%2F%2Fblog.hubspot.com%2Fmarketing%2Fweb-design-html-css-javascript&bu=https%253A%252F%252Fblog.hubspot.com%252Fmarketing&bvt=rss":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn66@2020_3/2020/10/27/16-54-05-712_28a2ab21df9bcfc4.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1603817624912},{"createdTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","updatedTime":"2020-10-28 00:53:44","title":"15 Excel Formulas, Keyboard Shortcuts & Tricks That'll Save You Lots of Time","link":"https://blog.hubspot.com/marketing/excel-formulas-keyboard-shortcuts","description":"<p>For most marketers, trying to organize and analyze spreadsheets in Microsoft Excel can feel like walking into a brick wall over and over again. You're manually replicating columns and scribbling down long-form math on a scrap of paper, all while thinking to yourself, \"There <em>has</em> to be a better way to do this.\"</p> \n<p>Truth be told, there is -- you just don't know it yet.</p> \n<p>Excel can be tricky that way. On the one hand, it's an exceptionally powerful tool for reporting and analyzing marketing data. On the other, without the proper training, it's easy to feel like it's working against you. For starters, there are more than a dozen critical formulas Excel can automatically run for you so you're not combing through hundreds of cells with a calculator on your desk.</p> \n<h2>What are Excel Formulas?</h2> \n<p>Excel formulas help you identify relationships between values in the cells of your spreadsheet, perform mathematical calculations using those values, and return the resulting value&nbsp;in the cell of your choice.
